description:
This place was right next to where I had lunch. We stopped by after to grab a cream puff. 

I'd never heard of a place that specializes in cream puffs so this was an exciting day for me. 

You choose what kind of puff and cream you want inside. My two coworkers got the original with vanilla filling. I had the eclair puff with hazelnut cream. Once I saw it, I was worried the cream would be more like frosting but it did have the creamy, custard texture. It was delicious. I ate mine super fast and tried my coworker's. 

I wish they had been a bit fresher but overall very tasty and price was reasonable for the size. Would go back.
author: Ashtar B.

description:
Delicious and HUGE cream puffs in the city. I opted for the eclair with vanilla ice cream filling. The ice cream filling is an additional $.75  and vanilla seems to be the only ice cream option. The cream puff was nice and flaky but was sturdy enough to hold the ice cream. The thin layer of chocolate was a nice twist to their original.

This location is right near the Metreon & Westfield so it's pretty central. The location is fairly small so service can get slow during peak hours.
author: Keizzel C.

description:
I'm a huge Beard Papas fan. I was so sad when the Beard Papas in midtown closed down. When I walked by this Beard Papas on my way to the Moscone Convention Center, I was so happy! It's literally right next door to the Marriott Marquis!

I came in on a Thursday afternoon around 5pm and had one of their original cream puffs. It was just as good as I remembered it being! The prices are a bit more than I remember, but they are really good cream puffs.

Service was quick and friendly.
author: Michelle T.

description: You choose your filling for your puff and the topping. I had the vanilla filling with chocolate icing. The puff was fresh and crispy, and the vanilla filling was nice and cold. This is a perfect dessert.
author: Ha D.

description:
My go-to place for when I need a sweet fix in the area. A crispy pastry shell filled with custard cream? Oh hell yes. Choose the puff that you want--plain or dipped in chocolate(eclair) and filling flavor. Matcha and vanilla bean are the best flavaflavs. Not to sweet, cool and flavorful. My fave combo is a chocolate dipped puff with matcha filling. Bomb AF!

I've tried their Paris Brest (donut shaped pastry w/choice of filling), their Tiramisu pastry stick and they were just as tasty AF. The 'fondant' cakes on the other hand are a pass. I tried the green tea one and it tasted like an uncooked cake with runny matcha filling inside. Not a fan...

Overall, beard papa knows what's up in the cream puff dept. They're a little bit pricey ($3+ for 1?) but I say it's worth it...for SF lol. Service is whatever tho (don't expect exceptional service); tell them what you want, pay and wait off to the side for the goods. I'll keep coming back!
author: Vicky L.

description:
"Do you want to go to Bearded Papa?" asked the bf. "It's Beard Papa," said I. "Beard Papa" is grammatically incorrect," said he. "It's an Asian transplant," said I. We then proceeded to go over this conversation with the newly opened Bake Cheese Tart (yup, it's not Baked Cheese Tart), but I digress....

In my mind's eye, Beard Papa's has always been an upscale sort of treat. Maybe it's specific to this particular store, but I left feeling like the spot had been knocked down a rung. The paint on the counters and walls was chipped in a number of places, the trash bins were overflowing, and the tables and chairs looked quite worn and cheap (not to mention dirty). We got a matcha cream puff (although they're marketed as eclairs now) with matcha filling. 

Perhaps it's because the shell wasn't fresh out of the oven, but it was very...normal. The green tea (plus white chocolate) shell on top didn't particularly add any green tea flavor. The filling was surprisingly somewhat strong on the green tea flavor. Compared to last week's adventures in transplanted Asian dessert-land, this was certainly a larger dessert and lasted more bites. Cream was not too sweet and definitely light. In terms of would I come back though? Hard to see myself doing that anytime soon, when a box of those Costco mini cream puffs (omg I love those things) would suffice.
author: Nicole H.

description: The LARGEST and yummiest cream puffs I've had in the city - so delicious. My go to is the eclair with vanilla inside. My mouth gets watery even thinking about them. AHHH!
author: Inci A.

description: Have had beard papas many times and it hasn't disappointed me ever. We get this for our coworkers' birthdays and is a team favorite. I'm also left craving for more. Surprisingly, all the flavors I've tried have been so good that I would be willing to have any of them again. So I think you could shoot in the dark to pick a flavor and you won't go wrong!
author: Akshat G.

description:
Eh... 

I have been craving Beard Papa's recently and I was looking forward to getting their cream puffs, but sadly it wasn't as good as I remembered them.

The boyfriend and I was able to make it 10 minutes before closing. The staff was nice about it in the sense that they didn't seem to be annoyed with us.

We ordered one Chocolate and Matcha with Matcha filling for both, and overall it was okay. The Matcha filling was tasty, but the puff itself wasn't fresh. However, that is understandable since it was almost closing time.

My boyfriend enjoyed the Chocolate with the Matcha filling, but for me it was too sweet. I definitely preferred the double Matcha, but both cream puffs in general were mediocre and not worth the $7 bucks.

Overall, my Beard Papa's craving was not satisfied. I guess I had higher expectations for the cream puffs, especially since so many photos have been floating around on IG recently. But don't get me wrong, I'm not writing them off! I am interested in returning at some point in the future and giving their other pastries a try!
author: Julia L.

description: Ambiance is very bright and inviting. Creme puffs were very lite and fluffy. I wish it were more flavorful and the puff was a bit more dense but others than that I would say it was a good experience. 3 1/2 stars for me
author: Deeley K.

description: The first time I tried Beard Papa's was in Honolulu. I'm so happy to find these store fronts while visiting SF. The cream puffs originated in Osaka, Japan. It's like biting into a cloud of deliciousness. The cream is so airy that you hardly feel bad eating it. I also like that it's not too sweet either. I had the matcha flavored original cream puff. You really get the matcha flavor. Perfect dessert or snack!
author: Vivian C.

description: So as much as I wanted to get the six pack to try all the flavors and combinations, I couldn't. I actually never been to a Beard Papas and I'll be honest the logo caught me. Walking in and it smells really good. I wanted to get a "small" bite before going to SFMOMA. So we got the cream puff with green tea filling and keep in mind it's gonna get messy. Like we're talking biting into a hot pocket messy, so take plenty of napkins. It was sweet, but not too sweet which is what I prefer. I really wanna go back and try the cookies and cream filling though. I'll be back for you
author: Alex L.

description: I'm so disappointed because I wanted to like this place, SO BADLY. I'm a huge cream puff fan and have never seen a place specialize in them, so suffice to say I was excited. I got a vanilla with vanilla center, eclair with vanilla center, and a honey almond I think with a vanilla center. First off, they're HUGE, so definitely reasonably priced. I wasn't upset about paying $10 for 3...until I tried them. The shell taste great, and the cream inside had a nice texture, but the taste of the cream inside was sorely lacking. It was so bland and disappointing. I honestly would not go back here. Sorry, Beard Papa's! I wanted to love you, I really did.
author: Kayt C.

description:
I don't get it - $3.50 for a cream puff that doesn't taste like much. I ordered an original as I'd never been before. I bit into the freshly filled dessert and ended up with the expected filling on my face. My mouth was confused, what did I just place inside it? My taste buds started to work overtime, trying to locate the special flavor that would make this a supposed tasty treat into a big business. Nothing. Boring. 
I tried a second bite. Same result. I put the puff back into the bag and went on my way. About an hour later I thought, now, now is when it will taste yummy. Repeat original process = original result. 

If I used emojis this is where I'd insert a sad face.  Me thinks the Beard Papa's success is something along the lines of the Emperor's New Clothes and I'm the child crying foul. 

My advise, don't bother.
author: Evelyn S.

description:
Double Matcha, Chocolate and Vanilla, Double Chocolate, Butter Honey Vanilla, Butter Honey Matcha, or Butter Honey Chocolate. So many options in puff and filling! 

Here's the breakdown of this cream puff goodness: 

Puff choices: 
1) Original
2) Chocolate glazed
3) Honey butter glazed
4) Matcha glazed

Cream filling: 
1) Vanilla
2) Chocolate
3) Matcha

You can fill your cream heart with whatever combination of the above! 
They also have some other Japanese crafted pastries such as Japanese cheesecake to choose from. 

I purchased a box of 9 the day before Thanksgiving to bring over to a party (knowing that everything would be closed on Thanksgiving day) and kept it in the fridge overnight. Although the exterior of the puff wasn't freshly crisp the next day, it wasn't wasn't soggy either! A day in the fridge and the puffs retained their shape, flavor and almost entirety of its texture. 

I was told the Beard Papas in the USA are made in a peanut free factory and this is different than the Beard Papas in Asia where this isn't the case. Don't quote me on that, but if true, this is exciting for my peanut allergy yelpers!

Eat here!
author: Janice K.

description: I ordered the matcha creampuff with the regular vanilla filling. The cream puff itself didn't taste as fresh as I had imagined it to be, but the matcha chocolate shell layer definitely added something new to the Beard Papa's cream puff I get in Vancouver. Overall, a quick and tasty dessert to grab on the go, but I wouldn't expect anything extraordinary.
author: Charmaine L.

description: Bear Papas was lovely. Cream puffs....AMAZING There's is so many combinations and it was hard for me to choose. I got the strawberry eclair filled with ice cream and it was everything I'd hope it to be. Definitely would return again!
author: Michelle L.

description: This was a first...yummy but not on my radar to revisit. They were offering i need recipe which looked good but i passed...not a fan of ice cream mixed in.
author: S W.

description: My bf and I have tried Beard Papa's about 4 times in total. First time at this location, one time in Milpitas, one time in Vietnam, and today. We came here because we were hanging out in SF and we're craving the cream filled yummyness that we remembered from summer '16. I remember back then they had other filling flavors like cookies and cream but this time they have matcha instead. I was excited to try the matcha filling. So I got the Honey and Butter puff with matcha inside. My bf got the Chocolate (eclair) puff with caramel inside. I got my sister a Matcha (eclair) puff with vanilla ice cream filling (extra $.75 for ice cream filling). We all agreed that it only tasted alright - not flavorful. Honestly there wasn't much flavor to the fillings at all. They also didn't really fill the puffs up so half of it was empty. I remember last time we were here the fillings were oozing out of the puffs. My sister said she couldn't taste the matcha on the outside of the puffs. All this for $11.25. Pretty pricy tbh. We were pretty disappointed and probably wouldn't come back.
author: Trang T.

description:
Recommendation: Great niche dessert place. Menu layout was a little confusing. Maybe a little on the pricey side for what you are getting. 

Beard Papa is a little shop right outside the Metreon building that specializes in creme-filled pastries. Mostly known for their cream puffs, they also serve eclairs and different, crunchy varieties. You can typically order from a few different flavors of pastry, and then you also get to choose the cream on the inside from the typical flavors (chocolate, vanilla) and the flavor of the month (March was cookies and cream, a grey speckled goo). 

The pastries themselves are quite good, but considering they are $3 a piece or so it's not the most cost-efficient way to gain a sugar rush. That being said, the creme is delicious as always and the pastries are filled on the spot, so they are always a perfect texture. 

There are only a couple tables inside and outside so if there isn't much space, I'd suggest going across Mission Street to the Yerba Buena Garden area or into the Metreon building to sit around in the expansive first floor seating area. 

All in all, I'd say it is worth it to try Beard Papa's at least once, and maybe bring friends here to marvel in the wonder of instant cream puffs!
author: John B.

description:
I love this place for it's cream puffs! Best cream puffs I have ever had! This last time I went I got the eclair puff and my friend got a cream filled with green tea. We also got a chocolate fondant as well. They were all amazing. 
Next time I come, I am going to get the eclair puff with green tea filling. Must try!
author: Sonia A.

description:
I brought my friend here for a snack break during our time at a conference. Although I was bummed that they didn't have green tea that day, we tried the caramel and it was better than expected. The caramel filling wasn't super sweet and even had a slight tartness to it. As a Beard Papa first timer, my friend said it was really good; she even ordered one of each cream puff to take home. 

Customer service could be better.
author: Tammy P.

description:
I definitely looked like a bearded papa after eating three of these cream puffs...that wasn't necessarily the goal, but I was feeling ravenous and when that hunger hits, I just dig right into my food, mindless of the mess I will make.  I had actually bought these cream puffs and brought them back to my hotel so as to enjoy breakfast in bed...I thought it'd be all luxurious, but I ended up just making a big flaky, creamy mess for the hotel maids to clean up later.

These cream puffs are delicate little things - the cream will ooze out the minute you bite into it so be prepared to lick all the cream off before it falls to the floor.  Let's play a little game of, 'Don't drop the cream!'.  These things are not only delicate, but also fairly small.  They aren't so small in that it's not worth buying them; I would actually say that for their size, they are filled with cream!  What's great about this place is that you can actually choose which filling you want.  I had come on a day where there was a bunch of construction outside and I guess they were preparing to close down temporarily because of it so there were limited flavors available.  They only had the vanilla and chocolate fillings available; and as for the glazed puff itself: only strawberry, green tea, chocolate and vanilla were available.  I was so looking forward to trying all these other flavors, but that wasn't in the cards for me that day.

There was a selection of cream puffs already to go, but then you had the option of picking and choosing your puff and your cream.  For each cream puff, either created by yourself or pre-prepared, it was about $3-4, so I ended up walking away having spent about $12 on cream puffs.  I didn't blink too much of an eye at this because I do love cream puffs...in fact, these cream puffs made for a breakfast of champions.  They didn't hold me over for long and their sugary base probably wasn't good for my diet, but they tasted pretty good in the moment.
author: Lauren K.

description:
I might just not be a cream puff person - I've known about Beard Papa's for a loooooong time since my family is from HI. 10 years later, I finally decided to try it - but as things usually are 10 years down the road, it wasn't as good as I imagined in my head.

Don't get me wrong, the cream puffs were good - we had a strawberry glazed one and a matcha glazed one, both with vanilla cream. They had a good balance of sweetness (not terribly sweet), and found their size a little amusing. They're HUGE compared to the ones I've had elsewhere.

That said, maybe I'm just not a cream puff person. I'd much rather eat a good brownie, cookie, or even slice of cake. I didn't care for the cream puffs at Odette in Paris (which is supposed to be known for their cream puffs) either. So I'd say - if you're the kind of person that likes cream puffs, it's worth a try! I haven't seen anything like it.
author: Larissa M.

description: I don't even like cream puffs but these cream puffs are  amazing! The original creampuffs are always a win and a crown favorite
author: Lena T.

description: Basic eclers with a twist imof different flavors on top. The best are mini eclers, 6 for $7 and any extra after that its just $1. It is very light and not too sweet
author: Laura k.

description:
Love love their cream puffs!! 
They are so good & yum  

My personal favorite is the chocolate filling!!
author: Deebs M.

description: My daughter picked the strawberry crusted puff and they filled with vanilla. It was delicious. We're definitely going back to get more puffs.
author: Ashi C.

description: Cream puffs Japanese style!  I was looking for something consumable as a house gift visiting relatives in the Suburbs and this fit the bill. I walked over from the Intercontinental hotel, about 4 blocks, and picked up an assorted dozen plus 2 for me.  I sat in the Yerba Loma park across the street enjoying the cream puffs. Don't forget to get several napkins as they are messy! My 14 cost about $50, so not inexpensive but well received at the house where they quickly vanished.
author: Bonnie W.

description: Yummy cream puff. I tried the original with vanilla cream. A bit on the pricier side.
author: Diana N.

description: Service is poor but the cream puffs are so good you deal with it. I got almond, green tea, chocolate, and creme brulée. They were all for myself lol. They fill the puffs for you on the spot, according to your cream flavor selection (vanilla, caramel, green tea). They also do ice cream filling for an extra charge. Don't go right before closing, they won't let you in.
author: Liz H.

description:
This place was recommended by a friend who said we should get 6 to share.  Uh...these are big ass cream puffs and one per person is sufficient!

This location had the original, crunch  and the chocolate cream puff.  You then choose a filling and have the option to choose between vanilla, caramel and chocolate.  These are enormous cream puffs and not the baby ones you see at Costco.  They run between $2.70-$3.50 per cream puff but are a delightful treat   

I had the crunch filled with vanilla and the hubby got the original filled with vanilla and a cheesecake stick on the side.  The cream puffs are soft enough and filled with a delicious cream with flecks of vanilla bean.   Try it next time you're in the area.
author: Tammie W.

description: Love the original with vanilla filling! I've brought them to work twice and everyone loves them. Highly recommend!
author: Ana M.

description: These are even delicious at 6:59 pm seconds before they close.   The pastry Still tastes fresh and delicate and the filling light but not too sweet.
author: R. G.

description:
I love the cream puff however this review is for the service. They need to improve on customer service especially the guy who package them. Very sloppy. To get a box apparently I have been told different things each time. One visit I had to order 6 puffs to get a box, but this time I was told 4. I ordered 3 puffs and 2 cheesecakes and the guy puts them in 2 bags. I wish they would ask at the register if I would like a box for an extra one dollar. I'm not going to carry around 2 shitty little bags of puffs and cheesecakes. They barely even fit 3 puffs in one!
Anyway I ordered an extra puff to have a total of 4 puffs and 2 cheesecake for a box. The guy doesn't know how to put the cheesecakes in the box without "squishing" them. 
Lol I fixed it for him but the cheesecakes were kind of messed up from him touching them :/ totally not presentable as a gift.
author: Grace Z.

description: Went back and had the creme brûlée cream puff and the original cream with vanilla filling, also a cheesecake.I'm glad we went back to give it another try. We enjoyed every one of them
author: Reis L.

description:
Prompt friendly service. Dropped in on a Saturday afternoon before brunch to pick up some cream puffs and these did not disappoint!

I ordered at the counter, mixing and matching fillings and glazes (vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the month: freen tea), and they were ready to go after just a few minutes. 

The store was empty so I actually initially thought it was closed. Its location can be easy to miss if you're not looking for it. Definitely a grab and go type of place.
author: Rosa Y.

description:
Holy smokes. This is a little piece of heaven in earth. The cream puffs are the size of your fist they come with chocolate or vanilla filling. Enjoy plain, chocolate, vanilla, green tea toppings. They have a cup of minis too. 
The crust is crunchy despite the fact that it is filled with cream. I will definitely be coming back.
author: Misty W.

description:
This scrumptious bakery is right across from Yerba Buena/Metreon and bascially next to the Comtemporary Jewish Museum. 

Their menu is small, but it's enough: mostly, it's different flavors of amazing cream puffs. We had the regular and the green tea ones.

Beard Papa is definitely not vegan, but I guess it's accidentally vegetarian. Regardless, it's a treat!
author: Veg V.

description: When I try to utter my last words on my death bed, I want someone to shove one of these cream puffs in my mouth so it's the last thing I ever taste.
author: Russ S.

description: Cream puffs are delicious! The staff are super friendly and helpful. Very chill atmosphere as I charged my phone and I ate a cream puff.
author: R F.

description: The goodies here are solid 5-star quality. Everything I have ever tried from cream puffs, eclairs, cheesecake sticks to chocolate lava cakes are delicious. Customer service however is non existent. Me and my coworkers were served by this extremely rude lady who was a BITCH. She was very unfriendly, didn't want to answer questions, no thank you. She basically acted like we were a nuisance by making our purchases. She completely ruined our experience. I will take my business elsewhere if I see her again. There's another Beard Papa close by inside Westfield Mall.
author: Nerdy P.

description:
Beard Papa specializes in cream puffs of course, and this store on Yerba Buena Ln is quite a bit larger than the food stand in SF Westfield.  By default they offer six or so different flavors but when you show up near closing like we did for a post-movie snack they only have limited selections.

We got a vanilla and coffee-flavored cream puff.  Good-sized puff pastry filled with goodness.  Its very messy to eat!  You're biting into cream or pastry - definitely no room for air inside these puffs.  The French Roast coffee they offer was bold and smooth - closer to a Strong Americano.  Great for washing things down!
author: Daniel C.

description:
I, for one, have never had fresh cream puffs.. but these ones got me HOOKED.
At first the prices on the puffs seem a bit steep, but that's also partially because I was expecting small pastries... what I got on the other hand were behemoth cream puffs that are filled right up with either chocolate or vanilla filling right in front of you!
We got regular, chocolate, and eclair puffs, all with vanilla filling. Made fresh daily, these puffs were quite big, but what I liked was that they were not overly sweet or overpowering. They were an almost refreshing and filling pastry that are definitely best when freshly filled with cream. Excellent visit!
author: Thuan T.

description: This is the original location for beard papa's. It is not as busy as the one in Westfield, which is good because we actually have a place to sit down. Their daily flavors are vanilla and chocolate, but they have weekly flavors as well. They are Caramel, coffee, mango, green tea, strawberry, and pumpkin. We always miss it when they have green tea and strawberry, but our to go filling is vanilla. They are crunchy and soft. Just make sure you eat it in the wrapping because eating the cream puff can get messy.
author: Michelle C.

description: Great place to stop for snacking after museum hopping. Small place. Two tables and a bench. The cream puffs are filled cream or other flavors like chocolate, mango, etc. The dough is crunchy. Not ultra sweet. Japan style. Located by the Catholic Church and the Jewish museum. Cost: $3.00-3.50.
author: Sandie S.

description:
Nice place. Right across the metreon.
This place has some seating if you want to dine in.
Menu is big and easy to read.
No one else was inside when I came in so I ordered right away.
I got an original cream puff and two matcha green tea cream puff. About $8 for 3 cream puffs which ok priced.

It was neat that the lady made the cream puff right in front of you. Got my order in about 5 mins or less.

They have a bathroom but it's out of order.

Cream puff was decently sized. Filling/cream was a little bit bland for the matcha one. It was not too sweet which was good. The sweetness was very subtle. Overall it was a ok and a bit better but not the best.

Friendly customer service!
author: Michele G.

description:
Conveniently located across the street from the picturesque Yerba Buena Gardens. If you don't feel like sitting in one of the indoor or outdoor tables, just walk across to the Esplanade to enjoy your pastry.

The puffs were soft even at the end of the day. I noticed they made a fresh batch but neglected to ask for those puffs and had no regrets.

Fillings were limited so we only tried the original and Belgian chocolate puffs. I'm normally a chocolate fan, but I thought the original cream tasted better.

They do accept credit cards.

Would I return? Maybe if I'm in the area, I still want to try the matcha puff.
author: Sue V.

description:
Every time I take a bite of the choux cream filled pastry puffs I go into sweet heaven! The regular vanilla bean cream puffs remind me of my childhood when my mom used to bring home a box filled with these wonderful golden crispy balls. Each bite I take make me go into orgasmic heaven. I hope my wife doesn't read this because she might just get a bit jealous of these cream puffs for a share of my love.

Seriously, stick with the original vanilla cream puffs. They're the best. Although they're best right away, I've eaten them a day later and the hard baked exterior actually keeps its crunch. I'll admit, I've eaten a whole half dozen by myself over 2 days...and I probably got diabetes doing it, but hey, it's worth it.

Get some!
author: Sam L.

description: Yum! I stopped by with a couple friends and shared a green tea puff with the honey butter topping (we really just wanted a taste, and these things are HUGE, so that worked out great!) - and it was very yummy! The pastry shell was quite hard, which I found odd, but it still tasted good. Overall: would definitely go back!
author: Liz F.

description:
This was my second time at Beard Papa's-- just stumbled onto it at the shopping mall and then came to this location.

I'm not a huge pastry or donut fan, so you generally won't find me buying much sweets in this category.  But I have to say that if I'm going to go for it, I'm going to go big!  This is absolutely the best cream puff I've ever had in my life!  The texture of the baked dough is perfectly flaky on the outside and soft on the inside.  The filling is rich and creamy but not too heavy or sweet.  One cream puff is just the right amount to leave you satiated! 

I wish I had a Beard Papa near me!
author: Christine S.

description:
Generally don't crave cream puffs but if I do I'd probably pick Beard Papa's... Actually I don't even know any other place that specializes in just cream puffs?

I remember when I was younger I used to love going to BP whenever I made my way into DTSF.. Now fast forward, working in DTSF, it's still pretty much the same for me.

Ordered half a dozen of cream puffs for me and my 4 coworkers.  I ended up eating 2 in 1 sitting, what the hell.  I was trying to have some self control & only eat 1 but damn, might as well eat 2 since it's already staring at me in the face.

HAHA anyways despite being a fatass, BP is really good for a cream puff. The shell is good and the cream texture is smooth and light.  BP keeps things interesting by having daily special flavors depending on when you go.  They always have the defaulted chocolate and vanilla flavors though.  One day I'm gunna stump in when they have green tea and I'll have a very happy soul. 

Oh also, the puffs are made to order! So the puff is not creamed til you order ;)
author: Tiffany Z.

description: I frequented Beard Papa's in New York and puff at this location was not how I remembered it. Although the cream filling tasted Ok, the shell was a little too hard. The topping was also a bit sugary. I thought they followed the same recipe so where did the differences come from?
author: Dex Y.

description:
These cream puffs are made fresh daily but still are not up to par. This sounds really rude but honestly I think I've had better at Whole Foods. I hate comparing businesses but I don't mess around when it comes to dessert! 

I admit, I ordered an eclair but let me tell you... It tasted exactly like a cream puff. They are definitely not suppose to taste the same. The cream filling was too fluffy and not dense enough. The only difference between the two are that the "eclair" had chocolate on its shell. 

They are in a great location that is a prime touristy spot. Maybe that's all that's going for them? I did see cheesecake sticks but honestly after a subpar eclair I couldn't bring myself to continue. 

Dessert is my favorite type of indulgence. I don't mess around when it comes to that portion of the menu. I was really disappointed in the turnout. I thought I might have been too harsh so I had two friends also taste it. They reassured me that I'm not a psycho eclair critic and that it was a less than average eating experience.
author: Breanna P.

description:
5 stars for the the matcha puff with vanilla filling, it was so delicious. The chocolate was kind of boring and I wouldn't get that again. 

0 stars for the place: Kinda a run down spot. Was kind of grossed out that the girl handling our food was wearing one glove but touching everything with it and handling our food with her ungloved hand especially since if you read their health code violations it says they don't have proper hand washing systems in place. Get it together beard papa employees, don't be gross.
author: Emma M.

description: The creamy puffs tasted great ! It had a thick pastry and nice creamy filling that gave a good balance of taste. It was right amount of sweet. I tried the chocolate creamy puff and their April spl - cappuccino and coffee jelly. This was first time I tasted coffee jelly. Interesting !
author: Tejashree M.

description: I visited this place on an evening to try out eclairs as a friend of mine raved about them. I ordered a chocolate eclair with vanilla filling but was disappointed. The eclair had a very hard outer layer. I would have preferred a cake like texture instead. Also, it did not seem very fresh and the cream filling was okayish.
author: Aanchal G.

description:
Love love LOVE their cream puffs here! I usually go to the Westfield location but happened to walk by this one during my lunch break yesterday. You can find a cheap sweet fix here for less than $5 a portion. I always stick with the original cream puff with some sort of fruity filling (I love their strawberry and mango flavors a lot! They are usually offered as the flavor of the day) since I'm not a huge fan of the vanilla or chocolate. Sometimes they have green tea if you're lucky! If anyone else happens to know other unique flavors, please send them my way!

One original cream puff is 2.90, and you can get a chocolate covered one for about 50 cents more if you're feeling extra sweet. Portion sizes here are decent and just the right amount of filling. They offer eclairs and vanilla slices here if you want something different, but trying their cream puffs here are a must at least once!
author: Kathleen S.

description: I've never had Beard Papa's cream puffs before and I didn't want anything heavy since we had an amazing brunch at Kitchen Story.  This hit the spot. I got the chocolate with vanilla inside and a black coffee. Others in our group got the crispy caramel, the green tea and the vanilla/vanilla. It was yummy and huge! Will get it again for sure!
author: Milee S.

description:
Came here yesterday around 4pm with my friend. When we walked in we weren't greeted and the cashier didn't seem like he was too thrilled to be working.

My friend ordered the regular cream puff with vanilla filling while I ordered the cookie cream puff with pumpkin filling. 

I kindly asked for two plates and the worker just quickly handed them to me without giving any eye contact or saying a word.

The cream puffs were decent. Nothing too special and not really worth the price. I liked how the filling was only lightly sweet; however, the taste was mediocre. It was really messy to eat and it would have been better if the cream puffs were warm when served to us.

Overall, 2/5. Service was fast; however, the workers were not friendly. The cream puffs were overpriced and nothing special. Will I be coming back? Probably not, but we'll see.
author: Pariya N.

description: Absolutely the best coffee and cream puffs in San Francisco. If you close your eyes you'll hear people speaking French.
author: Mark S.

description:
If your wallet isn't very deep like mine, then that price tag on the cream puffs might seem pretty intimidating. Let me assure you though that even though your wallet may feel emptier, your soul will be filled with happiness (and sugar too!). Having tried the vanilla before, I decided to try the green tea weekly special and it was amazing. I am always hesitant at trying matcha in new places because it's always a hit or miss, but I'm glad I took the risk this time. The cream filling wasn't too sweet, and it hit the spot after traveling around downtown. The line for ordering was short, and I received my cream puff seconds after I paid for it, which was great!

Would I come back again? I mean my wallet and maybe my pancreas my hate me, but hey at least my soul is satisfied.
author: Golden H.

description: I honestly didn't like the cream puffs. I guess I just expected something softer and with a white cream filling- not the custard. I can't rate it lower because I got what I ordered and the people were very nice.
author: D Andrew P.

description:
I am no cream puff connoisseur, but for the price ($3-4 per puff) and all the raving reviews- I was slightly disappointed. I also was not too fond of the customer service. It was our first time there, there were no other customers and no line, yet the guy seemed like he was less than enthusiastic to helping us understand how the process worked.

Overall- the puff itself was good (I tried the éclair and cookie crumble)- very nice crispness, but vanilla crème was bland... I would've much preferred whipped cream or Bavarian crème.
I am not saying I would never go back- maybe I would try a different location and a different filling, but as it stands I would've been just as happy spending half as much for store bought cream puffs/éclairs. 

Raley's/Bel-Air Market has some surprisingly delicious cream puffs. Savemart has some pre-packed (4 to a box) of New York style éclairs. I have also tasted some éclairs from some local bakeries that have been larger for same price and better filling. 

Sorry Beard Papa.
author: Feli D.

description:
CREAM PUFFS ARE SO GOOD. I've never loved a cream puff until now.

I had my first cream puff from here yesterday, and I've already gone back again today for more. The delicious pastry is stuffed full to bursting of thick gooey cream. It will sploosh on your face, and it'll be amazing. 

They have a standard pastry, and cocoa & cookie variants, which you can stuff with whatever filling you'd like. The regular fillings are vanilla and chocolate, and there's a special filling on weekly rotation. You can't go wrong with any of them.

I also had their tiramisu, but it pales in comparison to the majestic cream puff.
author: Theresa M.

description: Seeing as this was always a hot spot as I walked by, I had to try it. It smelled delicious when I walked in, that very buttery bakery smell. I ended up ordering the green tea and chocolate cream puff. I have to say I was not impressed and was very disappointed. The pastry was dry and tasteless. It seemed like it had been sitting out a while after being baked. The cream filling was close to flavorless with only hints of chocolate and green tea. I would give this place a 2 star rating, but the staff was very friendly so I give it 3 stars.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
TL;DR:

Forget macaroons, I'll be damned if cream puffs aren't the most innovative retro dessert of the decade. In fact it's actually rather difficult to make them unpleasant, and luckily Beard Papa's doesn't try to. 

***CREAM PUFF

Obviously the filling has to be inserted immediately before consumption, otherwise the flaky, soft, and yet somehow delicately crispy pastry ball becomes a soggy abomination. No problems in this department, though my pastry puff would have been superior had it come forth directly from the oven. There are a few different approaches for fillings, though pastry cream/custard wins hands-down over whipped cream or ice cream--good call, Papa. I was pleased by the decadent gooeyness that squirted forth into my mouth, yet I believe that the temperature should be slightly above freezing to maximize the efficacy of this carnal pleasure. 

A simple, unplanned delight.
author: Elliott D.

description:
I love Beard Papas! I've only tried the cream puffs but they were fantastic! Huge fan of the Vanilla Cream ones. Tried the chocolate and they just didn't taste as good.

Took them home and put them in the freezer for a little bit and the cream inside turned into almost an ice cream like consistency. Yum! Don't leave them in too long though, it isn't the same when the whole thing becomes frozen!

I pretty much came here to say, GO FOR THE VANILLA CREAM.
author: Tsyria T.

description:
I was so excited to try cream puffs for the first time after seeing all the mouthwatering pictures of the custard filled goodness. I finally got around to trying one and decided to get the plain cream puff with vanilla filling. It seems as if they had some premade already so immediately after I made my order, my puff was ready to go. 
Taste: I won't say that it was bad but there was something missing...There was definitely alot of yummy filling but I had expected it to be sweeter especially since the puff she'll was less sweet. The filling seemed..grainy? I. Not quite sure how to put it but it was definitely not mindblowingly smooth and rich. 
Service: quick, polite and straight to the point. There were no customers in to store at the time so the workers were chillin and joking with the deliveryman that had come by.
author: Connie C.

description:
I have to say.. I'm not really a cream puff kind of gal. I'd much prefer cake or a cupcake or a (chocolate) croissant or.. more cake? But even I can tell when a dessert is freshly made, and I definitely appreciate both that and the fact that the custard cream inside isn't deathly sweet.

Located just a few steps from Bluestem Brasserie, it's a short walk from the crowded Market Street and surprisingly calm. There are a few tables situated inside the store, but more scattered outside. The mechanism is assembly line: choose a kind of cream puff, choose your filling, pay, and enjoy. Service was mediocre but efficient, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Eclair cream puff with green tea custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#9I1eafhGAWlh-JbwgGEh-A)
This may seem like a strange combination, but I really wanted to try the eclair cream puff and I really wanted to try the green tea filling. Throwing convention aside, I decided to cram the two together and hope that it would work.. and it did! The chocolate on the outside was smooth and rich, which paired very well with the fragrant cream puff. The silky green tea custard inside seemed to engulf everything in a sea of matcha, and I was pleasantly surprised at how "right" the green tea tasted. 

Vanilla cream puff with vanilla custard filling:
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/beard-papas-cream-puffs-san-francisco?select=BVhsZ2Uz6NGKXS5CSnKnaA#QIj2Oz-kWXntstYnOTPfvQ)
My friend opted for tradition, and he did enjoy his cream puff as well, although he said that my green tea custard would be his first choice next time. I had a quick bite and thought that while I could still taste the freshness of the cream puff itself, it was a little one-dimensional after enjoying my eclair one. I think the added layer of chocolate or another ingredient really makes a difference. I did like that the vanilla custard was also not overly sweet, so the entire thing wasn't too heavy from start to finish.

If there were an option to have the cream puff heated up just a tad before pumping in the cool custard, I think I'd have trouble stopping myself from converting into a cream puff gal..
author: Maggie X.

description:
Treat Yo Self! 

The classic Vanilla Creme Puff is still my true Beard Papa love.

The Pumpkin one was a nice seasonal treat though as the cream reminded me of pumpkin pie filling. 

Eat your treats right away because no one likes a soggy cream puff.

AmIriiiiiight?
author: Amy C.

description: Bread papa offers cream puff that comes in a giant size(bigger than my fist) with speciality flavors --green tea, mango, pumpkin, etc. It's a cute idea and the end product is decent, but nothing amazing to me. I have to say I've had better. Perhaps it's because the coffee flavored puff I got wasn't all that different from other coffee pastries I got before; I bet their green tea would be something more unique.
author: Julia Z.

description: Very tasty cream puffs for a reasonable price! They even have a green tea glaze! We dropped by around noon and it wasn't crowded at all and there was prompt service. Would recommend!
author: Caroline C.

description: Always have to come here when visiting the bay! I keep it OG and order the vanilla cream puff it's always amazing!
author: Darlene V.

description:
This Japanese pastry chain is popular all across the world now, but they haven't really mastered the art of consistency like McDonalds or Chipotle has. As a result, the Cream Puffs that you get differ in quality from location to location. My local chain isn't that great, but this particular location was very good. Nicely done pastry, fully filled with cream, and served quickly!

It meets expectations for everything that you'd want from a chain.
author: Stanley W.

description:
Sweet dreams are made of......Beard Papa's Cream Puffs!

I've had these a number of times before when I lived in LA, but I couldn't remember the last time I had one, especially in SF!  I went for the special of the week: Strawberry.

Having a cream puff from Beard Papa is a luxury.  Having a cream puff with strawberry filling (that ACTUALLY tastes like strawberry!) is heaven.  If I could hug the cream puff, I would.  Except I'd probably squeeze the filling out since I love it that much.
author: Lisa I.

description: One of my favorite desert places, found it in LA and I'm so happy it's out here! Flavors always satisfy my tastebuds!
author: Stefania B.

description: Nom nom, I've only had Beard Papa's before in Vancouver and was very excited to see it in SF!  You pick the cream puff shell and the cream filling separately, and then they will fill the cream puff for you on the spot so it's fresh and not soggy.  This time I got the honey and butter shell with the cherry pie filling (May flavor of the month).  The individual parts tasted amazing, but the two didn't really match as a whole--no fault of theirs, just my bad flavor judgement!  The honey and butter shell is like a normal shell but with some sweet/sticky/caramelized sugar melted over it.  The taste was very reminiscent of a palmier and I bet it would have gone great with the vanilla cream.  The cherry filling was AWESOME.  If you're reading this and it's still May, go and get one now!  It wasn't overly sweet or artificial tasting, would probably go great with the plain or chocolate glazed shell.
author: Amy X.

description:
I was so excited this place was on the corner of my hotel. I was torn - had dinner in an hour but had never seen a cream puff place, so I had to sacrifice part of my delicious burger to make room for this. I was torn - the recommended vanilla puff, or the cheesecake stick? I went with the vanilla puff, which was good but had a few crunchy spots (I've made cream puffs, so I know it's not tough to have consistently soft puffs). The problem is that as you bite, if the puff doesn't cooperate - you get little puff and cream out the sides which is annoying. Their vanilla cream is solid but I wish it had just a little more vanilla-ness.

But I am pretty sure if I lived in the area, that this would be a solid contender when I needed a snack/sweet-fix. It's about the price of the designer donuts that are popular on the east coast, where I'm from. I *WISH* I had been around long enough to get a cheesecake stick. What regret!
author: Melinda K.

description:
I love cream puffs. I love how Beard Papa's is conveniently located right in the middle of Downtown. I love how they have a special flavor every day. I love how they have green tea cream puffs (I'm obsessed with anything green tea). I love fresh warm tender cream puffs. I love the rich heavy filling. I love how they melt in your mouth and for a second, you get a taste of heaven.

I don't love how the cream puffs are left out on the counter. I don't love how stale they can become.

I guess the pros outweigh the cons. I'll be coming back more often whenever I have cravings, and boy do I have a lot!
author: Vicki L.

description: Creme puffs are always welcome at a party.  So besides bringing wine, I like to bring a big box of puffs to parties, and they are a hit (so am I when I bring them.) They are fresh and have a nice variety. I usually have a large order so I call ahead (usually a couple of days before a party) and they have never let me down. There is always a variety that are ready to go so if you are heading to a smaller party, you would be fine just stopping in after work.  My current favorite is the green tea, it's not for everyone but if you like green tea and cream puffs I think you will enjoy!
author: Sam M.

description: Love, love, love! Delicious giant cream puffs!  In desperate search for a bakery with more than muffins, scones, and cookies, we stumbled upon Beard Papa's. Beard Papa's is a gourmet cream-puffery, you pick your shell (plain, chocolate dipped, strawberry dipped, matcha dipped, or honey butter crusted) and then it is filled in front of you (chocolate, vanilla, or matcha). We got chocolate dipped with vanilla filling and couldn't get enough. The cream is luscious and thick and was full of vanilla flavor. The chocolate dip was the perfect contrast to balance the vanilla cream. The first day we went, we only got two, but we had to go back and get the half dozen. Overall, the puffs were a little pricey but worth it for the size. Wonderful spot for a quick dessert!
author: Cupcake S.

description:
It has taken me a while, but these beard papa's have been on my list of things to try since moving to SF 2 years ago. So good! I've had the eclairs with strawberry and with vanilla fillings. Both were excellent. The filling (I think) is the traditional pastry cream plus whipped cream and a flavoring agent (ie strawberry or chocolate). This is more of a diplomate cream instead of a thick pastry cream, which is really nice on a warm day. It tastes almost like an ice cream. 

Will need to check out the matcha green tea flavor next!
author: William V.

description:
Super duper amazing cream puffs. If they had espresso coffee it would have been 5 stars.... That and the fact that they don't take Discover (thumb down)
The freshness can be tasted in every bite. No still cream puffs like in many other places. The eclair with vanilla (traditions) filling was my favorite. I really wanted to try the coffee and the pumpkins filling but today they only had vanilla, chocolate and strawberry. 
I would have been ok w/o the tiramisu stick (average at best)...
author: Alejandro R.

description: The cream puffs are amazing. I had one with a green tea glaze and vanilla filling. Yum!
author: Paula H.

description: I love their cream puffs. I went back here a couple months ago after craving for my childhood desserts. They're delicious and not too sugary. Customer service is really nice and I definitely recommend coming here!
author: Sandra N.

description:
I freaking LOVE cream puffs! 

I always end up buying cream puffs at around the same time so I often get the green tea eclair. Green tea cream goes great with the cookie one too! 

Just wanted to update my review to remind SFSU students to use their student discount and not let workers tell you they don't have it anymore. Integrity!
author: Sofia R.

description: Overrated tbh the cream puffs are decent but nothing amazing as other reviews lead you to believe. They're over filled and leak the cream every time. I'd honestly find a different place, there's a reason why it isn't very packed here. You can do much better in SF, I guarantee it.
author: Rohit S.

description:
Rolled over here for something sweet after having lunch. I haven't been to a Beard Papa's before but have heard all about it. 

The menu had 3 different puffs to choose from and 2 regular fillings and 1 special filling. Today's special was green tea. Since I wasn't in the mood for an entire puff Hub ordered his and I had a taste. There were a few other items on the menu that weren't puffs. 

If you haven't heard nor been here, you choose the puff and filling flavor and they stuff your puff. 

We tried the cookie crumb puff with green tea filling ($2.50). It didn't taste like much and wasn't sweet at all. Basically it had no flavor. I was glad I didn't order one for myself. The puff wasn't good and neither was the filling.

No future puffs for me. I will stay with cookies, cakes and pies.
author: Amber S.

description:
Mmmmm!!! The best pastry. Basic cream filled one is just a tasty explosion in your mouth!!! Service is not the fastest considering how easy is to fill the puffs. 

They serve also coffee so you can have a great fast breackfast
author: Gianguido G.

description: Oh man. I made the serious mistake of not getting a cream puff at Beard Papa's. I've had one before at a different location, but I just wasn't craving one this time. I decided to get the cheesecake stick instead. It was warm (as perhaps expected) but tasted like it had been sitting out for awhile. Overpriced, disappointing, and stale. On that note, everything in the window looked gross, the cream puffs. The staff members working that day were lifeless, and the place seemed like all the energy had been sucked out of it. Terrible experience here.
author: Stefanie C.

description: 4th Beard Papa's location I've tried. Not much selection/flavors when we went. Ordered vanilla puff. Tasted good, but in a forgettable way. Still not persuaded into being a Beard Papa's fan.
author: Jen J.

description:
Love this place! They make one thing and make it well--cream puffs! I didn't think I was a fan of cream puffs until a had a Beard Papa cream puff. It's life changing. They fill them to order and you should eat it right away. The filling is delicious--not too sweet and slightly chilled. I like to get the eclair puff with vanilla cream. 

So so good! There's a location in the mall too but I like this one because you can get your puff to go and sit out in Yuerba Buena to eat it. It's a little messy and you can't really look cute eating it but it's worth the sticky fingers and face.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Beard Papa's delivers some awesome, decadent treats. The Cream Puffs are amazing and come in many different flavors. I haven't been disappointed with a flavor choice yet, but you can't go wrong with just getting the original flavor. The Cheesecake Sticks are also good, but at times, I sometimes I felt like I was biting into moist pound cake and not rich cheesecake. 

My waistline isn't always happy when I come to Beard Papa's, but I sure am!
author: Mark C.

description:
Our family stopped in here for a mid-afternoon snack after going to an event at the Moscone Center. We stuck to the basics, each getting either a vanilla or chocolate cream puff, or an eclair. You can pick your filling - so there are lots of combinations of flavors to try.  Everything was fresh tasting, and the fillings were very creamy and smooth.

Great place to drop in for an affordable treat.
author: Rob N.

description:
The bland/ meh pastry shell is really just a poor vehicle to get the AMAZINGLY INDULGENT vanilla bean cream!!! into my mouth. A little pricey at $2.25 a pop for an original pastry, but I'm all about occasional (or frequent!) decadence ;)

I've been to a few other of their chain stores in and will definitely give props for consistency.
author: Angela L.

description: there is nothing more to say than the  best darn cream puffs in the world.
author: A.C. N.

description:
I was walking around downtown aimlessly and saw Beard Papa's, which is on my sf bucket list of places to try, so I popped in. 

I ordered the cookie crunch cream puff : http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/Nw8h8pc4TzHdVlPA3gsOlA?select=UJTSNCjp99HwH6GVzFNGXA#UJTSNCjp99HwH6GVzFNGXA

It was bigger than I expected and not too sweet. It was fresh and tasty. For $2.50 it was pretty good.
author: Court S.

description:
Rude!    Stopped by for an afternoon snack....staff was rude from all angles....when asked about filling flavored, the pastry gal kept waving at the sign.  No interaction.   The guy behind the register looked less than thrilled to take our order....and let me not forget about the coffee lady...asked her to fill up the creamer container....I thought her eyes were going to roll rightist of her head...


Bottom line....don't stop
author: Todd S.

description: There is no other Bay Area bakery that can make cream puffs like Beard Papa's can! You get a fairly large cream puff with 2 pumps of cream filling. But recently I have been asking if I could get an extra pump and they happily did! How awesome is that? Their standard flavor is vanilla and chocolate but if you are lucky enough to get some seasonal flavors you could get mango, which is my favorite, or green tea. I've also seen coffee and caramel but neither interests me. I just wish they offered more flavors like they do on their website. I would love to try TARO cream! You also have 3 choices of puffs. You can get original, cookie crunch, which is my favorite or chocolate. I always ask no powered sugar because whenever I bite into these guys I end up inhaling the powdered sugar and start to cough like mad, so I always skip it but you have to tell them in advance because they won't ask you.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
I love dessert as does my husband.  And by love, I mean we LURVE it.

We popped into Beard Papa's after lunch for a quick dessert.  I was so excited to try the cream puffs.

The employee recommended the Cookie Crunch puff with the vanilla cream (I got that).  My hubby got the Cookie Crunch puff with the chocolate cream just to be contrary.

I ran to the table, bit into it, and it. was. cold.

The puff was room temperature, but the cream was slightly cold.

It was a strange sensation and quite unexpected. I thought it would be warm and gooey and melt in your mouth delicious.  Instead it was cold.  and gooey.  and crumbly.

The vanilla cream itself was DELICIOUS.  The cookie crunch puff was MEH.  I did not try my hubby's but he said the chocolate cream was "just ok".

"just ok" in our dessert-fiend world means we won't be coming back.  Glad we could experience it while we were visiting San Fran, but would not make the list next time.
author: Heather T.

description: This chain is sooo cool. I wish there was one in Michigan. Cream puffs should be so much more popular than they are now. For those who haven't had one of these glorious snacks, it's a pastry with a custard/ice cream-like filling. The chocolate one I had a hard chocolate coating and a chocolate custard oozing out when I bit into it. Yummmmm.... $3 is a little pricey for one but it's a must have in the Bay Area. They have multiple items/variations on their menu as well as a huge variety of flavors. This location is right in the financial district adjacent to the Jewish Museum and the Yerba Buena Museum/Garden. Whether you want to sit down and slowly savor it or grab one on the run to your destination, I must say it's a recommendation for anyone with a sweet tooth!!!
author: Vikram V.

description:
After lunch at Wise Sons, we always have to finish with some sweets! Beard Papa is an international Japanese bakery known for their delicious cream puffs. As simple as they may seem, they are bursting in delicious, flavorful cream within...

See how the delicious cream just oozes with happiness?? We ordered the Cookie Crunch Cream Puff. On first bite, you get this cookie crunch on the outside, then the cold, sweet vanilla cream explodes in your mouth. It's really that delicious!

I really want to try the Green Tea and Honey Cream Puff, but it wasn't available that day. Don't worry Beard Papa. I'll be back for those clouds of heavenliness!
author: Leslie L.

description:
Why 3 stars?  Because they were alright, but I didn't like myself for eating them.

   ---   ---   ---

I like cream puffs, who doesn't?  Since I am not exactly Wolfgang Puck with my cooking skillz, my go-to item to bring to a pot luck style party is a tub of frozen Sara Lee cream puffs.  I friggin love those things.  I FRIGGIN love 'em!!

So when I am walking around San Francisco and see a store that's all about cream puffs, there was not a chance I wasn't going to walk in there and lay some cash down.  And boy did I.

What I got were some heavy ass cream puffs.  I think we were somewhere around the 2.5 - 3x too much cream mark.  I know they are called CREAM puffs, but I do like a bit of moderation, in order to not feel like a complete tub of lard after the fact.

I like the concept, but I won't go back to Beard Papa's.  I don't like the person I become during the digestion phase.
author: Brett N.

description:
This place is another "ok" place.  It wasn't really bad, but it wasn't any place I'd recommend.

So the concept - you pick your puff and your cream and they'll put them together for you.  

As other reviewers have noted, it seems to be a great idea in theory but maybe not so much in practice.

My experience - stale puff overfilled with cream led to most cream on the napkin and flaky puff pieces on the floor.  Not an enjoyable eating experience.
author: Gino M.

description:
I love it when you call me Beard Papa
Throw ya hands in the air if you a true player...

You know what Beard Papa and Kim Kardashian have in common?

They are both creme puffs.  What I mean by that is they look good but in the end... Are empty.  (Just ask Kris Humphries. That Big Dummy.)

So I walked out of the Metreon theater the other day and the first thing I run into crossing the street is Beard Papa.  I was so hungry, and those creme puffs looked really good.  So I walked in.  I couldn't decide so I asked the girl at the counter to just get me the classic creme puff and a cup of coffee.

So about $6 poorer I ended up with a decent cup of coffee and a tiny little creme puff.  Maybe my manly instincts kicked in and told me real men shouldn't be sitting in Beard Papa, and that real men don't eat sissy little creme puffs.  That I should be in a sports bar watching UFC, drinking a beer, and belching really loud.

In the end, I can't say I enjoyed my creme puff, much like Kris didn't enjoy being married to Kim.  Moral of the story is just cause it looks good, it could lack substance, leaving you feeling unfulfilled or unsatisfied.
author: Michael L.

description:
Raji R. and Angela L. are right on the mark with their observations of the not-terribly-overwhelming puff / eclair shells.

But the cream itself is darn good and just right. Not bland, but not overpoweringly sweet. And there are several choices at any given time. Green tea? Pleasantly refreshing. Pumpkin? A scrumptious way to celebrate the season. The chocolate fondant is wholly satisfying too.

Overall, a sweet, yummy treat that's worth a quick stop if you're in the area.
author: Vincent L.

description:
I saw another reviewer list the price as $3.50 per puff, but I thought I paid $5 for 2. In any case, definitely worth the money. I'm a huge fan of both vanilla and chocolate creme filling. Haven't tried some of the newer iterations with chocolate shell instead of traditional pastry shell. 

NOT a big fan of the eclair, as I don't care for the hard crispy shell. I'd prefer it if the chocolate were softer.

I'll continue to hit this place when I'm in town!
author: Scott G.

description:
I don't what it is about cream puffs, but they are so good!

Maybe it is the texture and the fluffy bread, but these cream puffs are amazing. My cousin and I decided to get a tasty treat after running the NWM 2013. Hey, we burned over 1000 calories. I think a cream puff should be okay! My favorite is the vanilla ones, but they have various flavors, like coffee! They added two new pastries instead of the original pastry. I like the location of this one because it is near the park so you can grab your snack and walk over to the outside seating at the park and people watch. The cheesecake stick was okay and the coffee they serve smelled delicious. We got a box of 6 cream puffs (2 vanilla, 2 chocolate, and 2 coffee) all were delicious. Don't worry, we didn't eat them at once, we spread it out during the day and shared with my brother!
author: Joyce D.

description:
LOVE these puffs! I ordered some to go and they were great even the next day. But, they are the absolute best right after you pay for it and they hand you that freshly filled puff. Oooh it's so good. I got the regular vanilla and the chocolate because those are my faves. I also tried a cheesecake stick which was pretty good too. 

If you haven't tried them, I highly suggest you get over there quick. This is coming from a girl that doesn't even like cream puffs in the everyday sense. But then again, this ain't your ordinary puff.
author: Mel L.

description: Fluffy and tasty, but incredibly messy to eat. I felt that this popular chain was not quite worth the hype I'd heard, so I was a little disappointed.
author: Ananya M.

description:
Ooooh, Beard Papa's! I've missed you!!

I used to have one of these down the street from my office in Chicago and it was my favorite afternoon treat on a crappy work day. So imagine my excitement when I walked by it right down the street from the Yelp offices today on my way to lunch. OH HAPPY DAY! I made it a point to go after lunch and grab an eclair shell filled with vanilla custard. It was just as delicious as I remembered! And just as messy to boot. Lots of tasty bits of custard shooting out every which way as I took bite after bite. So good I scooped that shit up with my fingers and licked it clean. YES!

My only complaint is that they don't have quite the same selection as the Chicago location. My favorite treat there was the Paris Breast, a ring of cinnamon and sugar pastry stuffed with custard. I could have really gone for one of those today but I ain't mad at the eclair! :)
author: Annette J.

description: A lovely little place to stop by when you want to treat yourself to a ginormous cream puff! The filling reminds me of a more glorified pudding and I love that the vanilla cream puffs have flecks of vanilla bean in them. The strawberry cream puffs tasted super fresh, with the filling having pieces of strawberry in them. Although each cream puff costs several dollars, I figure it's way easier and cheaper to just buy one here whenever I have a craving, vs. trying to make my own. The only reason why I docked a star off is because one time when I ordered an iced coffee in the mid-late afternoon, they seemed to be almost out of coffee and instead of telling me this or making a fresh pot, the person working there served me the gritty remnants of what was leftover in their coffee pot. Overall, a sweet way to get some sugar into your day - I recommend ordering one and walking across the street to eat it outside in the grass at Yerba Buena park. But make sure you bring napkins!
author: Stacy K.

description:
Eating one right now and I had to post a review!

It's a day old and my boyfriend had them, otherwise I never would've known about them, but GODAMN these are good!!!

The chocolate was light, airy with only a hint of cocoa taste so it won't weigh down the overall flavor or texture. But still a nice chocolate flavor that is a good cocoa not a cheap Hershey's. 

It's simply divine! I might have to sneak another from the box.
author: Bianca U.

description:
Green tea filling!! I thought it was a weekly special but I guess it's a daily special? I got one with a regular puff and it was dusted with green tea powder, yum. The filling has a relatively strong taste in flavor. As usual, my face gets slobbered with cream.

I also tried the cheesecake stick, it was average compared to the cream puffs. The cheesecake was pretty creamy though. I'd say just stick to the cream puffs.
author: Virginia Y.

description:
Tried the Cookie Crunch with Green tea filling. I personally like things sweet and this wasn't sweet =[. It was heavy green tea taste for those who like. The crunch wasn't crunchy. Kind of disappointed.

Plain with vanilla. Tastes a little like vanilla bean which I like :)
author: Benita M.

description: I love these cream puffs.  If I had no self control, I would eat here daily, 2x a day, maybe even 3.
author: Bryan D.

description:
Clean store, superlight dessert, I don't know of anyone who does it better! I think cream puffs strike a balance between desserty enough but not too decadent.

Go for vanilla for full authenticity. The "special" flavors are less filled and have a more whipped-cream filling rather than the richer custard.
author: Brittany L.

description: One of the few places in the United States where you can enjoy these amzingly delicious pastries.
author: Arthur B.

description:
Stopped by this place on Memorial Day.The cream puffs were pretty delicious!  I bought 6 cream puffs yesterday (chocolate filling and vanilla).

I was very disappointed at the two girls working there (filipino and caucasian). I was with my bf standing there waiting to order, and with no one in line, after several minutes of waiting for the girls to say something, I said "hi, can i order now?" The caucasian/foreign girl said "You come order HERE!" and rolled her eyes. Omg, what a rude person! We walked out furious. 

Beard Papa's, you just lost two customers for good! I will now just order else where. Please have a word with these two girls.
author: Annette F.

description: We went here after an event at the Metreon.  We had 2 Cream Puffs and the Tiramisu for dessert. The Cream Puffs were Ginormous and the place was clean. The staff looked a little tired because it was late, but nonetheless; they pretty were friendly. Wifey got coffee but since I did not get one, I can't comment on how good it was.  We will be back for more Creamy filled goodnessof  these very delectable tasty treats.
author: Robert R.

description: Over 7 years ago I had one of these delicious treats. I introduced my fiancé today to these treats and he was surprised by the vanilla custard. It tastes just like a custard that we used to have when we were younger. It has a great vanilla taste and perfectly balanced out with the dough.
author: Gaby E.

description:
Sunning in Yerba Buena not too long ago...napping and enjoying the beauty of the SF park.......got a bit peckish and started on the hunt for attainable snack within minutes...

ah.....so there you lurk... yet another branch of your tempting wonderpuffs, kicking on the insatiable appetite...

one to go....finished by the time I hit the outside tables in the al fresco area....sometimes, BP just hits the spot!!!
author: Jana C.

description: Their beard papas were perfect, but this place gets two stars for their service. Granted it was a hot day and flies are in some of the cities establishments, I would think if I asked for fresh cream puffs they would give it to me because I saw a couple of flies land on the puffs. There were 5 out in the front case and I was told they couldn't take one from the cooling rack because they needed to finish what was out. As soon as I walk out, he throws a whole FRESH tray into the bin and tells me it's for a pre order. I understand he was doing his "job" but that's still not right to serve pastries flies sat on.
author: Tiffany B.

description: they deliver! (i just gained 5 lbs typing that)
author: Rod M.

description: I had the cookie crunch puff with chocolate filling. It is a great size & costs under $4 for each puff depending on the type you get. They have different filling flavors on different days. Yesterday it was vanilla, chocolate and mango. I've seen strawberry as a filling flavor before in their other location in Union Square. This location is great because it's in the trendy financial district. I don't recall if there is seating indoors. Eating a cream puff can get messy because there's quite a bit of filling. It will ooze out so I advise eating it inside the paper bag! It's a great option for a snack pre pr post movies since this location is by AMC theater. They boast to have the World's Best cream puff, a claim that I would agree to primarily because I don't know anywhere else that serves/makes primarily cream puffs. This is a chain store that originated in Osaka, Japan. I love their bearded man logo because it is so cute! This makes for a great item to bring to potlucks too as dessert.
author: Brenda L.

description: Amazing eclairs, yummy strawberry cheesecake sticks, and my personal favorite delicious cream puffs. I've always been a fan of these. Just the right amount of sweetness. I don't feel guilty having two or three of these. The only downside of this location is that they don't clean. The table were full of crumbs and napkins and the trash was completely full. Before we walked in, one worker was standing at the register and the other was sitting down. We decided to eat there and I had to wipe down the table and chairs.
author: Briana Nicole G.

description:
Went to a Beard Papa's after a long time and it looks like they have kept their menu and formula exactly the same. If it is not broken, why fix it, right?

The puffs were good as I remembered them. I need to figure out how to eat it without making a mess though, it gets everywhere.
author: Sunil R.

description: I wanted to give this place a better rating, I really did! Their cream puffs and other pastries are awesome! Unfortunately, the last three times I have come here, I have encountered the most apathetic and disgruntled customer service I have had in a long time. I'm honestly shocked as it has been different people every time. How does an establishment selling the most wonderful desserts of all time have such miserable employees?! Im baffled. Good food, absolute sh*t service.
author: Cynthia D.

description:
Beard Papa is a beautiful thing. There is also one in the Westfield basement, if you're already in the mall.

I like to take my vanilla filled eclair over to the gardens next door and eat the wonderful pastry while watching children chase pidgeons.

Another wonderful thing about Beard Papa is that there is a different special flavor every day! Fan favorites are the strawberry and the green tea; I have yet to try any other ones.

Also, Beard Papa the character was in Wreck-It Ralph!
author: Christina S.

description: These are so fun! What a nice treat mid-day. I really like the eclairs with chocolate filling. Not too sweet and not too filling. Every time I visit San Francisco I make sure to pick up at least one (and usually two or three) of these.
author: Lori M.

description:
original creams puffs and cheesecake are yum BUT staff is unfriendly, condescending and argumentative, to think we were the only customers. you ruined the experience for us!! sorry Beard Papa, for that you get 2 stars! 

note: typically, establishments issue a receipt, so when a customer asks for one, you issue with a smile and never argue and turn your back with a snotty smirk. why the attitude, Alex? so inappropriate and unnecessary!
author: Maria L.

description:
So the puffs are all fine and dandy. I don't hate them, I don't love them. 

What I DO love are the chocolate eclairs filled with vanilla. 

Though I don't mind one in passing here or there, I wouldn't go out of my way to get these little sugary goodies! Not my thing maybe!
author: Raji R.

description:
I love cream puffs. Beard papa's makes amazing ones.

I recommend eating a cream puff every now and then unless:
1. You're a diabetic - you know better so shame on you
2. You have fatty liver disease - same as above
3. Your BMI is more than 30 - same as above, although once in a while is probably okay.

Everyone else, go get some creampuffs!
author: Julia P.

description:
Beard Papa's is the one of the best cream puffs I've ever tasted. They have expanded the flavors so it gets even more exciting when you visit. (Try the cookie crunch!) 
I admit the filing can get a messy all over your hands so be sure to have napkins handy! There is another location on the other side of the block in the Westfield Mall too, in case you are craving cream puffs inside the mall!
author: Marie P.

description:
They offer different types of cream puffs filling and pastry type. Trying this for the first time, I settled with the regular type of pastry and bought two to try both the classic  vanilla filling Beard Papa is known for and for the Filling of the Day, Green Tea. The filling of the day changes, of course, so all the more reason to go back!

The pastry is delicious. They're the size of the palm of my hands!
 Every bite is full of filling. Not overly sweet but still fulfills any sweet tooth's craving. Seems dense but is so light. Extremely worth it.

I particularly enjoyed the vanilla more than the green tea, but it's personal preference at that point. The green tea wasn't too heavy on the flavor either, the right amount.

The location, as well, has very good service! I could tell the guy behind the counter was having a great day, just jamming out to everything on the music station, and sharing his joy. It's rare but great to see that kind of person working. :)
author: Ann V.

description:
I ate green tea cream puff! 
I liked it! It wasn't so sweet and heavy!
I want to try a different one next time!

I didn't know I could use my student ID for discount until I read someone's review....
I'll ask them next time!
author: Sachi S.

description: I have been to this Beard Papa's location more than once and always feel satisfied by the cream puffs and cheesesticks.
author: Denise C.

description:
4.5 out of 5
---------------
What can I say about Beard Papa? I've had 'em in Japan. I've had 'em in NYC, and now I've had 'em in San Francisco.

This Beard Papa is tucked next to the Yerba Buena Gardens--I don't think you'd be able to find this place unless you were on a dedicated mission. It's on a small street that you can't really see from the front, so we had to do a weird square around it to access it from behind. There is some seating inside, but there is also seating outside as well. 

There are regular vanilla custard-filled cream puffs and cream puffs topped with a cookie crunch topping. There's also a rotating flavor that changes depending on when you visit. When we went, the flavor was Mocha. 

We got a regular puff filled with Mocha and a Cookie Crunch filled with Vanilla. Those babies got *inhaled*. And not just "eaten-quickly" inhaled, this was the type of devouring that got cream filling and crumbs all over your face, hands, fingers, and no matter how many napkins you used, you still kept finding bits of glorious cream puff on you. 

The regular vanilla custard is reliable and delectable. The mocha is a nice switch up and is a little less sweet and tangy compared to the vanilla. The cookie crunch puff is a little harder and crunchier than the flaky standard puff, but I couldn't taste a huge difference. I prefer the standard puff because it allows me to focus on the filling. 

Basically, these are an awesome treat. The only place I've ever been to that comes close (and due to personal preference, some actually like it better) is Pacific Puffs. The actual puff part of Beard Papa's puffs is pretty flaky, and Pacific Puffs holds up and is more solid. Beard Papa also jam packs the puffs full of cream so that when you take your first bite, the filling oozes out. Some think it's too sweet because of the filling, but the filling really isn't that sweet. The treat doesn't have that much sugar in it compared to other pastries, so you don't feel like you have to brush your teeth afterward lest you get a cavity.
author: Nicole O.

description: I'm from Los Angeles and the beard poppa that I loved by my house got closed!! So was I happy when I saw this around from my hotel while staying in SF?!? Uhhhh yeaaa! To my surprise they had different pasty shells, they were bigger and so much better and CRUNCHY!! from what I remember from that little stand they closed by my house. So delicious! I love that nothing is overly sweet which is bad too because then I eat like 4 cream puffs! Jk (ok maybe not jk :-/ haha!) but super clean! Fresh! Friendly! And yummy! Anything you get, get it with a cookie topped pasty shell! Wish I would've gotten more of those. Thanks BEARD POPPA!! I'll be back soon!
author: Jackie J.

description:
Beard Papa love!

We used to have Beard Papa in Florida but I guess that they did not do well and decided to close shop. So when I was in San Francisco on vacation, I was elated to find out there was a shop in the city. 

For my visit I got the cookie crunch pastry shell (my favorite) and the special flavor of the week, caramel. It was super tasty-- like having a flan in cream puff form. If you're in town, I definitely recommend stopping by!
author: Kate R.
