description: I needed some afternoon sweets in the afternoon as a pickmeup while in the city for a conference. I was walking this way to visit a specific store and the sign caught my eye. Sure enough, I was enticed in and had a vanilla. Oh boy...that was tasty. I just had to go with a traditional one, but I would've loved to try the pumpkin. Maybe I should have bought two. Next time, I guess.
author: Derek F.

description:
Beard Papa is the first cream puff I ever had.  And it was good!!  Took me by surprise though, when I took that first bite into that Vanilla Cream Puff, it exploded in my mouth...and everywhere else.  Yeah I made a mess!!  Anyways, I wasn't expecting the cream to be cool, so that was a pleasant texture and it wasn't extremely sweet, so that complimented the puffy pastry very well.

The next time I visited, I tried the Vanilla again along with the Green Tea.  While I still liked the Vanilla, the Green Tea one wasn't all that special.  I'll stick with the Vanilla!!  I'll definitely come here again to try their other creamy goodies.
author: Rodney H.

description:
I am a sweet lover. 
Its vanilla and chocolate puffs tasted so perfect after you froze them in the refrigerator for a while.
author: Judy F.

description:
My hubby loves cream puffs.  I don't care too much for them, but these---I love!

The freshness of the pastry combined with your choice of cream, it's heavenly.  My first bite into one turned into many more bites til' it was "puff" gone, lol.

It is definitely a must try for cream puff lovers or not.
author: Noel And Heidy P.

description: Like their chocolate Cookie Puff very much. Not a lot of people. Will try mocha flavor next time.
author: Yunong L.

description:
It's amusing to me how some bored workers like to talk in another language in front of customers, thinking that nobody can understand what they are saying. She was complaining in Spanish to her 2 co-workers that I was taking too long to order. It wasn't even 5 seconds, Sheez! and I was her only customer at the time too.

Normally bakeries/ pastry shops that sell sweet products, hire cheerful people to match the food they sell. The manager of this branch didn't get that memo. The employees looked unhappy, with a deadpan, monotone voice and blank facial expressions, like if either they were inside a jail or they thought that they're too cool to work in that job, not sure. Definitely a disincentive to buy more stuff.

I just came here to try the new mini-croissants, available in 3 flavors: butter (regular), chocolate and cheese (cream cheese). Sold by 3 for $2.95/$3.45, 1/2 dozen for $5.25/$6.25, or one dozen for $10/$12. I bought a mix to try every flavor. The "Petit-cro" looked nice and tasted okay, but the inside is a little dry. Perhaps better when eaten while sipping on a cup of hot coffee or tea. http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/fO4nmPfUwyyzLDRxOIwuVg/l

The "Fondant au chocolat" are little cupcake size chocolate cakes filled with chocolate that melts after they warm it in a microwave. Nothing to rave about. If u still want something similar, go to TJ's instead for a cheaper version in the frozen foods aisle. The "Cheese cake stick" (regular, strawberry and tiramisu) is another disappointing item, it's a small layer of cheesecake sliced into strips. I'd rather have a slice of dense NY-style or Zanze's light cheesecakes instead.

I'm not a fan of the cream puffs at this store (maybe I got poorly made ones, don't know), although I really liked the ones I tried at Beard Papa's in Waikiki, inside the Food Pantry market. Also I don't know why the Cupertino location has lower prices than the SF store.
author: Luis C.

description:
Overall Impression: Came in with a sweet tooth, came out slightly disappointed.

Cost: About 3 for each cream puff, and 2 for each cheesecake stick.

Taste: This is a personal opinion, but I thought the cream puffs were mediocre at best. I had the green tea and vanilla cream puffs. Both had a good consistency that outdoes anything that you could buy at Costco, yet the flavor within the fillings were pretty bland. The cheesecake sticks were small and didn't leave a big impression on me. 

Customer Service: It seems like the cashiers were having a long day. They seemed to be in a rush irregardless of the fact that I was the only person in line.

Ambience/Atmosphere: A nice setting to have desserts, even though it didn't satisfy my sweet tooth.
author: Kevin T.

description: This is a short one.  They got cream puffs, they got filling.  You tell then which of each you want and they put em together.  Then you ravage it!  I always stop by for one when I'm nearby.  My wife and my 8 year old also approve.  You want a quick dessert stop, try here.
author: Corey S.

description: BAD SERVICE. The staff are RUDE. The cream puffs are also a lot smaller than it used to be. Kinda of disappointed. the cream puff still taste good tho. I would give it 4 stars if they had better services. Would not come to this location again.
author: Karen C.

description:
This review is in regard to two experiences, back to back days.

The first time I had tried one of their cream puffs, I loved it!  My mother is a cream puff connoisseur and makes amazing ones herself!  When she came to visit me in the city, I wanted to treat her to one and get her opinion.

Well, it was probably one of the worst experiences from a customer service standpoint I'd ever encountered. 

The advertised opening time (online and store front) for Saturday is 9am.  So, we show up at 9am.  Another family had driven over an hour to buy  a box to take back with them - also waiting at 9am.  The cream puff specialist was clearly inside, blasting hispanic music and ignoring the line of people waiting.  When my sweet mother went to knock on the door as it's now 9:10, she cracked it open and said 15 minutes and locked the door back up.

Please note: their cream puffs are delicious!!!  I give this product 5 stars *****

But, this employee who seems to be sneaking some puffage herself (nothing wrong with being jolly) was just plain salty! 

When we were finally "allowed" in, she was so rude I didn't even want to give this place our business - although only worth a couple of cream puffs, it's the principle!

SO - I like to give places and people a second chance and we returned the next day.  My mom wanted to get some for my other family members visiting...but yep, same salty lady, same attitude.  I'm sure they do a great business here and my review means nothing, but I just had to post it because I was so upset and needed to vent.
author: Alex T.

description:
We were in the city for Mother's Day weekend just wanderiing around looking at the buildings and window shopping.  We just wanted a small snack.  We happened across this place on the way back to the parking garage. 

I am sure that everyone has had one of those tiny frozen creme puffs that you can get at Costco or Sams Club.  I think most grocery stores sell them too.  Our family likes to eat them frozen however, that is not how they are supposed to be served.

When you walk into this place they have the "puffs" already made.  They are about the size of the palm of my hand.  (I wear a L/XL glove).  They ask you what flavor of creme you want.  I got vanilla which is the kind that comes in the ones from Costco/Sams.  My husband got Chocolate and then there is another flavor they have all the time then each week they have a "flavor of the week".  Let me tell you some of the flavors sounded SO good but we were not in the right week LOL (looks like we will be going back).

Once you choose your flavor they have a machine that looks like a super large needle and they put the puff on it and pull the handle and it fills the puff.

I expected this to be not so good.  I am not huge on super sugary stuff so I cringed at the first bite.  *musical notes plow through your head as your mouth tastes this savory goodness" is exactly how I explained it to my husband LOL.  He agreed it was really good.

I can't speak for the chocolate flavor because I did not try it.  It was a dark chocolate and I am not a fan of anything but Milk Chocolate.  My husband ate all of it so it couldn't have been that bad.

The Vanilla - - WOW - I expected it to be like a pudding consistancy but it wasn't.  It was a mix between pudding and Cool Whip.  It was not sweet it was just creamy goodness with a hint of vanilla flavor.

If you get a chance to stop in . . . I would highly recommend it.  Next time we go we will be getting more and bringing them home and popping them in the freezer.
author: Jenn M.

description:
Oh where, oh where have my cream puffs gone?
Oh where, oh where can they be?
With their flaky crust
And their custard all sweet.
Oh where, oh where can they be?

The best cream puffs I've ever had without exaggeration. These put frozen Costco cream puffs to shame. I always get the vanilla and am never unhappy with it. If anything, I'm only ever unhappy that I limit myself to one. The crust is flaky with just the right amount of powdered sugar and the custard always tastes fresh and light. This was my guilty pleasure when it was in Berkeley and I was so sad when it closed down.

The staff is friendly and their puffy chef hats are so cute! Around $2.25 for one and worth every penny.
author: Salma R.

description:
The puffs went poof and disappeared almost as soon as we got them into our greedy hands. Favorite flavors include green tea, chocolate, strawberries & cream, dulce de leche and pumpkin. The cheesecake sticks are also a delicious treat but compared to the cream puffs, I think are a little small for the price.

Right across the street from the Metreon. We usually stop by before or after a movie. We usually buy a few to eat while sitting on the lawn of Yerba Buena Gardens and enjoy their summer concerts.
author: Cece E.

description:
I've only been here once, but I was completely satisfied with the original cream puff! I just got a normal vanilla cream filling so it would be the standard. 

The cream puff was delicious! I really loved the cream filling! Nice, cold, creamy, thick, and not overly sweet! It was awesome how they show their entire process on a television screen in the shop as well. They are pretty pricey, I think around $3 for each one, but it definitely is worth the try! 

I recommend trying this place out!
author: Kevin T.

description: It's a good place for cream puffs, not many places to get them in the city, but this is the spot. Small mom and pop vibe with staff of smiles.
author: Vic A.

description: NOM NOM NOM x) I am satisfied with this place. Their bread was flaky and soft, the cream inside was addicting for me and the desserts for me was not that sweet. I would go back there and try new desserts when I want to indulge myself x)
author: Jeca V.

description: Walked in today with a friend that was craving some sweets and was greeted by two friendly guys who recommended their new tiramisu with chocolate oozing out. My friend said it was pretty amazing but I stuck to my favorite chocolate eclair with chocolate filling. Also try their funky fillings like green tea every once in a while.
author: Leina K.

description: Finally ventured out of my comfort zone and tried the Fruit Cream Puffs... And I must say it's amazing! They use actual fruit so it taste both fresh and delicious. My favorite is strawberry and mango is great as well. They rotate their flavors every week, so call ahead of time because they do run out fast. It's also convenient that they have two locations on your quest for Strawberry cream puffs.
author: Arron E.

description:
Just perfect. Though, almost perfect. I just found another competitor for beard papa's and it's called Pacific puffs. I can't tell which is better! 

Beard papa's has a variety of flavored creams such as strawberry, blueberry, chocolate, vanilla, and etc. In which makes their cream puffs very unique. 

Price range is I think 3.50 per puff? And is a little bigger than a baseball. 
Try it, you won't regret it... And try Pacific puffs too. *drool *
author: Elaine N.

description: I love cream puffs that I have to order a dozen to bring back home to munch on at night. It's so good to the point that I feel bad that I ate almost half the box without leaving any for my family members haha. I really love the cookie puff cause it gives that crunch to the cream puff. Although it's a little bit more than a regular cream puff, it's worth the money.
author: Nick F.

description:
If you like cream puffs, this is the place to go. All your standard varieties of cream puffs here, including eclairs. Reasonable prices.

There are other pastry offerings here.
author: Anh L.

description:
Mmm. Cream Puffs. I love how they have different flavor fillings.

Yes, it is a bit pricey. Yes, it is a small shop with little seating options. Yes, the guy behind the counter may have been a bit cold... but it's all worth it for those little yellow nuggets.
author: Takeo T.

description: The cream puffs are bland but very sweet and it was hard to tell the difference between the flavors. But more concerning is that this Yerba Buena Lane shop is poorly maintained with dirty counters, tables, floors, and hand lettered signs posted with old peeling scotch tape. Counter help gives the appearance of not particularly pleased with being there. I think that general maintenance reflects the care of the food preparation areas and this sad dirty shop is not professionally maintained at all.
author: Aldus M.

description:
Not sanitary!

I was in line to get cream puffs and saw the  employee using the same old gloves to serve cream puffs.  Gloves shouldn't be recycled when you're using it for touching money, bathroom handles...etc.  what's the point of wearing dirty, contaminated gloves---to keep the cream off the employee's hand or to keep the cream puff clean?  

I saw the employee touching everything with same gloves.  Call me germaphobe but that's disgusting.
author: Bayarea K.

description:
Great cream puffs and certainly unique and worth a stop when in the area. 

Strange name however. 

I like this location since you can sit outside and people watch, or let them watch you eat your cream puff.
author: John D.

description: Get yourself a good, messy cream puff from here, you won't regret it! Just don't make the mistake of trying to eat it politely in public. You'll end up a mess. But it's worth it! I had the chocolate filled and it was delicious.
author: Kara S.

description:
Papa, can you see it?

Leave it to the Japanese to come up with a unique way to mix their native ingenuity in packaging with some semblance of European old-world charm. In fact, the cream puff has a double-crusted shell --- the hard exterior is European, and the softer inside is Japanese. I imagine the combination makes it easier to package than the standard open-shell choux that real bakeries use. But honestly, it just looks like a molded fritter.

Papa, can you taste it?

The filling is custardy with a hint of vanilla unless of course, you get the chocolate or green tea variations. Personally I find the whole tasting experience rather generic. It's not disgusting, just wholly unmemorable. There is obviously some master plan to make this chain the next Krispy Kreme, but it seems inherently self-limiting to produce these cream-filled eclairs, disguise them as cream puffs and expect people not to get tired of them at some point.

Papa, can you serve it?

The service is efficient, and the lines are managed to the best of the staff's abilities. I have only tried the place once, but once was enough. I prefer my calories in a heartier form. In fact, I think I'd rather see "Yentl" than have another puff.

Papa, watch me...pass this place by!!! (...then the orchestra swells... and the end credits roll)

FOOD - 2 stars...yawn 
AMBIANCE - 2 stars...made little impression on me
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...efficient
OVERALL - 2 stars
author: Ed U.

description: I came back today for cream puffs and the place was deserted.  The outside looked dark and drab.  After I got my cream puffs, I realized why their place had no customers.  They only fill half the puff.  All the cream puffs were deflated and sad looking.  I commented on this and they gave me an extra puff.  I probably won't come back.
author: Lorissa W.

description:
UPDATE (Mar 2007):
Rumors are true - they've reduced the amount of cream.  At first, I felt cheated, but I realized that one of the issues I had before with their puffs was cream to shell ratio, so I guess they addressed this.  However, I need to subtract a star.


***Review for all Beard Papa locations***
Shoe Cream?!?  No, Chou-Cream!!!

Japan did not invent Cream Puffs, or choux a la creme, but the French import with Japanese twist had been popular for years before Beard Papa came around in 1999.  What differentiated Beard Papa's cream puff was that they would fill the shell with vanilla cream after the order was placed, keeping the crust crisp.  Muginoho, the company behind Beard Papa Brand, seems to understand creating scalable food businesses, creating franchise stores all over Japan.

My first Beard Papa experience was in Shibuya, Tokyo, when a dangerous aroma invaded my nose as I was coming out of the subway station.  The smell was so inviting that even Hachiko (statue of a dog) was ready to head to Beard Papa.  There was a long line, so I waited patiently for my Shoe Cream...I mean Choux-Cream.  From the first bite, I could tell it was something special.  No other puff was as crispy and had the fresh vanilla taste.  I later learned that they use natural vanilla beans, instead of artificial flavorings.  If you see black dots in the cream, it is actually flakes of vanilla.  Their shell has a patent in Japan.  

I am so glad to see Beard Papa doing so well in the U.S.  I am hoping that other Japanese franchises, seeing the success of Muginoho and Delica R/F-1 (http://www.yelp.com/biz/xlXnPitrO9Mjfq3aPAyNVQ) and Santouka Ramen (http://www.yelp.com/biz/8oQW63QAXDaGfIWAQzmI0g), decides to open stores in California.  Sure, Bay Area people hate big businesses like McDonalds, but these are the only companies with resources to expand their chains globally.  No mom & pop operation in Japan could take the risk to test the market in the U.S.  Hey, all I care is that I get to enjoy my cream puffs.  


---Original Review on 12 May 2006-----------
Beard Papa cream puffs has arrived in SF!!!  For the first 50 customers (each of the first 5 days), with a purchase of dozen cream puffs, they were giving out a stainless bottle with Papa's logo with quotes "Let's go on a picnic." (see picture) Well, now you can purchase a dozen of their puffs for $20 and picnic at Yerba Buena Garden.  There was a huge line on the opening day on 12 May 2006, but I'm sure it will cook down in a couple of weeks.  

So, where is this Yerba Buena Lane?  Don't follow the Google map.  YB Lane is a new pedestrian walk way that gets you from Market Street to Mission St between 3rd and 4th.  Beard Papa is visible from Mission Street, next to St. Patrick's Church.  Beard Papa is technically in the same building as Marriott Hotel (not accessible from the hotel).

So, how good was it?  Well, as good as one's I've had in Shibuya, Tokyo.  Creamy filling with crispy shell.  $1.75/pc is quite reasonable - if you consider paying $5 for a piece of cake at Just Desserts across the street at Sony Metreon.  I'm just glad it's now here!

UPDATE (7/9/2006)
I went there on Saturday afternoon to pick up more cream puffs and found a line (probably 30 min?).  While I still believe this is a 5 Star place, cream puffs are not worth a 30 min wait.  No puffs are worth that much trouble.  I really hope the buzz cools down so that I could start enjoying Beard Papa's on regular basis.
author: トモ T.

description:
This Beard Papa is located in a small lane next to a chocolate shop. There are chairs outside and inside so on a nice day you can sit outside and enjoy the views. The cream puffs are good here -- in fact, these are close to the ones I'm used to eating in Hawaii. The puff is crunchy and the filling is abundant. I think in the Bay Area they are very very generous with the filling. I've never had BPs with this much filling before.

The bathroom here has a code so no riff raff can just go in and use it. It's clean and if you make a purchase they'll give you the code to use the bathroom.
author: Anita L.

description: Now that I had my favourite cream puff, I will have to reconsider switching from Marriott to Hyatt for my business travels, especially in SF. Marriott Marquis, with their dirty windows and borderline rude stuff has the second redeeming feature, their neighbor!  In case you are wondering about the first one, it's their Pliny the Elder tap :)
author: Anatoly C.

description: Oh I miss this place on the east coast since they have all seem to vanish. It was refreshing to get a green tea cream puff after so many years of not having one. The service at this location was bad, but after few times telling them I didn't want sugar on my puff I finally was able to enjoy it.
author: Vanessa S.

description:
Hands down this place makes the BEST creme puffs I've ever had. They have an amazing variety of flavors that you can choose from. Whenever I come here, I end up buying at least 6, solely for myself. :) Vanilla and green tea are my favorite flavors of creme puffs. After ordering the creme puffs, it doesn't take long for them to come out with your order so you don't have to wait too long. The outside is fluffy and flakey (but not hard) with the gooey creamy deliciousness on the inside. It's the perfect combination of textures and flavors! 

I would definitely recommend Beard Papa's if you're ever in the San Francisco area. Although street parking may be hard to find, there is a parking garage across the street that is fairly inexpensive.
author: Thomas N.

description:
The choco puffs aren't bad.
It's kinda funny when they smoosh
the cream filling via these metal apparatus
into the baked outer shells.
Apparently you must liine up in the "order here" area.
Said BP employee barked this numerous times to the tourist in front of me.
He must have been having a "training-day" day.
I wonder what the store-front experience is when you are in Osaka or Tokyo.
Must be miles apart from it's US counterpart.
Mugino Inc. please take note...
author: Derek N.

description:
Heard a lot about this place, so we finally checked it out last week. The cream puffs are DELICIOUS and hands down the best cream puffs I've ever had in my life. No question about it. It is indeed expensive; the price of $2.50 per cream puff is pretty high... but I think it's worth it to come once in a while.

Both the chocolate and vanilla cream puffs were delicious, and they inject the filling into the cream puff right when you order, which is pretty cool. I liked the vanilla one a little bit better, but you should try them both yourself :-)
author: Nikhil S.

description: Ummm what?! A store that only sells cream puffs? They don't have these types of establishments in NC. I knew I had to try a puff or two and dragged the group that I was with in for some as well. I ended up trying a traditional cream puff and a chocolate one. They did not disappoint. They weren't anything earth shattering but, if you want a delicious cream puff these certainly hit the spot. I ate way to much and felt a bit sick afterwards, but that was 100% self inflicted; I do not put any blame on the bearded man for that one.
author: Holly K.

description:
A place that sells homemade cream puffs??  Yes, please.

Only in San Francisco (and a few other cities) can you order a cream puff made with strawberry filling that USES REAL STRAWBERRIES.  And of course the pastry itself is made from scratch.  In other words this place is freaking great.  If you are busy shopping in the area and need a quick, $2 pick me up sweet treat you need to come here.
author: Heather F.

description:
Large-sized cream puff. I tried the Original Vanilla one. When you want to try a place, always get their first and the most basic one. So I stuck to the Vanilla one.

I'd say it was a good fix on my sweet tooth craving. It only took me 10 seconds (maybe 12 to 13 seconds) to finish one.. then there was none. hmm not enough? maybe, but at almost at less than $3.00 a piece.. I am not sure i'd want more.

Parking in this establishment/area is not conducive to as to any place in SF. hehe but I was staying at the Hotel Palomar (one block away).

If I were visiting the area, sure I'd get one.. or two.. But to make a trip out here just to get it? Maybe not.
author: Riza T.

description:
Cream Puff specialty shop? WOW..brilliant and amazing at the same time!

I have a huge sweet tooth and was totally having a case of the sugar cravings while strolling around town last week when I stumbled upon this little spot. I couldn't help but go inside and see if it was true...a whole place dedicated to cream puffs and some other delicious treats!

I stopped in, the menu is simple yet fully packed of delicious sounding goodies, and the staff is friendly. I am a big fan of places that greet customers and have a smile when you approach the counter. As amazing as the cream puffs sounded and looked, I actually went with one of their cheesecake sticks. Tasty, only $2, light, and yummy. Perfect little sugar craving satisfier! I was a bit surprised however, how pricey the cream puffs were. I've purchased delicious cream puffs elsewhere in the past but these were a bit more pricey. I will have to come back and try one next time because if they are as tasty as they sound, those few more bucks could be well worth it. I'll be back! :)
author: Akvile D.

description: It is a terrible shop ! I order one French coffee, they gave me green tea! I wanna change back my coffee, they didn't ! They think that it is my fault! It is ridiculous ! Their waiter just can understand Spanish! They don't understand English! Really terrible! Don't go this shop!
author: Angela D.

description:
I am in love with these cream puffs! They are not your average puff! I tried both the vanilla and strawberry puffs, both were good but the strawberry was EXCELLENT. I would definitely order that again. It wasn't the artificial strawberry flavor you're expecting, it's literally tastes like they crushed up strawberries in the cream. sweet, tart, and oh so yum. 
The puffs are $2.50 each.
Stop in for a treat!
author: Hannah F.

description:
First time trying this wonderful pastry.
I got the chocolate cream puff with strawberry filling. It was divine. The outer shell itself is just meh...but the filling...oh man. Yummy fresh strawberry taste. Very light. Not the artificial too-sweet taste that I was expecting.
Not sure if the same flavors are available to us in LA. I did notice that there are a few Beard Papas around...not close to me in the valley tho.
Very nice area. Yerba Buena park is pretty. Then there's the Metreon movie theater right across from it too.
author: Avril N.

description: I don't think you can tell by the website, but they only have Original Vanilla and Chocolate on a day to day basis.  They add a flavor of the month which I believe is one of the other flavors listed on their site.  My favs are the Original Vanilla and Eclair.  I tried the Chocolate and Coffee as well, but their Original Vanilla filling is sooo good that those don't even hold a candle to it.  The Chocolate needed more chocolate flavor and the Coffee needed more coffee flavor.  I like my chocolate and coffee flavors strong so these were both a little too light for me.  Other than that, this is definitely a great place to go if you're craving a cream puff!
author: Elena N.

description: Beard papa's. You have a weird name and a weird little gnome as your logo but you make a tasty cream puff. Your classic chocolate brought me here the first time but the mango, cookies and cream, coffee, and other surprise flavors keep me coming back to see what's new. I have to stop myself from coming here every day since it's on my way home but I'm only human....right?
author: Norris T.

description:
The cream puffs were delicious. I had the chocolate cream puff and it wasn't heavy or too sweet. The puff seemed to melt in my mouth. We ordered a box of 6, with a mix of different cream flavors. They prepared the puffs on the spot pretty quickly/

Downside? It's a pricey addiction to have, but definitely a treat to have once in a while.
author: Frances L.

description:
I'm giving them 4 stars for the consistency, the service and being the first (that I know of) cream puff place in the city.
I've heard of this place before they opened the store in the city and was excited to try them.  I don't go here all the time but am always to have a good cream puff.

Their strawberry puff are good. Vanilla and chocolate were good as well.
author: Learnee L.

description: I love cream puffs, or choux creme, whatever you want to call them. Before there was Beard Papa on the mainland, I used to hit up the Beard Papa in Honolulu every.single.day like some kind of addict. When they opened a location in New York, I made a SPECIAL TRIP to have them. It's so amazing to have Beard Papa just a few blocks away from me now. The custard cream filling is incredibly fresh and yummy. They fill the pastry only after you order, so the pastry stays crisp and not soggy. I like to get the cookie crunch pastry shell for the texture. The chocolate dipped shell is also yummy, though it'd be nice if they used a dark chocolate instead of a milk chocolate. But the main star is the fresh pastry cream in VANILLA (do not deviate from vanilla). You can see the real vanilla bean specks and it's just sweet enough. Considering cupcakes run $3.50-$4 each and, in my opinion, are way way easier to make, these cream puffs are quite a steal. They used to be like $2.25 but I think they're up to $2.75 now. For all the people complaining that the pastry cream filling is cold, that's because it is fresh pastry cream made with fresh milk and no preservatives and no weird gunky stabilizers and texturizes like carrageenan or whatever. It needs to be cold just like milk needs to be cold. I think Americans forget what it's like to eat non processed foods. It's a delicate fresh puff, not a cadbury egg that can sit on a shelf for years!
author: Cat M.

description: Oh how we love Beard Papa's!! We come here every time we come to SF, but can't believe it took me so long to review it! Anyways, we come here and always get a puff to go and walk around the city eating it. Just make sure you grab extra napkins because it can get a little messy! Recently we had the cookie crunch puff with vanilla filling. Excellent. Wish there was a location in AZ!
author: Aaron A.

description:
The Beard Papa closest to my house was closed . At first I was annoyed, but I'm kind of glad it did or else I will be chomping down on one every other day.  This is why I grab one of these every time I'm in SF... it's almost like a ritual.

It is not a macaron or RVC... bit it's the original tasty cream puff and awesomely good. At $2.25 each, it's worth it. 

A simple menu with a simple pleasure....
author: Tuan C.

description: They have additional flavors and the cocoa puff choux here than the Westfield location. The cocoa puff choux with green tea cream was really good. I can't wait to try the mango flavor.
author: Sherry L.

description: A peer brought these to the office today.  I have never tasted anything soooooo tasty and amazing.  The mango is my favorite-- you have to check this place out.
author: Fawn M.

description:
Hot D@ng! I didn't believe the hype. I mean, what's so special about cream in between two puffs? Hearing the testimonies and watching people out over each other as though they have been touched by the hand of Oprah herself...well, it didn't make sense to me. I have eaten a lot of pastry in my day. I am jaded when it comes to the sweet stuff. I have been there and seen that.

Oh.my.

I came here after a pretty filling lunch. I was satisfied physically and personally. My stomach was full and my usually greedy eyes were taking 5. I got a chocolate puff to go and thought about trying some later in the day. I came back to the office, started doing some work and skipped off to a meeting. I almost forgot the puff behind me. As the presentation wore on, my mind started to wander. "Might as well try this puff."

That was all she wrote. What began with the intent of having a discrete nibble turned into a full-on public gorging. I got cream all over my face, fingers and hands. I had no shame. I fully disengaged from the folks around me and for five glorious moments it was me and that chocolate puff. Creamy chocolate that was like clouds of cocoa dreams. Flaky puff that melted in my mouth before I began to chew. Hype? It should be believed. That's a d@mn good puff.
author: Johnny T.

description:
Tasty cream puffs and great service.  This was our first time at Beard Papa, which serves Japanese cream puffs, which have cream that is less viscous than what you would find in a classic profiterole.  We tried the eclair, original (vanilla), and chocolate.  They were tasty, made with fresh ingredients.  

Separate from the quality pastry, I would like to give a shout out to the service.  In addition to being kind and efficient, they are honest and incredibly helpful.  We left a nondescript messenger bag at the shop, but did not realize our error for over three hours.  When we called the store, they immediately confirmed that they had the bag.  Relieved, we ran over to retrieve our bag, which they had kept safe for us.  We wanted to tip them for their kindness and integrity, and they refused.  Thank you, Beard Papa at Yerba Buena!
author: Carolyn H.

description: Yes. Love it. Vanilla. Just like I remember.
author: Naomi K.

description:
Best Beard Papa's store yet. The one in Westfield is usually too crowded, the workers are too rushed, and well, that kills it for me. The one in LA doesn't cut it for me, either.

Extremely clean storefront with the perfect location; you can share them with friends in the grass at Yerba Buena right across the street! The people behind the counter are amiable and smile back - how can you NOT buy cream puffs from them?

I am in love with the basic chocolate cream puff, but their seasonal specials are always really good. The cookie shells cost more, but you should give it a go at least once in your cream puff eating life. If only these weren't so fattening!
author: Colleen M.

description:
We walked by a couple weeks ago and i looked up the place. The reviews were good and we were not dissapointed.

I bought a dozen and my friends ate them right up. I will be coming back to try some of the other flavors. We just got plain and chocolate filled.

A friend tried the cheese cake and she said it was tasty. I will be trying this next time.

Staff was friendly and quick.
author: Jay D.

description:
I think I've gone to every single Beard Papa's in California.   Hard to imagine that the first time I had it was in Seoul years ago.   I still love it.   

Recs: The Puff with vanilla!
author: Albert W.

description: The cream puffs are a good size. Price is reasonable. They only had three flavored on the weekend. Personally it lacked flavor to me and my kids.
author: My C.

description:
These cream puffs are great. The shell is nice and crunchy and dusted with powdered sugar. It's not too thick either so you taste a good amount of filling. I've tried all the flavors but my favorite is hands down the vanilla.

I've tried their coffee, cheesecake, and chocolate cake, but I don't recommend them. Stick to the cream puffs!
author: Alice J.

description:
4.5 Stars

+ Yummy
+ Fresh Ingredients 
+ Friendly Service
+ Clean

- So Fatty :(

LOVE Beard Papas!!! Came here with 2 of my buddies while waiting for a movie to start which wasn't in another hour and half or so. There were no line when we got here. Yes!!

I've been to other Beard Papa locations, and I gotta say, this is the best one yet! There were so much to choose from but the first thing that caught my eyes were the cream puffs. The "Daily Flavors" are: Vanilla Bean and Chocolate. Weekly Flavors are: Caramel, Coffee / Tiramisu, Green Tea, Pumpkin and Strawberry. (1 for $2.25, 6 for $11.00, 12 for $22.00)

Everything looked so tasty! I  was debating on whether to try the Green Tea or the Vanilla Bean, but after a long tough decision, I've gone with the Vanilla Bean Cookie Ccrunch Puff. Sooo good. Crunchy exterior, and creamy and sweet interior. Mmm~ Kinda regret not ordering a dozen to go...

For mango lovers, my buddy Steph recommended me the Mango Ice Shower! Shaved ice, mango sauce, topped with fresh mangoes. My mouth is watering just thinking about it.

Will be back to try all the other flavors! :D
author: Mona C.

description:
A cream-puff the size of softball and totally filled delicious vanilla cream. Who could hate that?!

I read about Beard Papa's on the internet before we arrived in San Francisco. It was right around the corner from where we were staying, so it was on my list to have one of these cream-puffs made at this strangely named store.

We picked up a six pack of cream-puffs and enjoyed every calorie loaded bite. You pick the flavor cream and they inject it right there to order. We tried the eclairs, but our favorite were the puffs.

This was one of those places, so uniquely San Francisco, because it was so antithetical to humdrum boxed variety you can get anywhere. I loved it!
author: Mach S.

description: This place is better than busting a nut in your moms mouth.   Seriously amazing puffs.   So get your puff on and go get you some!  I'll be back next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Chris F.

description:
Omg! This was my first time having Beard Papas!!! 

I love it! I thought it was going to be to sweet, but it wasn't at all. I ordered 3 vanilla and 3 chocolate puff creams. It was fantastic! Even more amazing with my Starbucks. 

I was staying in the Marriott marquee in SF, and they didn't have a refrigerator, so i left my pastries out. I ate it the next day and it still tasted good! wasn't as crispy but still good! 

Every time I'm in Sf i will stop by a BEARDS PAPA!!!
author: Bhanie C.

description:
I'll say it once again: there's always room for dessert! 

After enjoying a healthy lunch over at Samovar, my companions and I decided to mix it up a little bit and order some cream puffs. Uh huh! I actually went for the chocolate covered eclair with a vanilla bean center. 'Twas delish!

Although I will say that my mom makes a DAMN good cream puff herself... so I can't give Beard Papa too many stars. Or she'll come get me and I'll be in trouble :)
author: Abby S.

description:
2.25 stars to be generous b/c that's the price of a cream puff.

I really wanted to like Beard Papa. It made me think of Papa Smurf... but I didn't like the cream puffs as much as I like the 1980s little blue cartoons. 

* FAB location next to Schoggi chocolates of Switzerland... and nice clean design, like a factory tour: video of how cream puffs are made and clear glass, so you can see the workers make your order. Chocolate and regular puffs sit on trays; the drill pump device injects cream into the puff.

* BEST aroma -- baked goody smell. Cool concept: vanilla, chocolate, or the cream flavor of the week (changed on Fridays). At the beginning of the week, I got a reg. puff with green tea filling... the puff was dusted with green tea powdered sugar too. OK taste, not too sweet -- but not addictive as other Yelpers make it seem.

* I visited on a second occasion to test consistency of the quality. Customer service was lacking both times. If workers are not pleasant, it dampens my enthusiasm for your treats. 

** BTW when you saw that I was NOT HAPPY (but DISAPPOINTED) with my order (b/c you didn't read it back to me and I got something different than what I intended -- and I didn't even bite into the puff) you SHOULD HAVE offered me what I wanted: a baked chocolate puff filled with coffee cream, the flavor of the week. 

What I got: a regular puff with chocolate cream filling. 

Note: There's a Beard Papa's in the food court of the Westfield San Francisco center at 5th Street and Market... but the mall setting really cramps the magical factory feeling. They sell the same widgets anyway.

They also sell "sticks" of cheesecake. Picture a slightly skinner stick of butter, but made of cheesecake -- not butter. It would be more cool if it was cheesecake on a stick. If you offer this, please send me royalty checks.
author: Sunny T.

description: The creampuffs were little overrated and super spendy.  My friend's order was done wrong and we did not know until way after we had left.   I would rather waste my calories on much better pastry.
author: Ryan C.

description:
Alas, I've been eating cream puffs here, sporadically, for the last 6 years and they are still the best cream puff I've ever tasted. I keep hoping that the quality will fall off and I won't have to buy another one ever again, but this has not happened as of yet. 

Once upon a time, I used to make cream puffs at home...from scratch! Once my lips had touched a Beard Papa cream puff I've never made another batch since. They make a superior filling that I just can't top.

If you are a fan of cream puffs, this shop is a must. I think the original is perfection, but other flavors are available, as well.
author: Rue L.

description:
the gf insists that this place is actually good, and that we just went on a bad day.

but "meh. i've experienced better" is exactly what i want to say about this place. the pastry was hard. the chocolate was crumbling all over the place. 

and pacific puffs is way better. sorry to all the fans out there. i would give beard papa's another try, but why? when i know i can get the best cream puffs i've ever had at pacific puffs...
author: Richard N.

description:
For the price of their cream puffs they may not seem worth it but they are dang good! I wish they had seasonal flavors which would be pretty cool but what they have now works well.

Ive tried the vanilla, chocolate, green tea and something else and they were all good. A cream puff is basically like a sweet pie outside with flavored cream on the outside and topped with some powdered sugar. On a hot day theyre real refreshing, but dont save them cause they'll get soggy.

Oh, they can be messy for children... eh and adults. The sugar will get on you and if you dont bite it right so will the cream... watch out!
author: Tim M.

description:
Why have I never had Beard Papa's before this; especially when there used to be 1 blocks away from my apartment?

He got a Chocolate eclair.  The vanilla cream was not too sweet which complemented & softened the sweetness of the chocolate on top.  I got a Coffee cream puff.  The pastry was delicate & the cream filling had a good deal of coffee flavor.  Unfortunately, my cream puff was already filled.

These are not your usual cream puffs from the bakery or freezer sections.  $2.25 for a pillow of air & cream is a bit of a luxury but it is a great little treat for those special days (or just when you feel like).
author: Karen S.

description:
I love chocolate. Beard Papa is just so so to me. BUT, today my sister sent me this text: 

Sis: Dad asked where there is a papa beards. I said SF. Dad said, "They're my favorite."  
no joke his exact words. Lol. 

Anything that makes my dad happy, deserves at least four stars.
author: Chum L.

description:
I love Beard Papa's. So soft. So fluffy. All the layers. Heaven.

If you're gonna get Beard Papa's, come to this store and not the location in the nearby mall food court. 

There's the regular puff, eclair puff, or my favorite, the cocoa puff. All the creams are great as well. They have the usual vanilla and chocolate creams as well a special flavor each week like coffee, strawberry, or caramel. Strawberry is awesome. Caramel is meh. If you're going to visit somewhere, bring a dozen of these and you'll be so loved. 

My favorite flavors for the cream are: Mango, strawberry, chocolate, and gool ol' vanilla.

I wish they would have a facebook page like the cupertino store to advertise weekly specials/flavors.
author: C. Z.

description:
I love the green tea and the strawberry puffs!! 

Vanilla are always a safe bet though, especially if its your first time. 

I like this location because it doesn't get as busy, it seems more clean and the staff is relatively friendly. 

The cheesecake and tiramisu sticks here are omg good too!
author: Angela K.

description: The best cream puffs I've ever had! I usually get vanilla bean filling and it's sooo good. Their cheese cake sticks are delicious too!
author: Fallon P.

description:
I first had Beard Papa in Oahu when I went back about 10 or so years back.  It was longer than 10 years but who's counting?  Whenever I get into San Francisco close to the Metreon and Yerba Buena I usually at the very minimum go in the doors and look.  I sometimes don't purchase anything but usually I get at least one.  

So I have had the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, green tea....the eclair.  There have been so many flavors over the years that I can't keep track.  I'd venture to guess I have had all their flavors somehow in the past 10 years. 

This location is nice as it sits across the street from Yerba Buena where you can bring your cream puffs, find a place to sit and relax with your sinful treat.  They are light, fluffy and the cool to cold filling that is placed into the flaky ball really hits the spot.  The price seems a bit outrageous but these are pretty fresh and, in my opinion, well worth going to try and possibly bring home.  

They are sinfully good...so much that there is a church less than 100 feet away to confess your sins.  

Get one or three.  They won't last long.
author: PNotHere E.

description: I love these cream puffs but why are these girls in there chatting on the clock and closed while it's bearly 5:45? Can a manager check on that? Because it's honestly cruel and unfair to leave people wanting a cream puff before class!  with that being said; the signage outside the door reads that they close at 7:00 what the heck that's it you guys owe me one on the house!
author: Eli A.

description: These cream puffs sure beat those costco ones! They're HUGE and the vanilla bean cream inside is smooth and not too sweet. The pastry is light and airy and perfectly balances that sweet cream. Too bad you can't taste the calories in these things! The eclair is my favorite and I killed one while driving away.
author: Mymy N.

description:
I love these cream puffs. This location is whatever. Came here and got my cream puffs pretty quick even with a large number of people coming in and out. 

However, when I asked for an extra box... this is how the conversation went...

me: Can I get an extra box?
guy: no
me: no? why not?
guy: no

WTF. Really? it's a box. Sure I used a coupon for 50% off via Plum District, but seriously wtf. 

I'll stick with my normal location inside the food court at Westfield.
author: Jeannie L.

description: I went there today to get a couple of puffs. They were hard, stale and hard to eat. They are not supposed to be that way. They are supposed to be soft and almost melt in your mouth.
author: Rachel L.

description:
Best cream puffs hands down. 
The mango cream puff was smooth and silky ! And even had tiny chunks of mango pieces in it! 

Even though it's probably super fattening, I couldnt help myself to two because it was THAT good! 

Only downfall of my otherwise pleasant experience was that cashier had messed up my friend's order ( we ordered a coco puff with mango filling and cookie crunch (?) with mango filling but instead received an eclair and cookie crunch). When my friend noticed it ( immediately after the server handed it to her) the server gave my friend attitude and yelled at her, saying it was OUR fault the cashier got it wrong and that she couldn't do anything about it because she already made the order. Uhhh wtf. Why don't you eat the damn eclair then and give us the coco puff we ordered (which btw was CHEAPER than the eclair). If it weren't for the workers I'd give this place 4 stars!
author: Jess s.

description:
The chocolate and vanilla bean are my favorite treats.  Just biting into them makes me feel like I'm on cloud 9.  These little (actually they are pretty big for cream puffs) goodies are gooey and a bit messy but who cares, they are REALLY REALLY good.  They aren't too sweet which is a plus since I cringe when I have things that are just too sweet. I didn't even need a milk chaser like I normally do with pastries.  

I just wish they were in Sacramento so that I could have these yummy goodies anytime I wanted. (hence only 4 stars).
author: Mia D.

description:
I've had beard papa's back in so-cal, but never realized that they had other flavored cream fillings.  Came here after lunch at Bucca's just around the corner and had a little snack.  

What I like about Beard Papa's cream puffs is that the cream fillings are never too sweet.  And the strawberry filling was pretty awesome; it had bits of fresh strawberries in it.  Being the non-dessert guy I am, these types of items appeal to me more when they're not too sweet, which was perfect for me, cuz these were just the right amount of non-sweetness vs sweetness :)  Again, it's hard for me to get a good gauge on dessert places; so take my dessert reviews at your own discretion.  HOWEVER, I was with the Finz and a few friends who ARE dessert gals, and they loved them.  So there!  ha ha ha.  You can get them in multiples or just by singles, and they are a little big, so I just wish there were like mini-puffs...Muffs...um maybe not... we'll just stay with mini-cream puffs, he he he.

Nothin too different about this place than the others tho - the lady behind the counter was gettin mad at the kiddies(my friends have kids) that were playing w/ the blinds.  Well more concerned than mad, but the way she expressed herself showed she was leaning more towards the side of mad than concerned - but other than that, nothin special service-wise, get your puff on and puff outta there :)
author: Jay B.

description:
The first time I had these, my grandma bought them for me. Sooo good.

Went there again with some friends in high school and I bought them cream puffs and their cheesecake thingie. The cashier guy was so nice and he gave me 3 beard papa cell phone charms for being so nice to my friends! They were the cutest things ever! I have no idea where they are now though and my cell phone at the time didn't have the little hook thingie to put charms on. 

I've been lucky enough to go to the Beard Papa's in Shanghai and let me tell you. HOLYCRAPA;DFA;DFAFMOSTAMAZINGCREAMPUFFFLAVORS EVER. 

They have blueberry yogurt and green tea and mini ice cream filled puffs. I met up with a friend who was in Hong Kong the week before and she told me the Beard Papa's there had fresh fruit flavors! Ohhh man. Why can't they have such flavors here?!?!? WHY?!??
author: Tiffany V.

description:
My friend (who is way more of a foodie than me) was in town and suggested, "Why don't we swing by Beard Papa's?"  I asked, "Oh, that place near my work with the Gorton's Fisherman on the front?"  I was confused and had no idea of the magic that lay before me.  10 minutes later, MIND BLOWN.  I don't even remember the flavors I've tried, but they have all been equally amazing and consumed within literally seconds of exiting the store.  

I really think there's something lost in translation re: the concept/decor, but the food is freakin' awesome.
author: Jamie D.

description: I am wondering what the hype is about this place.   Cream puffs done right is not easy when they have been sitting there a while.   I am not into mass production of delicate desserts.    The filling (vanilla) pudding might as well be your store-bought (hopefully preservatives-free) sealed in a plastic container for a kid's lunch box.  Not a suggestion to do this to your children, BTW!   Umm.  Yes, the servers behind the counter do need to be a little friendlier.   It did not seem busy the 15 minutes (around 4:30pm) we were there, so I can't explain the attitude.
author: K N.

description: Vanilla cream puffs are the best. I love walking into the store, and smelling the puffs -- it's like anticipation for the first bite. I usually get 3-4, but if I had more self control, I'd get 2, tops!
author: Xiao C.

description:
I don't eat a lot of sweets, but I try to make a point of going to Beard Papa's at least once a year (I live 150 miles away). 

Crunchy, creamy, delicious... and so hard to decide which flavor to choose this time! I can never eat more eclair or cream puff  than one because they're so rich and messy. The cream puffs are unfilled - customers choose the filling they want, which is injected at the time. Flavors include vanilla and green tea. 

There are several locations in San Francisco, but this is the only one I've tried.
author: Barbara B.

description:
The shop is bleak, but the cream puffs are delectable. Why 5-stars? They really know how to do it. The perfectly textured shell and the light, somewhat sweet cream filing makes them the best cream puffs. You can order your cream filing--chocolate, vanilla, or a rotating flavor. This week's flavor is caramel.

  It's amazing that a shop can exist in the heart of the city selling just cream puffs and a few other treats. It just shows...if you make good food, they will come.
author: alicia k.

description:
Beard Papa is like crack! I love the chocolate covered puffs with vanilla filling. 

After you eat one, you want another, then another, then another....

There are locations all around the Bay Area so stop by and try one today if you haven't!
author: John H.

description:
Delicious!  I love how light Beard Papa's filling is.  Every time it gets me.  Kind of crazy explanation how good these cream puffs are, but just think of those Herbal Essence commercials where the ladies are moaning out loud.  That is kind of what these puffs do to me.  "MMmmm so good! I want some more!"   ha ha ha.  

This location is clean and guess what?  They have a public bathroom.  This location is located next to the Sony Metreon and Market St. (Ross and Old Navy).
author: Michelle M.

description:
I guess if you like cream puffs, this place is perfect. But I thought it was bland. I think this place looks better than what it really is. Coffee was okay, but then again, it was coffee. 
I guess I feel the same way like Raji R's review. This was a okay place this once, but can't see myself going out my way to return.
author: Mrs. A.

description:
Cream puffs are a delectable treat but the SERVERS ARE RUDE AND DON'T EVER COME TO THIS LOCATION AGAIN!

I was so excited to show off the place for a first-timer only to be talked shit about in a different language! First of all, I paid for two puffs and dared to try the green tea filling which is hit or miss with me. Complete MISS on the green tea but liked the cookie crunch addition. Whatever, fine. I'd give it four stars. 

However, the cause for losing stars is when the cashier "accidentally drops" my coin change by the tip jar and maybe I'm stretching this one part with her hand placed over the tip jar with a stare as she did the drop. Regardless, customer service is lacking in never apologizing about dropping the change nor phased about the exchange of money. It was an awkward moment but when she calls out the order in Spanish, literally translates to..."make these puffs for these assholes who don't tip!"

WHAT?!!  Yeah lady, while we may not look like who you'd expect to understand Spanish as my companion and I both looked at each other with the flabbergasted "did you catch that too?" look. I'm sure this isn't the first incident and it really annoyed me the rest of the day that after the whole ordeal, I wasn't excited about eating it. The place was also not busy at all to excuse the lack of overflowing creamy goodness from each bite.

I'm all for tipping people in the food industry because they work hard but sorry, talking shit about it and also not fulling the puff completely, wow! No wonder I had a "special order." Please be tactful and don't scam people, don't "drop hints" expecting to be tipped and then make the customer insulted for not getting their money's worth.
author: Rachel C.

description:
Being so close to my office, people at work have used these cream puffs as bribery to make their project move up in my "to-do" queue. It works every time.

That light, flaky crust, smothered in chocolate, stuffed with that fluffy cream can't get in my mouth fast enough. 

YUMMY!!!
author: Kori M.

description: Overrated. In taste, the vanilla cream puffs here = boston cream donuts elsewhere.
author: Abhas B.

description:
Cream puffs.  nice.  This is across the street from the the Metreon.  Its in a nice little alleyway.  

I always get vanilla cream.  They always have chocolate, vanilla, and flavor of the month.  But I always get vanilla.  Flakey crust with a sweet cream puff.   I wish i had room for more.  This is probally my fifth visit.  

One star minus for service.
author: Richard G.

description:
This particular spot was very clean and had a few tables inside to sit.. I dont know how busy it gets there, but it must suck when it does. 

Staff was friendly
price is cheap
space was clean
cream puffs.. yum.
author: Roger A.

description:
THE SERVICE IS EXTREMELY BAD AT THIS LOCATION!!

I bought the Dozen cream puffs for $11 on Groupon and on CHRISTMAS EVE, I drove all the way into the city to get my cream puff fix (pregnancy cravings). I used my Droid X with the Groupon App and it is not necessary to print the Groupon. Just pull up the Groupon App. But the employees here refused to accept my Groupon because MY DROID X IS NOT AN IPHONE!!!!!!!

Is this a joke?! 

Bar code was there, Groupon number was there, even instructions clearly stated it was usable via App, but the employees were too stupid and incompetent to understand. 

On top of that, the employees didn't even want to listen when I was trying to explain! They just kinda gave me that "I don't give a shit" look. I argued with them for 10 minutes, but I felt bad about the line that formed behind me, so I stepped out of line to call Groupon. Unfortunately, Groupon wasn't open because it was Christmas Eve. 

The management should really train their employees before mass producing a coupon such as this one.

So I wasted a trip to the city, paid for toll and parking (which sucks and is not free), raised my pregnancy blood level and screwed up my Christmas Eve morning. HAPPY F&^%$ HOLIDAYS TO ME!
author: Valeri N.

description:
beard papa, though a chain, has the best cream puffs :)

the only thing i don't like about it is that you have to come here on certain day to get the special flavor :((
author: Joanna W.

description:
Great genuine Japanese-style cream puffs (shukure-mu). The coffee is great as well, since they use the Japanese-style drip brew method (takes a little bit more time to brew, but well worth the wait).

The new location (for me, at least next to Yerba Buena Gardens is great and relaxing to enjoy a puff (or two, or three) and the coffee.

I try to make it a stop whenever I am in San Francisco.

Would someone open one in North Carolina?
author: Toshi T.

description:
Hello!!! Addictingly good! The only downside to this place is the horrible amount of calories consumed because it's hard to just have one. Oh and also when you unwrap one of them and get it close to your mouth, if you choose to inhale before you bite, you get a nose full of powdered sugar. So beware! 

They have CUSTARD filled cream puffs. That's right. CUSTARD. Can you tell that I really like CUSTARD?! They have vanilla and chocolate, strawberry whipped cream, green tea, cookie crumble. They also have chocolate fondant, and they sell some pretty Asian things as well like Pocky, Hi Chews, and Calipco. 

I made the mistake of buying a dozen once. Guess who ate the dozen? 

Mainly me. I think I managed to give away 2, but the other 10 I inhaled over the next 3 days. Grumble.
author: Grace Y.

description: Beard Papa, I miss you. On some days I wake up craving your lightly gooey richness after that delicately crunchy bite. A month ago, I drove 2 hours all the way to Orlando to look for you. But your website lied. You were not born yet. I will be waiting, my child.
author: Julie A.

description:
Let's be honest, as soon as I started writing this review I started drooling on my keyboard.  Let's think about it this way - do you like dessert? Mm, sure you do - it's amazing! Do you like your desserts made fresh to order? Well, you're in luck - Beard Papa's doesn't fill their crispy creme puffs until you order!  They have a great selection of flavors (when I was in: Vanilla, Chocolate, Pumpkin, Mango, Strawberry, Green Tea) as well as different shells (Original, Chocolate Covered and Cookie Crunch).

If you're visiting SF, put it on your to do list; and if you live in SF, you have absolutely no excuse not to go!
author: Amanda G.

description:
Whenever I'm hanging out around Downtown SF, I try to make a point to visit Beard Papa's!  Their cream puffs are so, so, soooo delicious! The play on textures with the crispy pastry and the velvety cream filling is such a win!combination.  Also, one cream puff is really filling, so the price, I think, is appropriate. Flavors I've tried are the vanilla, chocolate, coffee and matcha (green tea), and I really loved every single one of those, especially the matcha!

I've also tried the cheesecake sticks. A slice of cheesecake is usually a bit too heavy for me, so these sticks are the perfect size to fulfill a craving for cheesecake! They're not overly sweet, and they've got just the right amount of crust to filling.

In anycase, make sure to grab several napkins if you decide to just go for the cream puffs!! Tryin to eat a cream puff without spilling all over is an art I have yet to manage!
author: Valerie R.

description:
Frickin' A, the Papa is killing me. 

And by killing, I mean making me really, extremely happy. 

Creampuffs as big as your fist. Good shizzzzzz. Holy moly, it's just what a cream puff should be. Messy, awesome, disgustingly sweet, flaky and oozing with calorie laden cream. 

I can die happy.
author: Colleen C.

description: I decided to try these cream puffs on a whim while in San Francisco. Despite the fact that cream puffs are not one of my favorite desserts, something about the funny name intrigued me. I got a chocolate puff with chocolate filling and it was like no other cream puff I've ever tried! The cream inside was deliciously light and decadent, with just a subtle chocolate taste. I polished it off in a few minutes and wished I had bought more before leaving town. Mmmm!
author: Monica L.

description:
I had to do an update of BP.  It was one of the first places I Yelped as a newbie Yelper.  

I returned to BP with my good bud, D,  She had never been there before!
We went there on a Friday afternoon and there wasn't a line!  

I got a cookie crust cream puff shell with chocolate mouseey filling (of course).......yum!

Sorry to hear some Yelpers had runny fillings...ugh! 

I just got one though I could have eaten more.

"D" got a green tea cream puff and loved loved it.

The people who work here are so nice.  It would have been easy for me to have ordered at least 100 more but since I am the only one in my household who would eat them, I restrained myself......this time.

I of course was completely mesmerized by the video of the whole cream puff process.  It's hard to believe that I haven't been brainwashed at some point in my life since I am so easily entranced by anything on video or tv or movie.  Or maybe I have......?
author: Rinky N.

description:
only four stars since i haven't tried everything on their menu.  I will probably revise my rating in the future though.  Love the vanilla puffs.  I wish that we had a Beard Papa's in DC.  Then i could try everything else right away instead of on my trips abroad or to the West Coast.

I may be kind of obsessed, but if a place has a Beard Papa's, then I'm making a stop!  They are good for breakfast, lunch, snack, dessert...any time of the day except for after drinking.
author: Jamie J.

description: I moved to the area from Texas about two months ago. These cream puffs were the best thing I've eaten since I moved here. Mind you I hit the ground running with work and school, so I'm a little limited. Thing is I'm not sure the treats get any better than this. Absolutely amazing, you wont regret it. Ladies if you decide to have a cheat day, wreck it!
author: P F.

description:
I went there with my girlfriend and must say that these are very impressive cream puffs.

Here's a hint! Request one of the fresher empty puffs for filling. We ordered a chocolate puff with a fresher puff and it was simply amazing. Soft, flaky shell filled with fluffy chocolate. One bite and the filling just oozed out. A great dessert option!
author: Christopher F.

description:
Dear Mr. Beard,

Is your real name Brian Wilson? Or perhaps "Dos Equis" guy, the most interesting man in the world? I wrote you a haiku. Don't criticize me, it's my first one.

Light and fluffy cloud
Not the best I ever had
Chain stores cheapen you


Sincerely,
Mariela
author: Mariela D.

description:
Great and slightly crunchy when fresh. Still decent after a couple hours.  Oddly soggy the next morning. It's best to buy only what you plan to eat immediately, as the freshness is what makes 'em special. .

(+) Captain Okita may be retired, but he still makes a 'bomb' puff with that wave-motion gun.
author: Andy R.

description:
Clinton sums this place up pretty nicely...

But its hard to say no to a No-I-Just-Couldn't-Have-A-Bite-I'm-Going-To-Stick-To-My-Diet-Oh-Ok-Just-One-Bite-Maybe-Finish-That-For-You piece of heaven, soooo I dug in.

And it was magnificent.

::end scene in dramatic posture::
author: Jaime L.

description:
You'll have to pardon my sacrilegiousness. But I've discovered the origins of the term "Sweet Jesus", right here at Beard Papa's. Gloriously flaky, messy, explode in your mouth (and on your clothes) cream puffs. I just witnessed a sharply-dressed Oracle executive bite into his pastry puff only to create a bit of a disaster zone on his lapel. I tried to warn him but... my mouth was too full.

Extra points for the awkward name... I'll forever mess it up by saying 'Papa Beard's', I just know it.

Coffee is decent, accomplishes its intended purpose. Oh, and free wifi for the taking on the lovely patio outside.
author: Jelena Z.

description:
The cream isn't that sweet, but it's a nice snack to have next to the gardens. 

Would I go again? eh, maybe if the cashier wasn't a complete beech.
author: Nicole S.

description:
What's this? 

What's This? 

Cream puff pastries with creamy & tasty fillings of different flavors? Yummy....and it's originally Japanese? They're scrumptiously delicious and they're gone in 6 seconds.....me want more puhhlease.

Gotta get some in a box and take em home quick...fast.
But once I get em home at last, I find an empty box.
author: John G.

description:
Sweet tears of the Baby Jesus, this was a good dessert.

I love vanilla custard. I would marry vanilla custard. Stuff that oh-so creamy goodness into a pastry and put it in my mouth, and I am in HEAVEN.

This was my first time at Beard Papa's and I was a bit fearful that I'd be disappointed. I guess if there was a big ass line, I might have been unhappy, but I was the only one there. My unbridled excitement over having a simple cream puff made the counter guy smile.

I took the delicacy back to my hotel room so we could have a little privacy. I photographed the before and after (well, there was no after, since it was in mah bellah) and I think it's pretty clear that I was in ecstasy.

I totally wish I had a cream puff right now to get the nasty Zankou grease out of my mouth.
author: ericka L.

description: Today I had chocolate with vanilla, and as James Lipton would say, "It was... delightful."   yum yum yum  This is the kind of thing that you need to buy one, and then walkaway.  It would be so easy to eat more than one!
author: Chloe M.

description:
In my imagination I'd walk into Beard Papa, place my order and at the other end of the counter find heaven waiting for me in a clearly branded bag. Not unlike my daydreams of unicorns and Prince Charming, Beard Papa failed miserably to live up to the heights I had built it to in my mind. 

We ordered three puffs in all --- one chocolate, one vanilla, one vanilla eclair. Each was cold. I always imagined my puffs would arrive warm. The chocolate lacked any depth of flavor whatsoever. The vanilla was significantly better but the temperature just turned me off. As a result, my cream puff collaborator was forced to eat most of our order himself.
author: Miriam W.

description:
GREEN TEA CREAM PUFF! I've only ever been to beard papa once, so when I happened to end up here on an adventure and heard about the new green tea filling, I decided I wanted to try it.

Eating it was a delicious mess. I couldn't stop the cream from exploding everywhere after biting into it but the taste was amazing. Not too sweet with nice subtle flavors, I thought it was a fantastic cream puff. I only bought one this time, but it was good enough that I would probably buy multiple to bring home next time.
author: Darren C.

description:
The Law of Diminishing Returns applies here: the first bite is pure ecstasy.  The second bite is soothing.  The third has me worry about weight gain - and so forth.

Give me a mini puff, would ya?  Not something the size of my head!
author: Kristen S.

description:
I first had my beard papa experience 5 years ago in Hong Kong and I immediately fell in love with that scruffy old man in his yellow outfit. I didn't even have to taste the goodness to know it was going to be an oozy delicious episode in my life. Just walking within the vicinity got me hooked.

When I heard they opened their first store in NY, I was about to book a flight over. I emailed Beard Papa's US contact and begged them to open one in San Francisco. Years passed and I finally heard from a customer that they were opening on in SF! (One of the perks of working at the Department of Building Inspection ... you know what's going to open before anyone else!)

I took a day off from work when they first opened their store. Stood in line and bought 4 dozen of the original to share and spread the yumness with my friends. ... 

and first bite, while in line.. goodness. i must say it's not as good, not as creamy as the one I remembered in Asia, but its probably because we have different eggs and milk here... but still MMMMMMMm :-)
author: Lauren Y.

description: This place gets a 4 star because they definitely keep me coming back for their delicious vanilla cream puffs. ( The chocolate flavor is good too but not my preferance.) I would give this place a 5 star but when I came to visit they lacked this dessert that I wanted to try. But I always have a good experience at Beard Papa's Cream puff. Defintely my favorite dessert after french macaroons.
author: Julie C.

description:
These cream puffs are heaven sent. When I die and Jesus is about to high five me as I rollerblade into heaven, Beard Papa is going to greet me with his strawberry cream puff. 

I'm sure the other flavors are good, but when strawberry is the flavor of the week, it's very hard to not buy a dozen of those heavenly treats and not devour them in one day. The cookie crunch is a nice addition.

VIVA BEARD PAPA!
author: Felicia R.

description:
I first had it in New York, but it's the same anywhere!  Simply delicious!  Go for the regular vanilla cream puff.

Oh yeah, a word to the wise, try not to breathe thru your mouth when biting into one of them!  Trust me on this one, people!  =)
author: Jamie J.

description:
It was the first time I had cream puffs from Beard Papa's and I was not toooo disappointed.  There is nothing really too wrong about them but the fact that they are so big is a little bit off putting.  The pumpkin cream was more savory than sweet which I liked, but I did not care for the chocolate puff much.  
All in all a good grab and go treat to share.
author: Lama B.

description: It's ok. I've had better. The cream is slightly thicker than most cream puffs and it's not as sweet. I prefer my cream a bit more on the lighter side.
author: Hayden P.

description:
Three things I love about Beard Papa:

1) Their phrase "Fresh 'n Natural Cream Puffs" - which makes you feel slightly better about your gross caloric intake.

2) The fact [as pointed out by my pal Mere] that no one -at any point along the road of globalization of these delicious little puffs- ever said "Maybe you should reconsider the name of your company.  'Beard Papas' have nothing to do with puffy cream-filled pastries.  In fact, the word 'beard' conjures up images of hair - which no one wants in their cream puff!"  And perhaps if someone did say that...Papa was like "Eff that, that name stays!"

3) Oh, everything.
author: Beth G.

description: What's better than watching big, fluffy cream puffs being filled with the custard of your choice right before your eyes? Why - eating them, of course. I've been to Beard Papa's several times now, and I've tried the original cream puff with both the vanilla bean and chocolate custards, the chocolate eclair with vanilla, and the cookie crunch cream puff with the vanilla filling. The chocolate filling is a little too rich for my taste (I never thought I would say such a thing), and the cookie crunch shell doesn't amaze me enough to justify the extra costs. Stick with the original cream puff with vanilla or make it a chocolate eclair for the extra decadence!
author: Maggie W.

description: Can you say creamy goodness?  Stick withe basic vanilla and you will not be disappointed.  If you are are going to spoil your diet, then this is definitely on the short list of destinations
author: Robert H.

description:
I should say this first - I'm not a cream puffer.

I've tried and tried, and cream puffs just don't do it for me...same for eclairs.  The pastry outside always taste so bland, and the cream filling isn't sweet enough my my taste buds.  And I've tried Beard Papa's Vanilla Bean concoction not once, but twice.  And it still just doesn't make my mouth happy.

Nonetheless, I gave them three stars because the girls working there were pleasant and nice.  It wasn't too busy when I went, and it was a pleasant shopping experience.  (I was picking them up for someone else.)

I was definitely interested in trying the Cheese Cake today, but they were out!  Bummer!  However, I do plan on going back and trying their other goodies.  That chocolate thing with the chocolate center always looks pretty good, so that's another reason too.

It's just as well that I'm not a cream puffer, I don't need to find myself gorging on these things anyway.  With all the other desserts I love to eat, at least there are some that I can no to!
author: Teri C.

description:
OK, I went to see what was all the hype/madness was about over this cream puffs and to be honest: Yes, they're tasty, but to wait in that ridiculous line??? I don't think so! Instead, I went on a gloomy Sunday afternoon around 3 p.m. to find there was only 3 people in line ahead of me.

The original cream puffs are filled with a custard that's showered with real vanilla beans -- Yum! Unfortunately, the price is rather outrageous. It's worth a try, but with a fancy price tag and lines out the door...I won't be coming here too often. (And yes, my waistline has given me many thanks for this conclusion!)
author: Lisa R.

description: Awful experience with the staff. They acted like we were the first people to ever mention Wreck It Ralph (the frickin reason we went there), yet the next family that walked into the place was also talking about the movie. The cream puffs were good (that's how they get the 2 stars instead of 1), but the experience was lackluster. Also some guy who was on the assembly line who was going crazy having a good ol' time in some foreign language decided to take a break from his native tongue to yell bitch as my 9 year old was sitting there waiting for his cream puff.
author: Marc R.

description:
The aroma of freshly baked cream puffs wafting through the air is something I could get used to. 

I prefer the cream puffs from this location to those from the Westfield mall for some apparent reason. The chocolate cream puff with vanilla custard is just divine!
author: Juliette R.

description:
We were walking back to our car after having lunch in celebration of completing the Nike Women's  (half) marathon,  when we spotted this Beard Papa's..We couldn't help but go in.  

Next time I have to go back for an eclair...or that crunchy vanilla creme puff.

I had the coffee creme puff and it was tons yummy!! It wasn't too sweet, just right and a lil messy  - or may be that was me. :)
author: Dawn D.

description:
This location is ideal for an nice afternoon stroll through the Yerba Buena gardens.  I prefer going to the store and buying my cream puffs to go and take the bag to the garden and sit in the grass and people watch.  It's so relaxing!

Puffs:  The pastry shell is a oversized puff that is soft but has a crusty top that you can just tear into. You can just smell the pastry when you first walk in if they are still baking in the oven that is location right behind the counter. 

Vanilla custard filling:  has specks of vanilla bean, the custard is not sweet and does not have the egg smell or after taste.  The puffs normally include 3 pumps of the custard which is way to much for me, so I always get half the amount.

Strawberry filling:  fresh strawberries enveloped with a whip cream like filling.  The consistency is light.

And of course all of the puffs are topped off with powered sugar.  So if you don't like having powdery sugared lips/ mouth, then you should request for non.  I always look like Tyrone the crack head from the Dave Chappelle's show when I finish eating..  :)

I wouldn't recommend anyone ever getting the eclairs or the other bake goods, they are either made way in advance or pre-made.
author: Angel N.

description:
I puff, YOU puff, we all scream for cream puff :-)!

Light, flaky, airy and oh so tasty.  The fresh baked aroma is incredible.  It wasn't at all crowded at 1:30pm on a Wednesday afternoon and the service was quick.  I was savoring a strawberry cream puff in no time... 4 minutes later, I gobbled up a vanilla cream puff too. I stopped myself from eating the chocolate cream puff (I got for my b/f), even though I really wanted to.  

A great place for a delicious, sweet snack.  Next time I see a movie at The Metreon, I will make sure to stop by Beard Papa's so I can enjoy a cream puff or two while watching a movie.
author: Celeste M.

description: Fresh and delicious cream puffs! There always seems to be a long line. But, the sweet and creamy center covered with light and flaky shell makes it worth while. I've only tried the original one, but can't wait to try the other favors!
author: Becky W.

description:
I do not understand the rave reviews. Have you never had a cream puff before? Just because it is a cream puff, does not mean the establishment did a stellar job at making a cream puff.
