Cream puffs taste good, true, but these taste like every other cream puff (personally I think cream puffs are easy to come by).

These cream puffs are nothing special. They are just plain and simple. I like something a little more interesting. If you like boring, fine, have at it, Beard Papa is all yours.
author: Caitlin H.

description: I love Bead Papa's Cream Puffs and have tried them all over, but this location was kind of meh. You walk in and its kind of meh in there. The cream itself was delicious, but I am used to these puffs being warm and fresh, and the dough was kind of, hard and felt like its been laying out there all day. Maybe just a bad batch, or maybe I am just used to them being fresh and warm here in LA!
author: Milana K.

description:
Ahhh you curmudgeons, quit dissing Beard Papa's. I think their stuff is yummy and it's cheaper than a trip to Hong Kong.
I have tried the Costco cream puffs and these are indeed better.
author: Lisa T.

description:
If you get a chance to try the caramel cream puffs, you really should: it is the perfect marriage of  caramel and cream and all held together in this light puff pastry.  I'm thankful they only serve it once a month.  Otherwise, I have to stop by once or twice a day.

On the last day they serve the caramel puffs, I buy some to eat and some to freeze.  But why would anyone do such a cruel thing to a puff?  I usually scarf down my supply within a day's time.  Oh well, they'll be back soon enough.
author: Dan B.

description: The cream puffs at this place is no better or worse than other ones elsewhre. The space is clean and the workers are friendly enough, but they seem rather borers and tired as they don't get as much business as some of the other locations.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I have a massive sweet tooth, so when my friend described these Japanese style pastries as "not that sweet" I was prepared for disappointment. Thankfully, that was not the case. I tried the vanilla and the chocolate filling and both were delicious. I was partial to the chocolate, because it was a slightly sweeter flavor, but the light, fluffy dough encapsulating the cream was delicious, and the perfect amount of savory to compliment the filling. If for your love of the Wreck-it Ralph movie alone wasn't enough, (the character manning the security booth outside the go-kart factory is Beard Papa!) you should definitely treat yo' self and get some of these cream puffs!
author: Laurie B.

description:
Location is much, much calmer than the one inside the mall. So if you don't want to stand in the long lines at the food court, take a stroll to the Beard Papa's store around the block. There's chairs inside and out to sit and enjoy your puff but make sure you eat right away. A day old puff is no good...

Don't forget to get that "healthy" cheesecake stick and cookie crunch puff with vanilla filling. Oh yeah and the milk too!
author: Betty D.

description: Beard Papa is the bomb for dessert, or just snacking, in San Fran. This has been one of my favorite bakeries for at last 5 years.
author: Mary H.

description:
Yum Yum Yum ^^ 

I love "Beard Papa" !!! 

When I need little sugar to pull myself together on a busy work day, I go there to buy one or two cream puffs. I like how they have some week specials. The most basic is so far my most favorite, but I have tried few others, which I really enjoyed !!
author: Sayaha A.

description:
I LOVE Beard Papa's.

They are yummy yummy cream puffs. It's about $11 for half a dozen (or something like that) and $2.25 for one cream puff. A little pricey but they are sooo yummy. I've tried the green tea, chocolate, coffee, and vanilla one. I love all the flavors. My favorite is the chocolate one because it's so delicious and flavorful. It's very creamy and the family loves when I bring some back. They taste even better the next day. It's so refreshing for breakfast. Just writing about it makes me want to go out and get some!

Definitely recommend this place.
author: Natalie M.

description:
On first visit, I was not all that impressed. It was disappointing as I found the inside filling way too runny. 

But then...

I had it again the other day and it was perfect and delicious. I can only assume the ones I tried on my first visit originated from a bad batch...?

So I couldn't grant the full 5 star due to its inconsistant quality.
author: Esther A.

description:
BIG cream puffs, with THREE OR MORE FLAVORS:000 ONE DOLLAR each:0

= heaven galore!
author: Josie H.

description:
I was having a cream puff craving and had recently tried a different place for their puffs so i wanted to come here to try Papa's puffs. Again. 

I tried this place before and always thought the puffs were delicious but this time I was using Yelp and wanted to compare this place with another set of puffs i had recently tried.

Their puffs are BIG. The powdered sugar on top is good but could be a little too much for me. The original and chocolate are both delicious. But what I like about this place is that they have daily special flavors and when i came the flavor was GREEN TEA! Woot woot :] I love green tea flavored things so i just had to order one. There were no more COOKIE CRUNCH shells when i ordered but my friend, who came later, ordered a chocolate cream puff with the cookie crunch shell and it was yummy. The shell was hard and tasted a bit like cookies, not definitely. Anyways, my green tea cream puff was good. Not great but good. It wasn't a really sweet green tea flavor but more like Matcha, sorta. It was 'earthy' and mildly sweet. I cannot wait to try Caramel and Strawberry.

I am most def. coming back here and i recommend people to come here to try it out.
author: Michael N.

description:
Amazing Cream Puff what can I say. The Best I ever have had and sure the best I ever will. Light filling and just indescribable how good it was. I'm pretty sure I might be thinking about sex when I eat it. 
Had the Vanilla bean filling. Perfect crust. Paris tea was great with it and sort of floral.

As an aside the staff didn't seem super friendly though. Saw lots of people buying the mango madness. Hope they open one in Boston soon!
author: Sue B.

description:
I first had Beard Papa's in Singapore, and on every visit, I would go and indulge by having a just a few, say five at a time.  

These days, I am hostage to my car whose navigation system identifies the nearest Beard Papa, and gives me false directions until I arrive at one of their stores.  My New Year's resolution since 2001 has been no more than 3 at a time, and I've broken that promise only every time.  

I only choose the custard cream puff.   While I've tried the other flavors and other menu items, it is the custard filled puff that has a special place in my stomach. If they only sold my item, it would be a five star review.  I just don't get the strawberry and chocolate fillings.
author: Matt B.

description: Cream puffs are god's treat for us humans! They are not too sweet, but just perfect. The place is small, but cute and clean. I feel like I'm a kid in a candy store when I go here even though I am in my thirties. I just adore cream puffs!!
author: Virlie B.

description:
I have discovered a new favorite flavor...strawberry. I have tried the green tea, the chocolate, the vanilla, but this was my first time trying the strawberry.

Here's something to be aware though...They have rotating flavors of the week. But I did not know their idea of a week runs from Friday through Thursday (not Monday through Saturday, not Sunday through Saturday...yes, their week starts on a Friday). So off I went today (Friday), because I knew their flavor of the week was mango, but I was disappointed when I was told "Oh that was last week. Yesterday was the last day." I was totally scratching my head thinking, Last week? Last week? But yesterday was Thursday?

So I ended up missing the mango flavor because I went on a Friday and they had rotated the next flavor of the week to strawberry already. I still wanna try the mango one...never had the opportunity, but the strawberry is my new favorite flavor now.

Oh, they have their special flavors of the week (for the entire year!) posted online. Check it out if you wanna plan accordingly.
author: Wendy L.

description: Always hit this place when in the area. Awesome puffs. Always fresh, Lot's of great new fillings to try and it never disappoints! Worth the stop on any visits to the area.
author: Karl S.

description: Not as fancy as I thought. $3.40 for a cookie crunch puff. Also, not all the fillings are available daily. So I did not get the green tea filling. They have daily filling different every day maybe. And restroom is out of order. Felt bad that cannot wash hands before eating. And also worried about how their employees wash their hands.
author: Tina Q.

description:
Working in SOMA, I had passed Bear Papa many times, unable to shake the dirty feeling I got from the term "mango ice shower."  One day, inevitably, it was time to stop in and try the puffs.

Beard Papa's is definitely your standard fast-food-type joint, and I wouldn't really advocate eating there unless you're feeling particularly insouciant about ambiance. (2/3 etymologically French words, go me!)  But nobody really does that.  They grab their loot, their dirty, dirty secrets, and go.  We did the same.

I like that they have a few different varieties of puffs, you can get things like green tea and mango - but we opted just for chocolate and vanilla.  Watching them fill the pastry puffs was also fairly entrancing, perhaps indicative of the sugar coma that was to ensue.  They were tasty, to be sure.  I didn't, like, totally flip out over them, but perhaps I'm not a cream puff kinda gal.  Maybe I should go back...
author: Becca S.

description:
I've just took a drug-test, and failed. Too much of these delicious puffed pastries. A failed-drug test is worth it to eat here.

4 star: Crappy location, next to bums shelter on Mission Street.
author: Matt G.

description:
I'm not big on desserts or pastries but even I have to admit, the original Bead Papa's Cream Puff is quite scrumptious! The first time I had the pleasure of sinking my teeth into their Cream Puff was when it first opened in Soho in NYC. 

I like that the pastry puff is flakey (similar to a Croissant) and fluffy..it's really light and what made me really like it is the cream in it is not overly sweet or filling at all. To be honest, I can easily devour more than one cream puff if I don't practice some restraint.

I also like that it never tastes stale and is good either hot (straight from the oven) or cold (straight from the fridge)..it just doesn't lose on either quality or taste.
author: Soozie H.

description:
This was my first time at a Beard Papa franchise, I had seen them in NY but never bothered trying them as I am not a big fan of sweets. I was very pleasantly surprised at the taste and enjoyed it very much.

The location is very convenient if say, you just wanted out of the movie theater as I had. It's right across the street.

Having not tried cream puffs from them before I ordered half a dozen with 2 of each flavor. I was amazed at the size of these things, they were huge. 

Service was great, I decided to eat mine at home over the course of several house but of course following their advice and finishing them all withing 24 hrs and keeping them refrigerated.

Great place and service. I definitely recommend this place if you have a cream craving.
author: Howard C.

description:
Guess I'm not a cream puff kind of person. Was disappointed because we had a $22.00 Groupon and could not use it to buy their Beard Papa's bag. Could only spend it on food. 2 people buying $22.00 worth of cream puffs? 

Tried the green tea and thought it was strange. I did enjoy the vanilla filling although the pastry part left me feeling a little plain. Was too stuffed to eat anymore, so we gave the remaining 6 cream puffs along with my giant cup of coffee to a homeless guy outside of the establishment. He was quite grateful, so I felt good about the experience after all. 

The lady behind the counter who fills the cream puffs and brews the coffee and tea worked at an incredible rate, which was pretty impressive. Found it difficult to communicate with the person who took our order--a language barrier thing; however, we did keep chaning our order to maximize our Groupon and she remained patient.
author: Bren C.

description: I usually do not eat this type of thing but got one to try. Then realized I was late to an event so put in car glove box for several hrs... Later retrieved & it was very good, I was surprised. Will be back. I like that they are small.
author: P P.

description:
Update 6/10/06: tried the chocolate cream puff.  Still just ok. It's $1.95 (20c more than vanilla).  220 calories per puff I read. yikes.

My husband and I tried a Beard Papa's cream puff Thurs 5/18/06 around 5pm.  Wait was about 10 minutes which was fine.  Place order on the left, pick-up order on the right.  Cream puff was ok, one for $1.75.  Cold when I expected a warm or even hot cream puff.  Cream didn't have much flavor nor the crust.  We finished it up but probably won't get another one for a while.  Maybe other flavors would be more interesting.

Go only if you are curious, otherwise pass.  There is one unisex bathroom in the tiny shop.  Oh, and the shop is warm inside there.  Walkable from Powell Bart Station.
author: Ann L.

description:
This place used to be great.  My last two visits were terribly disappointing.  Here is why:

Beard Papa Cream Puffs deteriorate rapidly.
Some people disagree with this, but they are clearly wrong.

In the beginning, all the pastry were served warm out of the oven.
They will filled with the chilled cream to order, and the contrast of textures and temperatures was part of the incredible joy.

I had thought this was what the place was all about.  But it is possible that the warm pastry thing was a result of not being able to physically keep up with demand.

Now that the lines are more reasonable, my last two visits I have been sold PRE-STUFFED cream puffs.

Granted, they had been recently pre-stuffed.  But honestly they just were not as transcendentally good as eating them the moment they become a cream puff.

N.B. My recent experiences at the Westfield center suggest that this problem is localized to the store on Mission.  I hate to recommend a visit to the mall... but you should go to the mall.
author: Daniel B.

description:
These cream puffs were really yummy!  The pastry was crisp on the outside and light on the inside.  The custard wasn't too sweet.  But if the custard to puff pastry ratio is to high, it's too much.  Overall though, a yummy treat.

I will agree with others about buying only what you can eat because they get soggy the next day....what a waste of money!
author: Jessamine A.

description:
Their norcal manager Yuan contacted me promptly after the weekend to help rectify things.  He explained that it was their second busiest weekend after Thanksgiving and something must have simply slipped.

I do understand that sometimes these things just happen, though I'm still not a fan of the casual dismissal and otherwise hard time I had in communicating with the people there that day.

They're sending me a gift card for a free dozen. We'll see what happens next.
author: Diana C.

description:
Dang, these cream puffs and eclairs are addicting!  And you can choose the flavoring of the creme that goes inside these things too?!  Holy smokes, I'm in a sugary bliss!

My recommendation?  Don't get just one... Get the 6 pack!  Seriously folks, you will want more!  Oh, it's not just about the cream puffs either...  Gotta have the chocolate eclairs too!
author: Danny L.

description:
Like others here, I had never had a cream puff, and have been wanting to try Beard Papa for I kid you not four years, but never got around to it.  Wanted a quick snack the other day so popped in here for a coffee cream puff and a cheese mini-croissant.  I think it was under $5 for both but I wasn't paying, so I don't remember for sure.

Coffee cream was very rich, but still somehow light.  For me, one was definitely enough - two would have felt gluttonous, though I bet I could have managed.  Pastry was light and not very sweet, a great complement to the cream.

Cheese in the croissant was actually a little salty and not as sweet as I was expecting - actually not really sweet at all.  It was very good though, so no complaints here.

I was tickled by the other stuff there, especially the cheesecake sticks - how cute and original!  Service was quick and friendly.  The only little thing I wasn't thrilled by was the fact that they have four flavors listed as "weekly flavors" but in fact only one of them was the flavor of the week and this was not indicated on the menu.  There was a big round sticker next to one flavor, but it wasn't the flavor of the week, go figure.
author: Amanda P.

description:
Just go try one. 

Crispy light outside...ooey gooey cream inside.
author: Esty B.

description: For the longest I've had the self-discipline to stay away from this place. Then my BF waltzes through and just as I'm about to reject the cream puff he said "It's mango." Hold the diet and whatever "healthy eating habits" I might have, you have mango yogurt in a cream puff? JOY. These are so good and the fact that it had bits of mango inside? So delicious. That counts as healthy right? I mean it's yogurt and mangoes (let's forget the puff and doused in sugar part).
author: Shauna S.

description: Just walking around SF with my mom and bro and we spot this place.  Glad we did because I haven't had many cream puffs but these were delicious! The filling was not too sweet but sweet enough, and the cream puffs themselves were HUGE! I'll definitely go back in im in the area
author: Josey V.

description:
Who's your daddy? You bet it's Beard Papa. Damn good vanilla cream puffs!* (Think creme brulee filling in a light flakey puff pastry)

*Thanks Yan for getting me a couple puffs. Yum!
author: Helen Y.

description:
After hearing about the craze in NYC, I headed over to this joint a couple weeks after it hit SF. I sat there waiting, and waiting, and waiting as the aromas engulfed me. Man, I think right there, the waiting hypes these little guys up more than anything. 

I finally get my hands onto one of 'em and take a bite. Oh, what deliciousness. Soft and chewy. Yum. Okay, arguably, not worth the price tag. 

And... I'm a sucker for really, really sweet things (icing out of a can, anyone?). So maybe these weren't quite sweet enough. But still tasty. I mean, those Japanese know their desserts (mochi?). 

Except then I dig into a chocolate puff. Decent. But I'm not a huge chocolate flavor fan - so maybe I'm just not appreciating it all. Next up to bat: green tea (if I was going to try Beard Papa's, I wasn't going to half-ass it). Okay. Not a fan of the green tea. A little bitter. Actually, a little too much like, well, green tea. I mean, I like my green tea ice cream, but the cream puff definitely didn't do it for me. 

My rating out of 5: 
Taste: 3 overall (4 for vanilla)
Price: 1.5
Service: 3.5

Final thoughts? I wish SF had a Dunkin' Donuts.
author: Vic C.

description:
I had the Chocolate eclair with Vanilla filling.  It was really tasty and the chocolate top was breaking away from the bottom part as I was eating it. It was really messy and I had chocolate all over my fingers and yellow custard all over my mouth.

It was pretty good.  I think I may have to work out at the gym for 3 days straight to make up for it.  They probably should not make these places so convenient that you can just bump into them while your walking down the street.
author: James H.

description: I love their delicious, ginormous cream puffs! Chocolate & the original are delicious. They also have mango drinks that are good, but overly sweet.
author: Emily C.

description: I will keep my review simple and sweet on this, since it describes what this place is to me!   Whenever I am in the area the next time, I will stop by and get myself a couple of these tasty treats!
author: Chi W.

description: What could be better than a light crispy puffy crust filled with a delicious vanilla custard?
author: Kris B.

description: These cream puffs have quickly become my favorite treat...I was expecting the calorie count to be higher, When the puff is filled with your favorite flavor (love mango and the classic vanilla) as you order, they are so fresh and perfect, The filling is creamy and custardish at the same time....The price is good for such a quality product....I recommend them to anyone who likes cream puffs....they are not overly sweet, i might add.,
author: Eugenia P.

description: My teenagers' favorite pastry. We have to stop by for the world's best cream puffs whenever we are in the neighborhood. We will actually pay to park in the nearby garage if we have driven, but this location is near the BART (and the other one is down in the food court at the nearby shopping center practically in the BART station) so that's the best way to go.  Vanilla is the best- I don't need all the fancy stuff- but there is always chocolate cream and a special flavor such as green tea or mango. Buy two or you'll be sorry.
author: Kate N.

description: Wow. I don't think I've ever had a creme puff as good as Beard Papa's.. crispy, light, stuffed with cream. If heaven exists, it's catered by Beard Papa's.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
My review is the 700th one for Beard Papa's (this listing, anyway). What more can I add to these other 699 reviews?

I don't go into the store much, but Beard Papa's is a favorite at work. My manager and I got a box of cream puffs on Administrative Professionals Day this year, and yesterday, our small staff split a dozen cream puffs amongst ourselves. Mmm mmm. It's safe to say we find the cream puffs quite enjoyable and rewarding!

I've tried these flavors: Vanilla (original), Chocolate, Caramel, and Green Tea. All of us at work agree that the vanilla is the best, though. The Green Tea isn't too bad, but it's more mild than the Vanilla (a little smoother, maybe a little less fat). 

Certainly, one of Beard Papa's cream puffs is best with a cup of black coffee. Beware of the oozing cream when you get towards the middle, though!

I wish I could say more about the actual storefront, but alas, I cannot. I assume their service is decent enough if my boss keeps going back there for more cream puffs.
author: Helene K.

description:
You know youre a FAT ASSS GIRL when you have a huge breakfast at 12 noon. walk to this place randomly 20 minutes later and eat a cream puff. 

But it was so worth it. Yum!!
author: Aidan V.

description:
Once you realize that Beard Papa is actually a Japanese import, it all starts to make sense.  I mean, I don't think the typical SF food entrepreneur would think to start a cream puff shop with a cute but cryptic old-man-of-the-sea mascot named "Beard Papa".  Right?  Then there's the fact that they have a spot in the Westfield food court in addition to the (preferable) Yerba Buena Lane location--so you know there's some money behind this little operation.

Now frankly, I've never been too excited about cream puffs.  And while BP does seem to uphold the SF tradition of freshness (did you know they inject the cream into the puff right there in front of you?  Not too shabby), they don't single-handedly reinvent the genre.  Honestly, the custard is just kind of bland (yes, even the chocolate version).  Seems to me like these babies need a long list of exotic (and while we're at it, local/seasonal/organic) filling flavors.  Now *that* would be a 5-star sweet shop.
author: Wes M.

description:
MM...cream puffs. I remember when I first had these in Hawaii...the puff pastry was light and crisp, the custard was cold and gooey. Visually, you could see little flecks of vanilla bean homogenized into the filling. NOM NOM NOM. I would miss Hawaii often as a result... 

But I miss NO MORE b/c beard papa has made it to CALIFORNIA! WOOT!  At first I was a little wary that, like most ubiquitous chains, papas would morph into a place with depleted quality and stale service. But I am happy to say that neither has happened. Their cream puffs are just as delicious as I remember and their service, quick and painless. 

One note though: Their puffs and sweets alike don't taste as well when they sit over night. I advise devouring in one sitting. It's difficult when you buy a lot; it takes practice, but you'll get there.
author: Alesia T.

description:
I read about them in the SF Chron so I went down there to buy a 1/2 dz.  Passed them out to some friends at work and took some home for myself and DH.  Friend said they were good.  

DH & I had it for dessert  at night and were underwhelmed.  For the price you pay, it should be better but they don't taste any much better than those found at Costco.

Not great, just ok.
author: Wendy H.

description:
Beard Papa, Beard Papa.  That's all I hear when people talk about cream puffs...

I know I'm a meat girl by birth, but I always love me a good cream puff.  I like light desserts, airy, tiny, tasty.  My sister and I splurged and split a single vanilla cream puff (I had no idea that the "standard" cream puff "flavor" was vanilla).  These cream puffs were some of the biggest I've ever seen before, so I'm glad we split them.  The cream/custard was DELICIOUS - airy, creamy, light.  So many cream puffs go wrong with that dense, icky, overly-lardy/buttery heaviness, but Beard Papa's cream filling was perfect.

I was a little less than thrilled with the "puff" (I guess that's what they are when you disaggregate them) - it was just a little doughy and standard - I was expecting the contrasting flavors and tastes of cold cream and warm puff.  Oh well.  

Next time I'm going back for the eclair...
author: Wendy L.

description:
My first time at this location and at any BP period... I was just existing a formal Catholic wedding ceremony.  If you're Catholic, then you know how long I had been in there (1.5 hours)!  We were all very very hungry and walked to the left to find Beard Papa.  We said to ourselves, it's food, it's here, why not.  It was tasty!

I had both the chocolate & vanilla cream puffs with a hot caffeinated coffee.  I gotta say it was pretty good.  Perhaps I was just very hungry?  Nah... I'm an absolute sucker for pastries and something sweet.  This place is right up my alley.
author: Gina M.

description: Cream puffs= mmmm!  I've tried a few of their flavors, and all of them have been so very tasty (green tea, strawberry, chocolate, vanilla).  They even put real vanilla bean in the vanilla custard, a big plus!
author: Karen W.

description:
Thankfully, these are basically out of reach for me.  The closest one to me in Southern California is in a Japanese market that I never go to.
These are the BOMB.  The family and I shared one after dinner on our way to the Metreon.  YUM!
author: Cassie P.

description:
MY TASTEBUDS ARE SCREAMING!

When the new San Francisco Shopping Center opened I was pretty exited about their food court, definately different then other malls. So many people were lining up at Beard Papa and I'm thinking to myself what the hell is going on. So I moved with the masses and found myself in complete ecstacy over their cream puffs. I tried one vanilla and one chocolate. yummy. Everytime I go shopping there I make it a routine to grab me a cream puff on my way out.
author: Jane A.

description:
Wow.   So I wouldn't say I'm big into cream puffs, but I am after going here last night.   

We were early for an event at the moma and were walking around and saw this place.  I thought that it was odd for a place to just sell cream puffs but then again everyone and their mom has a cupcake place these days.   

We headed off to the moma and afterwards I thought about it again and we went over.  So glad we did! 

The place is kind of sparse inside so I didn't have high hopes,  but we ordered 6 of the éclair puffs ( because a cream puff with chocolate is sure to be better than one without); two with vanilla cream, two with chocolate cream and two with caramel cream,  which was the flavor of the week. 

The guy behind the counter was fast and laughed at all my half drunk boyfriends jokes while packing them to go in a cute little box.

So good.  Love them.  Ate them all that night like a little piggy.  The vanilla is my favorite.  Caramel was good.  Chocolate was weak on the chocolate flavor.

I've since been back and have to say coffee is a close second/tied with vanilla as my favorite flavor.  

No matter what I do though, I can't manage to eat them without some of the custard squirting out the other end.  I've tried many different techniques, all to no avail.  So just put your hand under it to catch the stuff that spills out then lick it up!
author: Kirsten M.

description:
de-freakin'-licious! Just had my first cream puff (chocolate) here today and it was heaven! A co-worker told me about it...we snuck out of a conference to fulfill our craving, yum! I'd give it 5 stars if it had more of a hang out area. It's a tight little space there if you want to enjoy your puff at BP's.

YUM!!!
author: Isabel M. L.

description:
I was having a dinner party for a friend of mine who was in town, and she brought over a dozen of these cream puffs.

I have a love affair with cream puffs since childhood.  Growing up in various countries in Asia - this was a treat that was quite often brought over by guests as gifts.  I'm not even a dessert person, but cream puffs (or even donuts with bavarian cream, oooh la laaa) really do it for me.  They make me happy.

All I can say is that she brought over vanilla, tiramisu, and chocolate - and that is also the order in which I preferred, and devoured them.

All twelve.

(OK, I let Rob have 2 and 2 friends and one kid had one each on that evening.  The remaining seven - - in my tummy over the course of 2 days, thank you very much.)

1 cream puff = 2 lbs gain = 3 inch waistline increase.
These are not the "pop in your mouth" size - these are rather enormous, I'm ashamed to admit.

And it's STILL worth it.

Go figure that one out!!!!

I can't believe I have never tried Beard Papa's until this week.
Thank God I hadn't, but now that I have - God help me.
author: Grace K.

description:
I had plenty of misgivings about Beard Papa's.   I've seen it in Southern CA but avoided it probably due to its name and logo.  I mean, its name sounds like a Smurf-themed sex shop or gay Bear bar.  I'm also not attracted to the Gordon Fisherman meets Chef Boyardee logo of an old man puffing on a pipe while I'm eating.

This Japanese-based pastry shop I guess started out in Osaka (where my mom used to live) and I love Japanese food so I figured I should give it a try.  According to their website (best watched after you've ingested said cream puffs) the original inspiration of the cream puffs came from the original Beard Papa's .... shockingly, from his facial hair.  He also seemed to be smoking while baking these "World's Best Cream Puffs".  I'm not sure what the most disturbing part of those sentences are, but I'll leave that up to you to decipher.

Regardless, the cream puffs are pretty damn amazing. I'm not normally a fan of puffed pastry seeded in custard and whipped cream, but stopping in was an unexpected treat.  I had the cookie crumb pastry with vanilla bean filling.  It was... awesome.  They also serve treats in stick form which is a form I am fond of.  They had tiramisu, cheesecake and strawberry.  They also have eclairs and chocolate fondant.  Thankfully, no beard hair or what ever Beard Papa is smoking makes its way into these delightful lessons in diabetes and obesity.
author: Christina C.

description:
Whoa! - As a true eclair junkie, i must say this place is pretty increadible!  I have only been there once, but I guarantee it will become a weekly regular form me. There goes the waist line... 


Update: This place SUCKS! - i have been there 27 times in the last two weeks and now all my clothes don't fit! Thaks a lot PAPA - jack ass! 

Update: no! Wait! - i'am sorry - i didn't mean it, please let me back in......
author: The Man M.

description:
I did a very very very bad thing yesterday and I am still doing a very very very bad thing even though I was told to EAT them as soon as I got them..... but really how could I eat 6 at one sitting.

OMG... OMFG I am in love.  The cream is delightful, smooth and so very easy to swallow.  I held my box so flat all the way while I walked back to the ferry building.  I was so careful to make certain that all 6 of them arrived home safe and sound.....  

Now there are 3...... soon there will be 0
author: Robin G.

description:
Beard Papa & I have crossed paths many times in the past: at Christmas last year, my auntie & uncle brought a whole box to dinner, but at the time I was "dieting." I see it every time I go for Peete's Coffee or pick up something at Bristol Farms downtown. And most recently, I've been reading all my fellow YELPers rave reviews about it.

The BFF & I stopped in at the Yerba Beuna location, at my urging, to try Beard Papa's for the first time (*record scratch* "i love it when you call me beard papa's...") The special flavor of the day was strawberry, which we didn't get because the pretty girl at the register said their regular vanilla are their best sellers, so we got that plus a chocolate one for me.

We ordered & they pump the little empty puffs full of filling right there in front of you. We took our first bites & didn't get any filling. Three bites in, we finally taste the custard & it is oozing out everywhere. I don't think I will eat another Beard Papa cream puff ever again. It's just not my stee-lo, ya heard? It's tastes & smells kinda "eggy" (ewww) & it's too many calories for something I just don't enjoy. The cream, the puff, the whole cream puff... is pretty bland. As my friend put it, "it's pretty hallow in the middle & when you eat it, thats how it will make you feel- HALLOW & a little fatter!"
author: Fancypants X.

description:
YUM! What's not to like? Vanilla custard. Yum! And even though I'm never really a fan of chocolate, I had to taste it and damn I liked it. Probably b/c it wasn't an overpowering chocolate taste. The flavor of the day was the milk tea and I wasn't brave enough to try it. I would definitely go back. Thankfully we popped in on a Sunday afternoon and surprisingly the line wasn't ridiculous. 

Does anyone know how they determine what the special flavor will be? Like does that menu rotate? I would love to try the strawberry and caramel!
author: Dina V.

description:
Beard Papa's is owned & operated by the Japanese firm  Muginoho. Their slogan is "Fresh'n natural cream puffs." 

Beard Papa's was opened in 1999 by Yuji Hirota in Osaka, Japan w/ the motto "Pipin' Hot Cream Puffs". Beard Papa's has over 250 stores in Japan & 300 worldwide in countries including  China, Korea, Taiwan, Indonesia, Australia, Singapore, Malaysia, Canada, & the United States.

Their trademark product is a pâte à choux pastry shell filled w/ whipped cream custard, available in vanilla, chocolate, & specialty flavors such as green tea, strawberry, pumpkin, Earl Grey Tea, Èclair, & coffee. The different flavors are sold on a rotating schedule.

While I like trying each of their flavours, the vanilla original flavour is my favourite. They inject the creamy goodness into the yummy shells to order. The place is imaculately maintained & provide a restroom & outdoor seating. 

There is also another location a block over underneath the Westfield Bloomingdale's Mall, in the food court. 

The name Beard Papa was chosen because the cream puff reminded Yuji of a sailor's beard & he felt that the "Engrish" (disjointed & often unintentionally funny Japanese version of English) title of "Beard Papa" will give Japanese people an American touch, while giving Americans a Japanese touch.
author: Tadashi Y.

description:
We were shown this place by some friends. First off, they just make creme puffs and the creme has different flavors. The puffs are already pre-made and just filled to order. There was a line and probably always is, but it moved fast.

I thought their puffs were light so that was a plus, but the creme wasn't super and didnt make up for the cost. They are expensive. I am glad to say I've tried it, but I would not come back.

I am a believe in cheap and good. I don't need all the other frills. This place is expensive and good. But in the end its just a creme puff. 

We did order the green tea, chocolate, and vanilla. They were out of strawberry. Green tea usually kind of tastes off when they make it into some other form than tea. I suggest not trying this. The chocolate is thick kind of like pudding and the vanilla had the best balance.
author: Andrew N.

description: I love these cream puffs!! when i had my first taste of what a Beard Papa cream puff was a few years ago the only way I could explain it was like "biting into heaven".  the vanilla flavor is always good but my new favorite is the coffee.  YUM!
author: Dez B.

description: My daughter & I were staying down the street, & had never even heard of this place until we searched Yelp for somewhere to get dessert.  They had already closed for the night, so we went back the next morning & picked up a six pack of cream puffs.  We had vanilla, chocolate, and the flavor of the week which was coffee.  Man....those things are friggin' good.  Without a doubt we'll make a return trek to Beard Papa's every year when we're in the city.
author: David F.

description: Such a great snacks before I go to work. But I'm always get messed eating Cream puffs or even the tiramisu thing... becoz o the powder.
author: Calvin Nicholei L.

description: OMG, who came up with this? These puffs are to die for! Best I've ever had. Yum! I would give it 10 stars if I could.
author: Julie F.

description:
I'm not a connoisseur of cream puffs, nor have I had many in my days... but this was probably the absolute best of all the cream puffs I've ever had (possibly 3 or so).  Yummmm.... 

Very light tasting.... they filled mine with vanilla. And then lightly dusted with some powdered sugar. Yummm... good stuff. 

$2.25 for one cream puff..inexpensive quick treat!

Location is great - -right across from Yerba Buena Gardens.
author: Jessica A.

description: Fresh and perfectly sweetened cream custard puffs!
author: L T.

description: If only strawberry was a regular flavor! Vanilla bean is a close second and suffices when I'm not feeling their "flavor of the week." The green tea and pumpkin are interesting, but nothing beats the classics.
author: Miffy Y.

description:
i love this place! these are seriously the best cream puffs ive ever had, and theyre huge! 
theres not only cream puffs, there are also sometimes cheese cake sticks and tiramisu sticks.. they fill the puff right in front of you which is pretty cool, the one at the mall is always crowded so this one is the best way to get it and go! 

vanilla and strawberry filling are my favorites! it really tastes like strawberry...
author: Jessica C.

description:
Orgasmic puff pastry at its finest.

The biggest cream puff I have ever had, and undoubtedly the best I have ever tasted.

Crispy puff pastry shells with the sweetest, yet not overly sweet, and creamiest filling around - it is enough to make me want to cry out in pleasure.
author: Lisa W.

description:
Oh dear vanilla cream puff! I love you. Period.
If you haven't had it, you are wasting your life ... I mean appetite!=)

Warm outside, cold creamy inside and it melts in your mouth. it is probably really bad for you but it tastes so freakin' good. i am a huge fan. i want one right now!..mmm.. maybe i should go get some...holidays as in never ending eating? sigh.

ok, pls. go try and you will see. My fave. is the vanilla flavor but they have chocolate, green tea flavors etc.
author: C A.

description:
Looked for a haven from the rain,
found heaven,
they filled up the cream puff...right there.

and there is a pumpkin flavour.
enough said.

so good i don't even need to be grammatically correct.
author: Lauren S.

description:
Today I tried a strawberry mousse cheesecake strip and it was a delightful set of contrasts. Diced bits of dark red strawberry sat next to chopped green pistachios atop a foamy sea of pale pink mousse, all resting on a bed of off-white cheesecake. The density of the cheesecake emphasized the airiness of the mousse, while the crunch of the nuts gave a satisfying counterpoint amidst the soft, sweet joy in my mouth. 

I've had the cream puffs, too, and yes, they are sinfully good. Seriously, you should go to confession at the historic church next door after you eat one. Then go to the gym for an hour. Or more.
author: Bill B.

description: These creme puffs are really good. The outside is nice and crisp and the inside is smooth and creamy. You have to eat them fresh or they will get soggy. I still want to try their green tea flavor but its never available when I have gone to the store. The puffs are filled with your choice of cream when you order.
author: Alexander L.

description:
My favorite is the Green Tee puffy treat.  I started going there when they opened up.  It is a messing but yummy treat.  The place is clean, the people at the counter are nice and plus you can sit outside or inside. I like the calmness of the walking promenade with all the cute shops and museum.  It is relaxing to go there.  

I was tempted to go to the one in the Shopping Mass next door, but it is a mad house, plus the mall is noisy has heck.
author: Vanilla C.

description:
I love these little divine puffs of heaven!!

I've had Beard Papa one other time in the Westfields Shopping Mall on Market Street, and I remembered it was a delicious treat. So after visiting the Contemporary Jewish Museum and stumbling upon this location in the adjacent alleyway, my friend and I just HAAAD to stop in for some puffs!

The special flavor of the week was Coffee, in addition to your usual Vanilla and Chocolate choosing. I wish they had Green Tea or Strawberry instead of Coffee, those sound yummy. What I love about these treats that they are just so light and heavenly to indulge!! The puff pastries are soft with a slight crunch, this is a good thing by adding some texture. I'm not so fond of over-buttery and sweet custards. I find the cream fillings here to be on the light (and very fresh) side, which I prefer and love. 

I can't help but smile and be joyous when eating these, even as thoughts of them immediately adhering to my waistline creep up every now and then.
author: Jing D.

description:
The words "served warm" have always been a HUGE selling point for me, so when I came into Bead Papa's and saw their tiny molten chocolate cake with those words right under the label I realized I was guided straight to dessert heaven. 

I was leaving SFMOMA and was coerced into having a dessert *EHEMyouknowwhoyouare!* 
I shrugged my shoulders and went inside without knowing what to expect.
The first thing I saw were the Vanilla Cream Puffs, "sure, why not." Then my eyes shined as I gleamed at the chocolate cake. YESSSS

The puff was a perfect complement to the rich chocolate and for about 10 minutes and less than $6 I was in ooey gooey heaven. *_*

The best part? All that walking around in SF burned off all the calories and I indulged in a guilt-free pleasure.
author: Laura G.

description:
not sure what the hype is all about...edible is the highest rating i would give...place isn't busy and the counter person still gets the order wrong.

cheesecake sticks taste like sticks - no flavor...cheesecake is supposed to taste like a guilty pleasure...

the cream puffs were more like cream bricks...dried out and tough...

maybe it was a bad day...
author: Shiawase O.

description:
It's simple, really.

Perfectly creamy vanilla bean custard + flaky light pastry dough = cream puff heaven.

In my book, warm is always better than cold so one star withheld for lack of proper temperature.
author: Kathleen M.

description: The puffs tasted great but the service is horrible. The cashier took our money and walk away without immediately placing our order onto the system. The place was not crowded at all. Just us. We waited for 15-20 minutes, so we walked up back to the counter for follow-up, then they thought it was new order to get again. Can't believe this.... They need to train their staffs much better to serve such quality dessert!!!!
author: CL C.

description: Went here for the first time after a day of Christmas shopping.  Got one vanilla cream puff and a cup of good strong french roast coffee.  Really good, my picky boyfriend even enjoyed his half of the puff.  Easy to find location so  I am so going back.
author: Jennifer D.

description: So we had dinner nearby and after you've eaten a full dinner what do you need? Well of course a sweet cream filled cream puff. They're sweet, creamy filled cream puffs. They're delicious. They are not culinary master pieces but they're really good.
author: Hyung L.

description:
How can you go wrong with these delicious Cream filled puffs? Had the Creamy Vanilla bean and the Chocolate Puff. The Vanilla was just awesome. It almost tasted like a thinned out ice cream. Light, Creamy and slight vanilla flavor,Everything a cream puff should be. I was so happy eating this cream puff.

The Chocolate Puff wasn't all that appealing to me. It tasted like they mixed in cocoa powder to the regular batch of pastry cream. I wish they would of used a real nice dark chocolate folded inside of the cream. Possibly even drizzle the top of the pastry with warm chocolate. Don't get me wrong though. It was still a solid B+ 

Good stuff! Would def come back!
author: Joseph G.

description:
They do get points for originality and for freshness, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here. When you arrive, you basically have two choices to make: regular or "cookie crunch" shells, and vanilla, chocolate, or the week's special cream filling. For the first choice, the main difference is texture; the cookie crunch is, well, crunchier than the regular. But I found them both to be rather bland. For the filling, I've tried the chocolate and the coffee (this week's special), and again I found them to be decent but rather bland.

During the busier of the two times I came here, they were stuffing the cream puffs to order. The quieter time, they had a small stockpile of each of the six combinations. I'm glad that they keep the options limited so that there is fast turnover, thus keeping their inventory fresh.
author: Adam B.

description: I've been to this place a few times and still don't understand the hype. I guess its just preference...I'm not a fan of the original cream puff or the Cookie Crum Cream Puff I tried just yesterday because it honestly was little boring to me. It's 220 calories per cream puff and if i'm going to be indulging in something like that...I prefer something a bit more decadent and unique in flavor.
author: Angela P.

description:
For those who gave Beard Papa 4 or 5 stars please don't hate me for this. =(

So being an occasional calorie counter I had to go online and check how much calories this little pastry cost my body. 

1 cream puff =
220 calories
120 fat calories
6 grams of saturated fat
22 grams of carbs!

ok ok so I guess it's really not that bad because it's not like I eat it everyday blah blah blah but still! They charged me $2.25 for a little blimp.

Maybe it's just me but I don't really like my pastries with stuff inside. For example a jelly donut, a red bean bun, custard bun, etc. I thought that there were too much cream or pudding in the cream puff. Don't get me wrong, it tasted pretty good. I think it was the guilt that made me not like it as much as I should. 

I DO want to try their tiramisu though. That thing looked good. I'm sure tiramisus are just as bad but damn they are good!
author: Tracy A.

description:
These are soo addicting and so rich. Can you say guilty pleasure? 

I don't care if they have soo many calories. I can always walk it off while eating them.

That should counteract the fattening process, right?

Delish!!!!
author: Genevieve S.

description:
I am not sure what all the fuss is about. I had the original with chocolate and the chocolate with the vanilla bean. The chocolate with vanilla was far superior. The original was bland and over filled. The cream puff was leathery in texture but the inside was nice. The leathery outside made you have to struggle for each bite which made the filling pour all over your hands. 
They were also out of coffee on a Saturday afternoon. What gives? The price was reasonable but I can cross this off my list of things that I must try and put it on my not to repeat list.
author: Tracy C.

description:
Oh Beard Papa, you crazy fisherman-looking mofo you.

What right do you have crafting such delectable pastries?  Who granted you the gift of creating such heavenly custards?  What trade ambassador brokered your safe passage on to our shores?  Some diabolical forces are surely at work.  Unregulated consumption of these cream puffs will surely undermine the very fabric of our society.

Beard Papa, my rugged purveyor of delicate treats, you only get four stars.  Your own variants of the standard cream puff, chocolate and the seasonal flavors, simply cannot hold a candle to the classic vanilla masterpiece.
author: Christopher K.

description:
Circa August 2006.. some China Basin warehouse, San Francisco, California.

The 5-HT receptors in my nervous system were mediating massive amounts of the neurotransmitter and peripheral signal mediator serotonin, molecules of which were flooding my brain in the synapses, creating an inordinate amount of euphoria. This was caused by a round shaped pill with a mitsubishi sign embedded, which I had orally ingested approximately 30 minutes ago. 

I was coming up. My fingers had a tingly feeling and there was a cold chill coming up from the spinal cord.  The cleanliness, clarity, and marvelous feeling of solid inner strength was overwhelming. I was overcome by the profundity of the experience, and how powerful it was. Pigments in the dance floor became intensified. Shapes became rounder, more organic. A sensation of lightness and rivulets of warmth began seeping through my body. Bright lights began pulsing and flashing behind my closed lids. I began to perceive waves of energy flowing through all of us in unison. I saw all of us as a gridwork of electrical energy beings, nodes on a bright, pulsating network of light.    I looked up and saw God. No beard, and his name was Paul Van Dyk. He had four turntables and was spinning a label called Politics of Dancing.  

I felt the same way when I bit into a Beard Papa's Vanilla cream puff last week.
author: Sav B.

description:
Yuuu-uuummm...holy crap, these puffs are good.  So good, in fact, that my husband and I nearly came to blows in the Metreon over them.  

I stood in line for twenty minutes to purchase my precious half dozen of these luscious babies, and the wait paid off in SPADES.    I got the last six.  The guy behind me only wanted one.  When the counter dude told him they were out, the poor sap looked like his puppy had just died...

...oh well!  So sad, too bad!  Muaaahahahahaha!  

These things are EVIL!  They are crispy choux, real vanilla bean cream filled, Satan's puffs.  They will turn you against your loved ones, make you the devil incarnate, eat your soul and devour your humanity.  For reals.  

My husband looked at my cream puff box o' six and smacked his lips.  He was boring a hole into it with his steely gaze.  I took the box and tucked it under my arm protectively, giving him the "don't mess with this psycho Korean chick, man" stare.  

Out of pity, I gave him one.  He inhaled it, licked the powdered sugar off his face, put the cream smeared wrapper in his mouth and sucked it dry.  Then, he looked at my box again.

"You gonna eat ALL of 'em?"  He asked innocently, eyes still on my box.

"Maybe."  

"Whatcha gonna do with the rest?  You can't eat 'em all..." 

"Maybe I CAN."  I said as I hugged my puff box a little tighter.

(a pause...and then a deadly two minute stare-off)

"You'd better sleep with that friggin' thing under your pillow tonight, woman."  He hissed as he glared at me with hatred.

I don't trust my husband.  If it was me and a cream puff dangling precariously off a cliff at the Grand Canyon, in real danger of plummeting to our doom, well....I'd be a stain on the floor of the Grand Canyon...sad, but true.  

It's a sad testament to the farce that is our marriage...we are an evil union of two unholy cream puff pigs at best.
author: Kristina R.

description: Delicious cream puffs.  The cake is light and fluffy and the custard is creamy and gently sweet - not sickeningly sweet.
author: Lev E.

description:
I used to be chun-ky.

Not like..."Aw cute, look at the little chub roll on the cute little baby girl".

But more like, "Is your kid gonna eat all my kids cheez-its?"

And yes, I am not ashamed to tell you that there have been times where I might have grabbed a pat of butter from that little bowl of golden delicious, snuck under the table, and licked it, like a sweet, creamy lollipop made of animal fat.

Beard Papa's kinda taste like that.  They leave a coat of fat on your tongue and eating a whole one makes me want to puke, but at the same time reminds me of the cool, calm feeling I used to get while licking a cube of butter under a dirty restaurant table, counting the wads of used gum that stealthy teenagers with bacne decided to stick there.

Would it be weird if I still had the urge to do that?

If you ever see me fingering that little bowl of butter, just look at me and say "No" firmly.

Also, don't date me.
author: Rachel G.

description:
I am a fucking disgusting pig.
Cleanse be gone, i am a mother fucking cow.
I'll call myself every farm animal name in the book if it gets my point across.  
Are sloths farm animals?
I will even drop the F-Bomb, and I try to avoid that in most my reviews.

I went for a "walk" for lunch today.  I had already eaten when my hour break came around, so i decided to go and enjoy the day.  Came across this devil spawn of a store, and thought to myself...."Self, you have never been here.  You could write a review.  You could see what the other 479 people are talking about....decide whether or not to believe the hype."

So much for the walk.

Why is it so fucking big?  Is that necessary? Can't we get enough custard in something half the size?  You know we will finish it O Beard Papa.  You help make this nation the disgusting slobs we are.  I tried you once, I am giving you 4 stars because I cant deny your deliciousness.... but mark my words.  I'm never going back.  I would much rather be a beautiful swan, than a slovenly pig and there is no way you can help me achieve that.
author: Lauren F.

description: Okay, confession time. I am not a sweets person. Give me a choice between a small bag of kettle fried chips or a triple scoop of double chocolate ice cream on a waffle cone and I'll take the chips any day. That being said, these little diet busting puffs of air, butter and flour are tasty. I wouldn't skip a meal just so I could eat a few and still avoid a closet of full of stretch band pants. Besides, the staff here is just plain spacey. Is it sugar poisoning? Is it flour overdose? Is it just poor staffing at human resources? It's god's own mystery. The other mystery is the hype. You can have the ice cream and I'll take the chips and we can both avoid this place for the calorie wasting disappointment it reallly is.
author: bongo c.

description:
Killed my hunger like a Samurai warrior.  

I don't want to think about how many calories were in that salvo, though.  I ordered a vanilla cream puff and a milk tea cream puff at the same time, so I could compare them.  I have a responsibility, you know!  

The shells were paper thin and paper crisp, without a hint of oil.  The vanilla cream had a nice custard texture to it, but the milk tea cream was all liquid.  The shells crushed in my hand as I tried to bite into them, and the powdered sugar made an impromptu snow storm all over my black clothes.  Even so, the quality of the two cream puffs was better than I found in the store at the Food Pantry in Waikiki.  

When I went in the shop was empty.  When I was done there were TEN women around me.  Am I being followed?   Or was it the cream puffs?
author: David D.

description: It's hard to say that an hour wait for a simple vanilla cream puff is worth it.....but honestly it was. Beard Papa's Cream Puffs are amazing. The vanilla cream is so rich and flavorful: almost like creme brulee in a delightful light puff pastry. Rest assured I will be back to try the green tea creme puffs.
author: Jessica T.

description:
How pathetic is it to grab a couple of these on the low down, sneak them back to your hotel room, and scarf them down before you go out to a big group dinner?

I hope not very...because I sure would miss taking refuge in the rich taste of  vanilla bean custard and might have to turn to a harder drug found in SOMA.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Beard Papa's is soooo good. Our radio station is right near by and we used to send our interns to get us boxes when we were craving something sweet. The chocolate covered vanilla bean custard cream puffs are the bomb, they have a stand in the food court of the mall too.

I highly reccomend!!!
author: Sarah A.

description:
Well, much like the annoying Pinkberry craze that is oh so tragically sweeping the taste buds of LA, I just don't get the fascination with Beard Papa's. 

For months I've been reading the "oh my god" "this is the shit!!!" "holy crap, these are amazing" "would you like my first born, Bearded Papa?" reviews and really looking forward to trying this creme-filled pastry goodness. And so while walking past this place yesterday, we decided, today's the day. Let's try this thing and see what it's all about and after months of buildup, my conclusion is....drumroll please...

A shitty waste of caloric intake and meh, not so much. 

To me, the pastry tasted stale. The vanilla creme was bland and boring. The powdered sugar was divine, but really, you'd have to be a flippin moron to mess up powdered sugar. Overall it tasted like a sad attempt at Pastry 101 and while the Japanese have created many a fantastic dish and cuisine over the decades, I just don't think baking is the winner in the strong suit category. But then again, I'm Danish, and so I was raised on some pretty good stuff, so I'm a bit, okay a lot  picky when it comes to the baked goods.

Either way, I think it's way over-hyped and I'd rather put more junk in my trunk via something really tasty than a BPCP.
author: Stephy S.

description:
I think just maybe I'll have to give this place another try. 

I haven't been back for awhile now because when I tried it both times, it wasn't really tasty..

You should NEVER, and I mean NEVER leave cream puff shells out like they do for more then a couple hours.. It gets soft and doesn't have much taste to it..

I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, and green tea before.. I think if I had to choose my favorite, it would be the vanilla. I dig the vanilla cuz there were speckles of vanilla beans in there so you know it was made with real vanilla instead of the extract stuff..

Maybe it would be better if I tried it when they had just finished baking those shells..? 

They are pretty expensive for something so mediocre.. I think now it's like $2.25 per piece!?
author: Juliane N.

description:
*knock, knock*

Me: Um yeah, excuse me can I ask you a question?

Every other yelper below me: Sure, what's up?

Me:  Can I have some of the Kool-Aid you drank?

EOYBM:  Excuse me?

Me:  Yeah can I have some of the Kool-Aid you've been drinking, because there must be something in it that I ain't gettin.

EOYBM:  What are you talking about?

Me:  Your Reviews of Beard Papa cream puffs, I mean WTF? at almost 2 bucks a pop  you must be drinking the Kool-Aid, cause I don't get the hype!

Head down to the Mission an get a crispy pastry tube filled with cream for like 65 cents.  now that's the bomb diggity!
author: A P.

description: AHHHHH! I instantly fell in love with their cream puffs at first taste.  OMG. Their perfectly flaky pastry outsides, powdery white sugared sweetness, and the vanilla bean custard filling was heaven on earth. After finishing one fist-sized cream puff, I was so tempted to run up to the lady and rush order me another 5 cream puffs, that I even did a coin toss.  Heads...I would order up another cream puff of heaven; tails...I would resist my urge to be a heifer.  I laid the quarter atop my quivering thumb...flicked up the coin...and as the flipping coin glistened in the sun, my mouth salivated for more of this cocaine of a puff. Ping, ping, ping....There on the cement ground lay the silvery imprint of an eagle. Tails...As if the eagle were mocking me...I sadly walked away, glancing back at my dear Beard Papa.
author: Chow Mein Ninj A.

description:
So yummy and sinful!  These little treats are so good when fresh!  I always go to the one near Yerba Buena because they are freshest when they come from here.  My favorite is the vanilla bean.  The chocolate cream puff is good, but not as good as the vanilla.  I've also tried the cheesecake sticks here, they are alright and also the chocolate molten cake which is very good!

This place is good on a hot afternoon.  This is the perfect light dessert!
author: Marylouise R.

description:
8- number of minutes it takes me to walk here from my office
2- number of cream puffs I normally scarf down
3- number of minutes it takes my fat a$$ to eat said cream puffs 
5- number of sizes my ass grows from eating (2) cream puffs
1000- number of crunches I must do at my local 24 Hour Fitness to work off cream puffs
1000000- number of minutes which smile on my face lasts after eating 2 chocolate cream puffs
author: Sarah W.

description:
This place is seriously overrated. If you enjoy inhaling pure butter and waiting 45 minutes for cold cream puffs that have been made, frozen, then baked off, this is the place to go. I'm a big fan of fresh baked goods, so this wasn't the place for me. The cream puffs were hard, and the custard tasted kind of artificial to me. 

I think people are a little brainwashed and have been caught up in the wave of doing the next trendy thing, without actually evaluating whether these are any good. I'd go to any of Pascal Rigo's French patisseries, or even Tartine, any day over Beard Papa's.
author: Joyce G.

description:
Amazing, fresh, still-warm cream puff was an absolute delight along with a fresh cup of strong, savory coffee midway through the afternoon (and you know sometimes when a place has a specialty pastry or other product their coffee suffers, but this was not the case.) 

Just delectible. 

What a nice little gem of a place to stumble across when you're craving something sweet and need a pick-me-up. 

It's located halfway down the block at the corner of the Marriott between 3rd and 4th on Mission across from the Metreon. 

I'm missing it already.

** Update: For my local So Cal friends, I understand there are a couple down here too - 2 in OC and one in Gardena. Go with god...
author: Krys G.

description:
Here is a play by play of my last attempt to get cream puffs here.  I strolled in because there was no line.  Score!  The flavor of the week was pumpkin and strawberry.  Score, and score!  So I went up to the counter and the woman behind the counter said something to me.  

My brain, addled by the divine eggy-vanilla aroma, could not digest what she said immediately.  The heavy machinery of thought churned slowly, with much creaking and grunting.  My happy thoughts of pumpkin and strawberry cream puffs were being swallowed up in the cogs of--er, excuse the pun--cognition like Chaplin's Tramp in "Modern Times."  Before I knew it, I heard myself saying "THIRTY MINUTES?!?!??"  But it probably sounded like Scooby Doo going "Rrrraaurwhrrr?"  The woman confirmed, yes, it's a 30 minute wait for the next batch of puffs.  I was so incredulous that I blurted out "Not worth the wait." and ran out, rejected, and ran straight to BART and went home.  

Forgive me, I didn't mean to be so rude, but I was just so taken aback by the wait time.  The wait to get a cream puff shouldn't be so disproportionate compared to the time it takes to scarf one down.  I'm surprised they don't try harder to stagger the production so there is a constant turnover of choux going in and out of the ovens.  I mean, I can make double batches of four different cookies in my podunk home oven for Xmas in one afternoon.  Papa really needs to come up with a new system to keep the choux coming!!

I do like this location better than the Westfield one because the wait is usually not as ridiculous, and on nice days, I can trot over to Yerba Buena and eat my puffs in the sun.  The cream puffs are pretty good, mostly because they're warm and fresh when you bite into it.  But I think I actually prefer the $1 giant choux creme I can get in the bread section of Niji-Ya and other Japanese markets.
author: maiko h.

description:
Shatangi had 1. Can't wait for the Green Tea version. The shell was crisp and buttery and the filling was like a slightly gelatenous creme anglaise. I got the last one of a batch and the suckers behind me had to wait for the fresh ones to cool berfore being filled (Haha!).

Shatangi told you
author: Njon W.

description:
You've heard the phrase, "Tastes so good it makes you wanna slap your mama"? Sorry Moms! Pumpkin and Green Tea options = Trouble with a capital T! Hey ladies, round in the middle can be sexy too!

I didn't have to stand in line so we'll see.
author: Mingus R.

description:
For those of you who saw me riding my bike later this afternoon, please take note that I did NOT indulge in any "cheating on the boyfriend" activities!
Honest!
That creamy white stuff adorning my upper lip was the remnants of a different kind of afternoon delight.  Specifically the vanilla bean, custard filled, cream puff variety.
So NO I am NOT cheating on my boyfriend!
Even though it does sound suspect to say that the creamy white substance all over my mouth came from Beard Papa.
author: Jill D.

description: I know you should not write a scathing review after only one bad experience, but seriously...  I just visited this location and they are out of cream puffs.  how does a place that only sells cream puffs allow themselves to run out?  and why did i have to stand in line for over 10 minutes to find that out?  if you're out, put up a sign!  so, so stupid!
author: Bette K.

description:
Have you ever had home made cream puffs? These suck almost as much as the ones in the frozen section. I think my underbaked ones filled with strawberry cool whip tasted better. 
A couple of times their cream tasted like flour. 
Not that I'm a cream puff chef extraordinaire, but in a cream puff its supposed to feel poofy. The shell is supposed to hold the delicious goodness and feel like a cloud. The exetrior of the shell is supposed to be crisp and not hard - and the inside should be airy fluff, not chewy or breadlike. The inside filling is not supposed to be heavy and make the shell droop to one side, but not taste like whipped cream (beard papa's do not taste like whipped cream).  Well that's how I like them.

I do appreciate the creative new-school flavors, they are delicious.
author: Cheryl D.

description:
These cream puffs can KILL.

As you breathe in to take a bite of these baked little biatches, you might choke on the powdered sugar that's drenched all over this evil, Beard Papa, pastry shell.

Eat cautiously and buy life insurance.
author: Faffy L.

description:
I'm so glad I didn't try Beard Papa's until a few hours before I headed home.  If I did I'm sure I would have gained five pounds instead of losing five pounds while on vacation.  I definitely would have HAD to try each cream puff and each eclair.  What I tried was OMG SO amazingly delicious, a pure party in my mouth; I got it all over myself so it must have been good, right?  I was cursing you all the way to the airport over the sadness of knowing it will be a long time before I could become one with the Beard Papa cream puff once again...

Lo and behold when I arrived back in Seattle I checked their website http://www.beardpapa.com/main.php?nav=locations) to see where the closest Beard Papa's was to me and found out that sometime this month there is going to be one in Uwajimaya and at Safeco Field, this just made things so much more exciting for me!  Cream puffs and baseball can it get any better than that people?  I don't think so.
author: Me H.

description:
I love sweet, puffy sugar things.  I love them so soooo much that typing this review I'm drooling.

But I don't love Beard Papa's.  It's cute.  And the puff flavors all sounded amazing.  But my green tea puff had almost no flavor.  My friend agreed that it had no umph.  We actually threw out half of it because it was so unsatisfactory.
author: Katie S.

description:
Beard Papa.......I like creme puffs for the most part its one of those things where i'll eat one and then don't really feel like eating anymore.

Anyhoo my Mom brought me over a box with Vanilla bean, Chocolate and Strawberry creme puffs. They were pretty good The pastry was very light and smooshy and the filling was pretty good. I think it could've used a little bit more powdered sugar. 

Either way  I think they are okay.. But for the price You can get a Cupcake from Karas and its wayyy  better!
author: Nette A.

description:
You know how some places are so good that you think about them all the time, but know that you shouldn't go all the time?  Beard Papa is one of those places.  In a perfect world, we could eat cream puffs every day.  In reality, no one should.

Beard Papa vanilla cream puffs represent cream puff perfection.  Oh, the double-layered shell is light, delicate and flaky.  You can taste the quality of the rich vanilla custard cream.  Piping in the cream keeps the shell crispy.  Beard Papa has cream puff making down.  The recipe is 200 years old and I imagine it has only gotten better and more consistent over time with the advances in cooking technology.   I know these puffs are not healthy, but they are fresh n' natural :-)

They have some seasonal flavors to keep things interesting.  I'd like to try pumpkin whenever that comes back.  I tried the green tea.  For some reason, that green tea cream was too runny.  I also tried the chocolate which was good, but vanilla (the original) is the best flavor.  

I love the Beard Papa mascot; he reminds me of Papa Smurf. Cute name too - very Japanese.  I loved the Beard Papa story: http://www.muginohousa.com/main.php?nav=the_beard_papas_story

It's cute how he smokes while he's baking.  He's never without his pipe.

Also, the puff doesn't keep well.  It gets soggy.  Eat it right after you purchase it.  This location is larger and better than the one inside the mall (Westfield Shopping Center).
author: Lolia S.

description:
After months of walking past this place and hearing all the hype, I finally got to try one of these bastards when my friend brought a couple of boxen to a party at my house.

Interesting.  I've always been a pate a choux connosseiur, cream puffs being one of the first things my mom's best friend (my real mom, as the three of us always joke) taught me how to bake.  This isn't quite pate a choux, but it's damn fine shellcrustdoughbatter. 

On the other hand, I had the vanilla bean filling, and while I love cream and I love vanilla flavor, I was summarily not impressed.  This was custard!  Way too thick and way too much of it.  I ate the crust and left a big glob of filling with no regrets.

So now I can say I've tried them and if I were stoned, I'd probably like them more, but I really prefer to saunter over to Whole Foods and pester their bakery people to bring their cream puffs back, as I am wont to do every few weeks.

Oh wait, I was stoned.

EDIT:  I gotta eat my words and add a star...the chocolate cream puffs are fucking TITS.  Not the ones dipped in chocolate, the regular ones with cocoa powder on top.  And Whole Foods brought their cream puffs back since my last diatribe.  All is right in the world.
author: Frankie D.

description:
A store that only sells cream puffs? I was intrigued. They must be super-amazing-orgasm good, right? Not really.

I went to the Bloomingdale's Beard Papa first--where they only sell vanilla, chocolate, and chocolate eclair flavors. But I noticed this location on Mission was bigger and had specialty flavors so I gave it a shot too.

They rotate the specialty flavors each week and the ones I can remember off the top of my head are pumpkin and green tea. Pumpkin flavor BTW was bleh. I'd rather have a pumpkin pie. Stick with the vanilla or chocolate.

As far as cream puffs go, I like that they are fresh but they are so big that eating them is a HUGE MESS. I guess this would be ok if you have that fetish where you like to be covered in food. I don't. The chocolate eclairs are even messier. I practically needed to take a shower after eating one of those.

In summary, good cream puffs but not good enough to crave. They're comparable to the frozen cream puffs that Trader Joe's sells.
author: Cindy P.

description:
OK. I go to school across the street.
Lord help us, at school they're teaching industry pattern drafting for size zero, and across the street they're teaching how to eat a cream puff on your break, puke it up, and still fit into that zero! Any questions?

If you do keep it down, just know that they come chilled, and should either be shared, eaten on the spot in spite of a tummyache, or othewise don't get the chocolate, as it hella melts.
I don't care personally for the chocolate filling (and if you've read my other reviews, that's pretty much what I write about)...so get the vanilla with the brown stuff on the outside! 
Beard Papa. Such a weird name.
author: Amelia P.

description:
Krys G you are responsible for the fact that I FINALLY caved in.  Your review put me over the top.  I couldn't stop myself.  Really I couldn't.  

I gave my family a story about free art museums and dragged them into the city for some culture (and surprise cream puffs).  

You know which came first.

While the filling was deliciously rich, it was also very runny.  And the pastries were cold and not-so-fresh.  They need a sign for the window that says "WARM" on one side....and "MEH" on the other.  

I guess our timing was off with BP's.  But the free museums were great!
author: Linda M.

description:
[[[ Rap to the tune 'Big Poppa' by Notorious B.I.G ]]]

I love to eat the Puffs at Beard Papa
[With the shell double-layuh to vanilla bean flavuh]

I love to eat the Puffs at Beard Papa
[To the Asians makin' pastries like the French ancestries]

I love to eat the Puffs at Beard Papa
[If you got a hunger in your waist
Please don't eat at some other place
Cause I see some creme puffs just right
Who should be up in my belly
Bel-ly

-------
Seriously, though.  This shiz is the bomb.
The staff was extremely accommodating as well.  We called from where we were having dinner to make sure they were still open.
They weren't (they had closed 30 minutes earlier), BUT they held back some puffs for us.

Not sure why they have the name Beard Papa, perhaps it's a Japanese thing (that's where they got their start)
I'm going to call them Puff Daddies from now on.
author: Chris M.

description:
A little piece of this lactard's heaven.  So thick, so creamy.  It's like they giftwrapped creme brulee in a flaky golden shell.

Pass me dem tums.
author: Melissa S.

description:
Good gawd! Why didn't I discover this place sooner?! Better late than never I guess. I'm a sucker for cream puffs. Beard Papa's cream puffs are truly scrumptious. I've only had vanilla bean so far, and the cream was the best ever. I can't wait to try all of their other flavors.

(This review bites...I'm all out of funny for the day.)
author: Anastasia B.

description: Why would anyone waste calories on this dessert?  I stopped by for a coffee and could not resist trying one of their treats.   What I got:  A liquidy custard inside a puff pastry with a topping that tasted less like rich chocolate than it should have.  Worse, there was no whipped cream involved!  Vinyl forks unsuited to the task were the final disappointment.
author: Lynn S.

description:
A hidden little place near the Metreon.  I bought a half dozen vanilla, as other flavors are NOT AVAILABLE yet.  They told me the chocolate one will be available after Memorial Day.  Other flavors will include caramel, green tea, and some others.  Eclairs will be available soon too.

Anyway, they are a good size puff, and not too sweet.  I brought some to work only for my favorite women here.  Especially the one who will bring me my paycheck.  Gotta favor that one!  My roommate stole one from me in the middle of the night and was waiting as I exited the bathroom after my shower this morning.  Since I am the only one who knows where this place is, I have to bring them home more often ... yeah right.  

Anyway, enjoy them cold from the fridge.  They are maddeningly addicting, and very good!  Custard oozing out all over.  Great with a good strong cup of coffee!
author: Michael M.

description:
Fluffy, decadent cream puffs. One of those things that I'll know that I'll be obsessing over and will head directly to the door of Beard Papa on my next trip to San Francisco. Unless they ship those bad boys out to other states. But I"m guessing not, due to the delicate nature of the cream puff. 

Good thing I don't actually live near one of these, because I could quickly foresee this becoming a daily ritual. The breakfast, lunch and dinner puff. 

I only got to try the chocolate (probably bad form to take one of each from the box my coworkers passed around) but it was enough to convert me. Forever. To a cream puff, Beard Papa obsessing person. 

I. Want. Another. Puff.
author: Deanna J.

description:
I love it when you call me Beard Papa, put your hands in the air, like you's a true playa.  

Beard Papa is no such playa.  His cream puffs are wiggitty wack.  I do not like them.

(Yes, Bella W. did use the same Biggie line.  I couldn't pass it up though.)
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Cheap and delicious!

downside: a bit too sweet and the calories are off the chart!!!!!!! =/
author: Banannie E.

description:
Pre-Yelp, I was oblivious to the Beard Papa phenomenon, but having read so many reviews I made a note to try one the next time I was downtown.  Since my trip to Bloomingdale's coincided with a raging sweet tooth attack, today was the day.  Some of the flavors of the day looked interesting, but I went with a regular vanilla cream puff.  I wasn't blown away, but I wasn't disappointed, either.  It's a sweet treat - nothing more, nothing less.  I wouldn't cross town just for a cream puff, and I wouldn't wait longer than five minutes in line for one (OK, maybe ten minutes), but I liked it.  The pastry part was flakey, and the inside was very creamy.  You definitely want to eat them right away so they don't get soggy, but that's just as well, since the last thing I need is the temptation to take home a box of these puppies.
