When I arrived a nice lady said yes you can choose from the chocolate or the plain and I could also choose what filling flavors I wanted. They were all so tasty :)
author: Karen T.

description:
Creamy Vanilla Bean cream puff! 

LOVE LOVE LOVE this sweet treat. 

the eclair was so so. I will try the flavored cream puffs next time.
author: Lady O.

description:
Crispy creme puffs - what else needs to be said?? I was bored and was reading SF GATE. I stumbled across an article. My only dislike of creme puffs is they are rarely fresh in the states and by the time I get them they're usually soggy and too rich on the inside. 

I don't know how they do it but man those damn things are crazy addictive. The vanilla ones are great but my favourite on es are carmel and strawberry. Mmm... good.
author: Ceci L.

description: Service pretty quick because doesn't take long to name the puffs they fill it with creme for you on the spot
author: Veranna N.

description:
Logo reminds me of a hybrid of cute Papa Smurf & the guy on the fish sticks package...

I love the *mildy sweet*-fresh-light Vanilla cream puffs.  I've tried the chocolate one, but my palette prefers the Vanilla.

Eating these makes me want to skip along the rolling green lawns of Yerba Buena Gardens singing La-la-la-la-la-la...(insert Smurf theme song)...
author: Cathy K.

description:
SOMEbody keeps bringing home boxes of these things - ahem, you want your petite woman or a bloated dirigible here?

I'm not saying these are anything fantastically special or new, but I like vanilla custard so it is really hard for me not to take to these sweet crusty pucks of goodness. 

I think I'm pudding on some weight from them though, curse you Beard Papa!  *shakes first covered with crumbs and remnants of cream*
author: GIR ..

description:
Cream puffs weren't even on my radar before Beard Papa.  But dang people, honestly, the praise for this Japanese cream puff chain could never be played out.  For real.  And their trademark "Beard Papa" (yellow hatted, fluffy gray bearded pipe smoker) is totally cute even if it is the most random.

I've tried the vanilla and the green tea puffs.  Both were absolutely phenomenal.  The green tea custard took me to heaven and back.  It tasted like the highest quality green tea ice cream in a warmer creamy goodness form with detectable hints of vanilla bean.

They have five rotating flavors of the week - green tea, milk tea, pumpkin, caramel and strawberry.  I just wish I could know the flavor in advanced of arrival.  But I guess the suspense is part of the experience.

And they use quality dairy products -- I know, like you can't taste it.  But evidence was had as I was waiting in line for my puff last Friday as the milk man was wheeling in carton upon carton of Clover milk and cream.
author: Sharon R.

description:
Hello, my name is Jenny, and I'm a Cream Puff addict.  

It started last Friday when I sunk my teeth into the the two-layer puff shell.  The first layer, an outer piecrust shell, had the the perfect amount of crunch and then the inner choux shell continued to tease my senses.  But even then the journey was just beginning... once I finally reached the center, I was greeted by the vanilla whipped cream custard that had the perfect amount of creamy sweetness.

I can't remember what happened from there, but ever since my first taste I can no longer sleep, I've lost my job and have to have a cream puff fix at least once a day.  

I've looked on their website and while it states Beard Papa's cream puffs contain no preservatives, I'm convinced there's something in the powder sugar they gingerly sprinkle as a finishing touch.  That's right, the powder sugar... the powder sugar...
author: Jenny S.

description:
I love it when you call me Beard Papa
Put your hands in the air if yous a true playa
I love it when you call me Beard Papa
'Cause I see some ladies tonight who should be eating my cream puffs, baby.
author: Jackie I.

description:
Pretty lame.

I could make better cream puffs at home.  I'm willing to bet on it.  
These are totally overrated.
author: Christy T.

description:
This "Cream Puffs" filled with CUSTARD brings me back some childhood memories of my grandma's chocolate custard filled puffs.  I especially LOVE the GREEN TEA flavor, 1 out of 5 of their "flavor of the week".  Call ahead to find out what week is the green tea week.

Note:  Puffs generally made with loads of yolks.  Those watching your cholesterol levels beware.
author: A T.

description:
My time first eating Beard Papa's Cream puffs was in LA while I was on vacation with my daughter. They had alot of different cream favors.

I got more excited when I found out they have one here in the bay area!!

They have the best cream puffs so far!! YUMMMMMMMMy!! =D
author: Nancy C.

description:
I've never been here. Judging from the reviews, though, these puffs o' custard are either divine clouds of joy or the pastry equivalent of the pet rock.

I'll be the optimist and give them a 5 for flavor and a negative 4 for all the review hubris. 

Total: 1 star.
author: James E.

description:
Now, there is an amusing tale associated with these lovely puffs. 

Beginning with the road trip from work that my co-worker Gina and I decided to take one afternoon and ending with a confrontation.

So I drop Gina off to make her sweet, puffy purchase and rather than being "that girl who double parks", I decided to aimelssly drive around the block wasting gas and destroying the environment. I swing around once, noooo Gina....Hmm...swing around again, weird..must be a long line.....Third times the charm, no Gina...oh CRAP, it is starting to pour rain. WTF? Swing around one more time, drive by too fast to roll down my window and yell at Gina who is standing on the corner cradling the box of puffs. Oh for the love of Pete could this be any more difficult??? So as a result, I lean over to try to grab my phone to call Gina to let her know I am coming and almost proceed to run people off the road and into the Metreon....uh oh..no phone..hmm this is problematic.
Don't worry folks, this story ends happily with Gina and I finally finding eachother and me being able to cradle my own box of Beard Puffy Puffs. YUM.
But it continues....

So I go home, put them in the fridge and over a hectic holiday schedule leave to go home for the holiday weekend and forget those lovely little puffs. Oh well, I guess I can eagerly look forward to having them when I get back into town.

SCENE:

KK: "ooooh yay I have cream puffs! How exciting"

*scramble to open box, suspicious face appears as I realize the box is a little too light*

KK" wait! where is the other one?? hmm..."

*pick up second cream puff, look at it as it seems to be smashed in...open the wrapper...*

KK: " Oh my god..what the hell?!?!?"

* my last  cream puff has a large chunk of it missing, as if someone had taken a bite out of it and PUT IT BACK INTO THE BOX*

KK: "Josh? Did you um have some of my cream puffs?"

JOSH:" uhh yeah, well I was all alone for Christmas and um, you know, I was hungry"

KK: " But Josh...you TOOK A BITE OUT OF IT AND PUT IT BACK IN THE BOX"

JOSH: " I saved you some, doesn't that count?"

And that my friends is the tale of my experience with Beard Papa's Cream Puffs. I was robbed, but at least it was nice to give my roommate a bit of  holiday joy. 

He did say however that they were quite tasty.
author: Kathy K.

description: I love the chocolate eclairs with the crispy, airy puff pastry, smooth and rich vanilla custard and the thick chocolate shell on top.  Thank goodness it is pricey otherwise I would stop by more often.
author: Wilhelm Y.

description: It smells good upon entering.  It's filled with promises of lightly crunchy puff and a beautiful vanilla custard filling.  Nicely paired with a hot tea on a slightly windy afternoon.   I don't understand how Japanese people stay so skinny.
author: Shinny L.

description: They got the best strawberry cream puff.  It's not too creamy or sweet and you can taste strawberry.  The other flavors are fine as well but I only go when you have strawberry available.
author: Bob S.

description: I am in love with their puffs filled with custard and cream! I used to eat puffs gome made when I was a child and lived in Europe. The quality for Beard Papa is excellent!!! It brings me back to my childhood! They are so "Europian". if I may say so :-) I wish their business more and more years of prosperity and wellness!
author: Helen T.

description:
So I went today at lunch time to finally give this place a try, I am happy to say it was good, but it dose not make me crazy! There was no line when I was there, so I ordered and had my CP in like 1 minute. 
I was surprised how runny the filling was. Maybe I'm just use to the frozen ones from Price Club.
I would eat these again. Maybe they would be fun for a B-day or wedding shower.  But, I sure would not wait in a line for more than 5 Min's!!
author: Lisa A.

description:
I really tried to like this place because I love their cute little mascot and sweets, but it simply didn't meet my standards. 

If you like cream puffs you will be disappointed by this place - they are big but they are pretty empty. I find that usually people that love it have never experienced real cream puffs. In their defense I have only tried the vanilla cream puffs.

The coffee is pretty bad too, it reminds me of starbucks coffee, too bitter. I had to really fill it with sugar to appreciate it. 

1 star because they are clean
2 because the service is always pleasant

I only come here when a friend wants to and if I can't persuade them otherwise. Not absolutely terrible, but not very good either.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
UPDATE: after my beard papa's visit in boston and my previous one in sf, it's really nothing to rave about. being a dessert lover AND knower, this wouldn't be the thing that i would pack on the pounds for. safeway chocolate cream puffs are WAY better....and only $2 for 2!

**************************************
sadly the highly anticipated cream puffs was not love at first bite. it might have been the hype or that i was just so darn full from lunch at grand cafe to fully enjoy but yeah, it was just AIGHT. still good but nothing spectacular. like a lot of people mentioned, their assembly line is so UNnecessary but props to them for creating more jobs for the economy. we came on a wed afternoon around 2:30 pm and luckily no line but we did get the last dozen before waiting around for 15 minutes for the next round.
author: Jane Y.

description:
I first discovered these tasty little cream puffs when I was in Japan about 3 years ago.  At that particular Beard Papa (and all other Beard Papas in Japan I'm assuming), it was the first time I tried all the "special" flavors like green tea, chocolate, strawberry because they had all at once ... YAY (shared with family of course cuz I am no piggy... ok maybe I am but these were damn good so leave me alone) and the best part was that there was no ginormous line.  The pastry is light and fluffy and the filling perfect...not too sweet.  I was super excited to find another Beard Papa in Taipei, Taiwan (level B1 at Sogo dept store) and delighted to learn that they too have tasty puffs but alas, no special flavors. 

Imagine my delight in NYC frolicking around NYU to find ANOTHER Beard Papa....with green tea filling as well! SCORE!  Introduced my Beard Papa virgin friends to them and they were hooked.  So of course I had to go to the SF Beard Papa when I heard about them and I took my parents along, who are also big fans.  It was good... albeit a tad disappointing.  It was too soggy for our tastes... maybe we'd been spoiled by the other Beard Papas, but somehow this one didnt quite live up to our expectations.  But I'm willing to give it another go...this time with my bf who isnt as picky ;)
author: Peggy W.

description:
I was born without a sweet tooth.  

Despite that, Beard Papa's Cream Puffs were pleasing enough to my palate to keep me awake last night.  I kicked myself to sleep, pissed that I had only bought one cream puff ... just to taste.  I'm such a fool.

The puff itself had a nice crispy exterior, was of a light consistency but had enough body to contain perfectly the cool and creamy vanilla bean custard.  I loved that the custard didn't taste gritty, fatty, or sugary.

Next time, I'll have to get cream puffs to go.  These are the perfect dessert for non-dessert people.  Yum!
author: Jenny K.

description:
I was hesitant when a friend first gushed to me about this place. I was all - dude, a cream puff is a cream puff. There's no way you're getting me to pay that much for a dinky little pastry with some vanilla cream in the middle.

But, I've been put in my place. A cream puff is certainly not a cream puff. Beard Papa's is on a plane all its own. They are not dinky or little. And its not just vanilla, you can go crazy with chocolate, strawberry, or one of the seasonal flavors.

The only thing that bothers me is the name. Shouldn't it be "BeardED Papa's"? I know they're Japanese cream puffs but the name is in English. Proof read people.

Also, they opened a location at the new mall in the food court where the lines aren't nearly as bad. Pick up a box when you're out shopping. Your family/ roommates will love you for it.
author: Taylor E.

description:
Just adding to the chorus here.

After a pot-luck lunch with some work friends (pork ribs, shrimp patties, meatloaf, stuffing, lentils with sausage), we decided the appropriate ending was a green tea cream puff from Beard Papa.  Besides, the few blocks of walking would aid our digestion.

It's wonderful: some light choux pastry with cream, all dusted over with some green tea powder sugar.  And it's a joy to watch the puff pastry move down the short assembly line, anticipating the puff pastry that will land in my grubby clutching hand.

Here's an anomaly: the green tea cream puff is perfect with strong coffee.

So, my favorites would be:
vanilla
green tea
double chocolate

Stay away from Milk Tea.  It's floury.

And there's even more good food for me later in the day.  Yelp Korean Chicken Night!  Yay, gluttony!
author: Sooj O.

description:
The little man with the beard and pipe can't help but lure me in... 

Why must I lose every time? I simply can't help it. 

I don't think their "weekly" flavors are really "weekly." I walk by all the time and it's the SAME flavor. PUMPKIN. Why pumpkin? I don't know. I thought pumpkin was only in season in the fall. But they ALWAYS have pumpkin when I walk by. I'm waiting for something more exciting like green tea... until then green tea cream puff....
author: Aromy X.

description: After a looooong day at a conference nearby I was looking for a sweet treat - Yelp did not let me down. $3 for 2 giant cream puffs - not overly sweet, just... perfect. You can actually see the specs of vanilla bean in the vanilla. If you are in the area, make a point to stop by. This will be a must-visit every time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Kristin F.

description:
This place has the best name I've ever heard.  Papa must have a lot of cream, and a lot of beard.

Update: OK.  I just ate there yesterday.  These are sooooo goooood. Not too sweet, light and flaky without being dry.  I want to eat one now.  Big ups to Masaki for buying 6 of them to share.
author: Mark W.

description:
Green tea (a seasonal flavor in San Francisco) or vanilla cream puffs definitely hit the spot after a day of shopping or walking in the city.  One star taken off for the flakiness of the puff, but perhaps I'm biased after having the ultimate cream puff (a creamy, thick cream puff that only has about 2000 calories per puff) at a Vietnamese pho place in Seattle for years.  

I'd say Beard Papa hits the spot in terms of puffs!. :D
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
love this one ;-)

this is one of the many surprise "uwi" that i get from Tb.

I love the vanilla but he always makes it a point to get me the chocolate too.

Carlos loves them too.
author: Malou C.

description:
This place is fantastic.  The cream puffs taste delicious, they make great gifts, and out-of-town guests go crazy for them.  This is not something that you find just anyhwere...maybe in Japan.

I especially like the cheesecake sticks and eclaires.  The flavors change regularly and they add new items from time to time.  This place is absolute must at least once.  

This is another location that I walk to, so I am not sure where to park if driving.  The Metreon parking lot is the closest paid option.
author: Ryan W.

description:
I'm so not hip.  I didn't know anything about this place.  We were up at the MOMA today on a field trip and this one Mom said I'm going to find that Japanese cream puff place.  Not wanting to go home, I followed her. We found it easily.  She waited in line while the rest of us watched the kids run around.
After about 30 minutes she was back with a dozen.  We each had one, then two as the kids really didn't like them. Lucky me, I got three since neither of my kids liked them. :-p
Super yummy!  Love the crunchy flaky pastry and the custard filling.  Would've been the world's be eclair if only there were some chocolate.  
Was wondering...do you think I could buy just the pastries and fill them with ice cream at home???? Yum!
author: Jen E.

description:
When I first heard Beard Papa was coming to San Francisco, I was very excited. By all accounts, their cream puffs were supposed to be the best cream puffs around, with the Japanese tailored taste improving the already yummy European cream puff. I'd heard stories about people who'd brave the lines in New York to bring home a container of Beard Papa's for their friends.

I had not gotten a chance to get out to Beard Papa when it opened. Then last night, I found myself in the city and my friend asked me if we wanted to stop by Beard Papa's. I immediately said yes and we found ourselves at Yerba Buena Lane. The line wasn't too long -- only four or five people in front of us on a Thursday night. I got myself a cream puff and then purchased a box of 6 ($10) for my husband and friend who were at home. My friend purchased half a dozen specialty cream puffs -- green tea -- for about $12.

Truthfully, I found the puff a bit wanting. The fabled double-layer pastry -- choux and pie crust -- didn't live up to my expectations. For something so highly touted, I would have expected a more delectable crust, slightly chewy from the choux with a little bit of bite and body from the pie crust. I don't know if mine weren't as fresh out of the oven but they were lacking in the flavor and the texture category, with the pie crust adding an unexpected bit of salt which really threw me off. The sprinkling of powdered sugar did very little to enhance the flavor.

The whipped cream custard, so proudly advertised as having lots of vanilla beans in it, was similarly lacking. The taste of the custard was not too sweet and tasted more like sweet cream with the body of a very light custard. I found it much "flatter" than I normally like my cream puffs. I found very few vanilla beans but moreover, I couldn't taste them at all. The green tea puffs had a much more pronounced flavor in the custard.

Don't get me wrong -- the cream puffs are good and there are certainly MUCH worse cream puffs to be had in the Bay Area. But don't believe the hype. These cream puffs are NOT godlike and they certainly are NOT worth a special trip into the city.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Here's my story for Beard Papa's:  Picture this, it's a lovely saturday morning.  I'm on my way to the Ritz Carlton to pick up a client who was heading back.  My car is just for their luggage.  The clients were sitting in another car.   So I'm driving past Mission and Third going up to Stockton and think to myself:

Self:  Man I should have factored in some time so that I could grab some of those Cream Puffs I've heard so much about.  

I get up to the Ritz and put in a phone call notifing the proper people that I'm in the area, and they've just started eating breakfast and that they would be ready in about 30-45 minutes.  Now, I had a decision to make..  Breakfast at the Ritz, or Cream Puffs.    Seeing that I wasn't in proper "Dining Room @ Ritz Carlton" attire, I decided to rush down to Yueba Buena to grab some puffs.     

Wanted to park at the Jessie Street Garage (underneath the Four Seasons) but decided itwas too expensive so backed out of the garage and headed over to the Fifth and MIssion garage.   

Parked the car on the 2nd floor next to the stairs and ran down the stairs, across the street to Beard Papas and there wasn't even a line.   I was amazed at all the employees needed for those 6 puffs.    This job of filling the custard with creamy goodness could be done by one person.  

I ended up buying 6, since it came with a nice carrying case, plus I could eat more than 1, ran back to my car, paid the $2.50 for parking 10 minutes and make it just in time to pick up the luggage.  

Cream puffs were delicious and definately warrants a return visit.
author: Herb C.

description:
I had these for the first time last week while on vacation in Oahu.  I didn't know they existed at all let alone were available in San Francisco.  Then last night I saw a guy walking down Mission with a Beard Papa's box and chased him down to find out where he got them.  

These things are not only delicious on day one but remain delicious 3 days later.  Mmmmm.
author: Jess H.

description:
Beard Papa... It's kind of weired name, isn't it?
But it doesn't matter! 
The puffs are sooo good! Addictive!

So crispy and crunchy out side. so light....
Inside is not too whippy and not to custardy. Perfect!
I like the Vanilla the best!

It's from Japan. So I can't argue with that either. Haha!
author: Green Mango Y.

description:
I love Beard Papa.  Once in a while, I allow myself one and i savor every single little bite.  

They have lots of other stuff here too and different flavors for the cream puffs other than the usual vanilla and chocolate but you can never go wrong with a vanilla cream puff...  DROOOL
author: Tiffany J.

description:
I LIKE IT WHEN YOU CALL ME BEARD PAPA!
Read Deb K's excellent review for the accurate lowdown on this place.
I am withholding one star because:
1) they don't open until 10am, too late for me to pick up a fresh dozen for my coworkers in the financial district. What bakery opens at 10 AM? 
2) not being fully stocked on all creamy flavors for their grand opening
3) on my visit, it took two people to seal a box of creampuffs: one to hold the box flaps down, and another to apply the scotch tape. We're not talking brain surgery here, people...come on.
DESPITE THESE MINOR COMPLAINTS, ITS EXCELLENT. GO, BUY, EAT. RIGHT NOW!!!
author: Johnny O.

description:
I can't say it's the "Best Cream Puff in the World," but they were pretty damn good! It's hard to have just one. It was worth it walking there in the pouring rain just to get a taste of these creamy, puffy calorie bombs. The only drawback was that everything on the menu (except the regular cream puff) was "coming soon." I can't wait till they start serving the different flavors.

Also, is it just me or does the Beard Papa mascot look a bit like Papa Smurf?
author: Hue L.

description:
These creme puffs are DIVINE. 

Love their mascot too. (What does a bearded papa have to do with pastries?)
author: Vince M.

description:
I had no idea that this chain originated in Japan.  The more useless knowledge you accrue...the more you'll be able to impress people when you act as a Trivia machine contestant at Dave & Busters.

I'm starting to run out of synonyms for "mediocre".

The pastry shell is indeed _________  (being more dense than flaky like it should be), but the cream itself is glorious.  It's so smooth and refreshing that it quenched my thirst.

I have yet to try their eclairs and cream puff flavors other than chocolate.
author: Momo R.

description:
An ode to Beard Papa's Cream Puffs...

YOU FUCKING ROCK!!!

Ok...I'm obviously not good at writing ode's...though in all honesty, I'm not sure what makes an ode...well, an ode.

Anyways, it's good. I wish that they had more flavors though. I mean, EVERYTIME I come there, it's always "Green Tea week" and I'm like, "Really? REALLY?" I wonder if anyone ever orders that flavor. I mean, come on...why not just MAKE the caramel an everyday flavor. Now that would be all out goodness.

This place is wonderful though. I don't think there was ever a time when I left here disappointed. I mean, it's that good. If you've never bearded your papa...you're missing out on an orgasmic experience.

Orgasmic people...come on...you can't beat that...well, you could...but not with cream puffs...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Oh my precious....my precious cream puff. I do not want to share you with anyone!
I am a giver and I love to share, but I dont like to share my cream puff and I will NOT share my bombolinis either. I learn from my mistakes ya kno. 

One time my hubby wanted "just a bite" of my cream puff, and then I found that only a third of it was left....oh I was not pleased. Much like the incident when he wanted to "just try" my bombolini and then after realizing how AWESOME it was, he asked for ANOTHER bite. HRMPH! No no, that will not do. He now gets his own cream puff, because one is barely enough for me as it is.
author: Diana S.

description:
Decadence in a small delicious form. The double chocolate is my top choice, followed by a regular vanilla cream puff. They got it right the first time.

Beard Papa, you can fill my mouth with your creamy goodness any day. I'll even pay you.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Maybe it's the overwhelming smell of eggs, or the idea of having something incredibly indulgent, but whenever I hear the name "Beard Papa" I can't help but jumping around like a little school girl and chanting "bread papa, beard papa, beard papa"

Sure, sure, there are better places to get pastries in San Francisco, but this place is endearing and their vanilla cream puffs make me melt just a little bit.
author: Allyson S.

description:
This is the first time I've ever walked into a food joint and ordered by quantity instead of menu item. While there were several different items on the menu, only one of them wasn't plastered over with a big "Coming Soon" sticker, a la the giant sticker that was visible outside of the establishment for about a month before the grand opening.

I missed the grand opening by over a week, and I'm glad: my entire lunch-break visit was about 5 minutes long, and I left with two warm, flaky pastries filled with cold, delicate vanilla custard.

Beard Papa's is definitely worth stopping by if you're in the neighborhood -- the creme puffs put a nice, refreshing gourmet spin on the ever-reliable creme-filled donut we're all so familiar with. But don't bother picking them up to eat later -- if you can't consume them while they're still warm on the outside, cold on the inside, you're not getting what you've paid for. Fresh and on-the-spot is the way to go here.
author: Danny D.

description:
Boy oh Boy, Beard Papa, Beard Papa what a Joy!!! :D

I LOVE Beard Papa. . . the name is cute, the logo is cute . .. damn, am I using the word "cute"? Oh well, anyway, those cream puffs rock!!! 

Before I went to BP I hadn't had a cream puff in almost 5 years. Though they have been a favorite of mine since I was a kid, I try to stay away from too many sweets and I hadn't really run across a worthwhile cream puff until I saw BP. 

When I walked in I felt like a little kid again. . . I was practically dancing and hopping around in anticipation of getting my wonderful cream puff. When I finally got it I took a big whiff and that eggy wonderful delicious smell transported me back to my childhood. Then I took a huge bite of that chocolate covered pastry and it was like I was floating on a cloud. Bless these people for making something so good, so tastey and with the ability to make me sooo happy. I couldn't stop smiling as I walked up Mission street with my BP cream puff in one hand and a napkin in the other. . . I know I probably looked like that big grinning Yahoo! emoticon because people kept staring at me on the street like I was some kind of freak OR maybe it was the fact that I got some of that whip cream on my nose and didn't know it! lol! 

Anyway, treat yourself right and have a delicious Beard Papa cream puff ASAP!
author: David R.

description:
Not bad, Beard Papa's!

Clean and organized place with friendly staff. The cream puffs were definitely yummy. (I was a cream puff virgin before my friends dragged me here!) I think the best way to describe a cream puff from Beard Papa's is "light". 

Yum! :3
author: M J.

description:
I tried this place in Beijing without any knowledge of the one here in San Francisco and thought it was great. To tell the truth, I only recently stumbled across the one downtown and have yet to try it. Maybe it doesn't play well for some folks here in SF because it's not balls hot here like it is in Beijing. Or maybe some people just aren't used to the more subtle flavors found in certain Asian desserts.

Whatever the case, give this place a shot if you're in the area. They're cheap, bite-sized, and they'll probably give you a cream-covered smile. 

You perverts.
author: Justin M.

description:
Yes, yes lots of hype. Yes, lots of mixed reviews. No, I didn't wait in a long line.

5 stars for delivering on the hype of the vanilla bean puff. 5 stars for being really fresh. 1 star removal for screwing up my order (how hard can bagging puffs be?)
author: Christine V.

description:
Stopped by for Puffy goodness, waited in line for 15 minutes, was told that the next 30 puffs would be handled and the next batch wouldn't be ready for 30 more minutes. All while illegally parked waiting for your madagascar vanilla injected goodness? Damn you Beard Papa! I know your puffs are worth it from a previous trip to New York, but I can't sit in a tow-zone waiting right now!!

* review subject to change upon Puffs.
author: Andrew L.

description: I have been wanting to try this for the longest time.  So I rewarded myself for my birthday yesterday.  2.25 for one puff and 11.00 for six.  I ordered 6 with vanilla.  They did have green tea and chocolate but decided against it.  Anyways, the puffs were nice and dense, very light with a baked crunch.  They fill the filling in as you order.  I ate one as soon as my ride came around.  It was gooood!!!  You have to be a dairy person, cause you do feel the dairy effects afterwards.  I think next time I will try the other few cake slices they have, like the cheesecake and tiramisu.  I think I had enough puffs for the rest of the year,  I ate the last two today!!!  lol
author: Leslie Y.

description:
I can attribute the last two inches on my belly to the Beard Papa. Those cream puffs are tasty although the price is questionable. Were they to drop everything by about .75 cents I'd probably be more afraid for my weight level though. 

Sadly not everything is a cream puff and most of the other items are just poor imitations of what is often quite good food. The cheesecake sticks for instance partially ruin a decent cheesecake by subbing weird health crackers in for the classic graham. 

Final assessment? Better than the Costco buckets, but not as good as Grandmas. Then again will anything ever be that good?
author: Stephen M.

description:
I've been addicted for 2 years. If I don't get my creme puff fix at least 1X/.month I start to go crazy.

Go and get your creme puff on.
author: Sarah G.

description: I love these pipin' hot, sweet cream puffs of custard!  I first discovered them in Japan and it was crave at first sight.  The portions are larger in SF, but they don't quite have the same appeal or quality.  Nevertheless, I'm still a BP cream puff fan.
author: Jenny L.

description: I first had Beard Papa's in Hong Kong and they were so amazing I bought them in packs and brought them back to the hotel and I just ate them constantly.  I definetly gained some weight on that trip. but when i heard they were opening one in san francisco I freaked and I had to try them. They line is long but they cream puffs are still just as good.
author: Samantha L.

description: I heard all the hype for this.  When it first came out, there were mass e-mails to the fun-email-distro lists.  But when I finally got there.  I was less than amazed.  I was thinking this cream puff would be like those from Costco, ice cream filled like.  Instead it was just pudding...inside bread...or more like melted ice cream in bread.  Now if they froze the puffs so that they were more like ice cream...man they would be golden and I'd be broke...
author: Carolen M.

description: Walked over a mile for the cream puffs and it was worth it! Eclairs are excellent as well.
author: Holly M.

description:
I don't understand why all these Yelpers are writing about Beard Papa's other deserts. Obviously they are famous for their cream puffs and eclairs... so why would you go there and have anything else? Its like going to Italy and only eating Chinese food, it just doesn't make sense.

Their cream puffs are pretty good. I tried the Yerba Buena location first. But once Beard Papa's came to the mall I decided that they would be my treat to myself every time I made it through a long day of shopping (sometimes I end up buying two then going home and trying on my clothes again and not fitting into them, I suspect, because I had two).

Get the Vanilla Bean. I have tried the Pumpkin, Chocolate and Green Tea (all good) but hands down the Vanilla Bean is the BEST. They are super good on a hot day, or a cold winter day with a cup of coffee. 

I would give them 3.5 stars but Yelp doesn't operate that way so I am erring on the side of generosity and giving them four stars. Stick to the cream puffs (specifically the vanilla ones).

-----------------------------------------------------------------
So I changed my mind, despite being good I have demoted them to three stars until the can prove to me that they really want that fourth.
author: Sarah S.

description:
Taste:  4
Addictability:  5
After-you-eat-them regret factor:  2
Miles to run to burn the calories:  5

I'm so glad my office is too much of a walk to eat here every day.

I once bought 2, intending for the 2nd to go to a coworker.  I ate them both before I got back to the office.  The tell-tale "cocaine powder" residue on my lips (and on my black jacket) was a dead giveaway that I wasn't sharing again.

To paraphrase a few reviewers' opinions, this is the poor man's kitschy  Hello Kitty version of profiteroles filled with ice cream.  But oh so good.  I prefer the vanilla over the chocolate (and I'm a chocolate person).  The puffs were flaky.  And the custard was cold enough that I didn't believe that it wasn't ice cream at first.  And the custard wasn't overly sweet.  Just sweet enough to pop them (and those that were supposed to go to your coworkers) in your mouth.

Great place to go on your cheat days.
author: Ruiqiu K.

description: Their cream puffs -- any flavor -- have been my favorite dessert since I found them a few years ago... Enough said.
author: Amelia D.

description: Absolutely freaking delicious delicate desserts! However, the price is a little bit high for the palm size cream puff. The quality never fails me though.
author: Jannet H.

description:
I was recently ditching work with my friend and we were spending a day going to the museum. On the way home we passed Beard Papa, and the long line pouring out the door. Since I was already being bad, I figured waiting for 20 minutes and splurging on a fatty, rich treat would be a great way to cap off the day. 

I was surprised that the puffs were not at all heavy. My friend and I split one chocolate and one vanilla. The chocolate tasted like it was filled with Jello pudding, but the vanilla one was good. The puff itself was kinda bland, almost flavorless. It was light though and I didn't feel overly stuffed or ill after eating it. I can't understand how people can eat more than one of these though. I think I would die from a diabetic coma from the inside if I ate one more. 

All said, it wasn't bad, but not really worth the hype. Maybe if I want a sweet, but light snack I'll come back, but only if I don't have to wait 20 minutes in the freezing cold to get one.
author: Rebecca H.

description:
I LOVE cream puffs.  I used to love when I went to my mom's house and she had the big tubs of the one from Costco, I would sit there and eat them until i felt like puking.  Then half an hour later, I wanted more.
WIth Beard Papas, I LOVE them, and I think I kept eating them until I passed out from sugar overload.  I had the chocolate and the vanilla, and i CANNOT wait to try the green tea and the cheesecake sticks, and whatever other goodies they have.
author: Janet R.

description:
Bah. The pastry shell is good, crispy though not dry.
But what is that inside?
It's not whipped cream and it's not custard.
It manages to be both too runny and too heavy; and there is too much of it.
author: Bob R.

description:
Pros: Place is modernly designed with friendly and efficient service, and not busy when we went around opening hours (10AM-ish). 
Cons: Limited to flavor selections. Keep in mind they always have one special flavor per week. So I got Caramel (when I was actually craving Green Tea) and BF got Vanilla Bean (when he was craving Strawberry). 
** Filling in each cream puff can be overwhelmingly sweet and may be messy when eating due to the quantity of cream injected into the puff. They inject the cream from a machine right in front of you,too!
author: Lisa C.

description:
OMG! This is all I can say about these creme puffs!!

We went to SF for the Thanksgiving day weekend and I was walking around on Black Friday trying not to get run over when I was getting I little thirsty so I saw this little face of this friendly older man on the sign and I thought...why not? 

Well, I forgot all about my thirst when I walked in there....cream puffs??  Well, yes please.

This is the best creme puff I have EVER had and I have to tell you it might take over cupcakes as my new favorite thing.....!

You have never tried a creme puff like this.  I had the vanilla but I did notice that they had other flavors but I am a purist and went with the vanilla.

YUM!

me---am sad now that I am back in San Diego sans Beard Papa's.
author: Amiee L.

description:
Best Chocolate Eclair (with Vanilla filling) I've ever eaten. However, that's if you wait 5-10 minutes for it to "thaw" out a little. I got it a little cold, didn't get it fresh from the oven. They should seriously consider changing the fridge temperature or think about making less puffs so that there's not a lot of excess to chill up. 

Despite that, the eclair was delicious!

Cream puffs were just okay, puff too crunchy (tasted like crackers for a sec)-not flakey like most-but super generous with the filling.

They offer  3 types of cream filling (green tea, vanilla, chocolate) in the puffs or eclairs. I only realized this when the cashier asked. I'm not sure I saw these choices on the menu.

Other desserts they offer are cheesecake sticks-if you're on the go and don't want cream filling dripping all over, and chocolate au fondant. Other locations offer mango ice shower, mochi, and Mont Blanc. 

For beverages: tea, coffee, vitamin water (no formula fiddy though!), etc. I wish they had some iced mocha-chocolate frappes to go down with my eclairs...

Not worth the travel, but worth the two block walk if you happen to be around the neighborhood...
author: Aileen A.

description: I had the Creamy vanilla puff, an it was not special to me.  Surely this is just a fad to be different.  I can't believe people will keep coming back.   As for me, I would rather have a beignet.
author: Larry B.

description:
I have been so happy ever since Beard Papa came to the U.S. 

The first time I tried them was in Osaka Japan. I could smell this wonderful buttery aroma long before I could even see the store. As I approached I saw a huge line of people waiting to get freshly made cream puffs. I decided their must be a reason to stand in line for them so I joined in and was not disappointed. These are simply the best cream puffs ever. I can't eat other cream puffs now because I have been spoiled by Beard Papa's. 

The San Francisco store has the same amazing taste. The Vanilla is always delicious and I like to try the weekly flavors as well. You can really taste the high quality ingredients and freshness in every bite.

Maybe the song by Shonen Knife is most fitting.
I spent happiness
Before I ate strawberry cream puff
I had nothing to complain of
Before I ate strawberry cream puff
As if I were in a dream
Before I ate strawberry cream puff
I was satisfied with my life
Before I ate strawberry cream puff

It can easily disappear
It's just like a daydream
If you eat it only once
You'll be obsessed with it all your life!
But I can't make strawberry cream puff
And I can't get strawberry cream puff
I can't make strawberry cream puff
I couldn't never eat strawb' cream puff

Everyday is lonely
Since I ate strawberry cream puff
Everything is boring
Since I ate strawberry cream puff
My heart is breaking
Since I ate strawberry cream puff
There is something missing in my life
Since I ate strawberry cream puff

I know I can't make strawberry cream puff
I know I can't get strawberry cream puff
I know I can't make strawberry cream puff
But I need my strawb' cream puff
But I need my strawb' cream puff
I want my strawberry cream puff.
author: Kevin F.

description:
So went to check this place out bcuz of the Yelp Reviews.  It was middle of the week around 5 PMish -- no long lines (yay),  fast fresh cream puffs (we had 6 choc/ 6 vanilla -- i prefer the vanilla), and pretty big cream puffs.

As my honey turned to ask me, "What's the hype all about?"  I had already devoured one puff and vanilla was all over my mouth. (it was overloaded with vanilla but I'm not complaining).  I think I had answered his question!  YUMMY!
author: Stel D.

description:
Every time I'm in NYC, Beard Papa's is always WAY too crowded. Now I understand why! These cream puffs are DELICIOUS!!! As I was heading towards Union square for some shopping, I walked right past the shop and noticed that the line wasn't long at all! I immediately walked in and stood in a line that lasted maybe 2 minutes. As I was waiting, the aroma of buttery puff pastry put me in a trance dreaming about my first bite. I decided to go with the vanilla bean cream puff. The pastry was so crispy on the outside and perfectly soft in the inside. So light and good. The vanilla cream was yummy, not to creamy and more custard like. I'm not a huge fan of cream puffs, but these were heavenly. 

I'm definitely going back to try the chocolate and their weekly specials. Hopefully the next time I'm there, I can try the pumpkin and green tea! YUM! OOOOhHHH.. they also have chocolate fondant cake too, but it's still under "coming soon." Can't wait!
author: Denise L.

description:
LONG LINE on Sunday night just before closing... we had to WAIT for the puffs to bake... they take 30 minutes to bake, and then 5 minutes to cool down.... so... if you ever see a line that's not moving, you can do the math... it'll take at least half an hour for you to get out of there.  Bundle up cuz it gets cold waiting for fresh puffz.  I waited in line, and a guy comes out to tell us that there are only 13 puffs left.  13!!  That was their last batch.  Good thing we were all civil about it :P

The Vanilla Bean is really the best flavor.  They are also making different flavored custards, but I can't really appreciate them that much...  I think it's cuz I've had better from Beard Papa's in Asia... they truely rock over there... and their production line is MUCH FASTER.

Still, I have to give brownie points to the owner.  He served us hot tea or coffee while we were waiting and let us sample their new product, the Fondant.

Bear in mind... I'm not even much of a dessert fan... so, for some of you, my review may not count.

For those that are on the same plane as I am... 3 stars from me...  They're $1.75 each!!!!!!!!!!!!!

They're opening new stores.  Another one in the city, and one in Redwood City.
author: Jasmine L.

description:
Um.  Yeah.  They make cream puffs.  The logo is a guy with a beard, smoking a pipe.  They just blew my mind.  
I have to admit.  I don't get the beard.  Or the papa.  I don't get it.  
What I know is that I have been here once, around 11 am, before the line started, and the cream puff was great.  So there's that.  
I can't type more because I don't know what to say.  I don't get it.
author: Blake W.

description:
This place makes some seriously good cream puffs.

The line is always really long, so I normally don't stop by Bead Papa's if I just want some for myself.  But if you commute to the city, and want to bring something back for your friends/family, stop by Bread Papa's and get half a dozen vanilla and half a dozen chocolate puffs, and your friends and family will worship you.
author: Evan K.

description:
Green tea cream puffs. That is where it's at! It was so absolutely delicious. This is the original location in SF, I was told, but it's so small and there isn't much room to sit in here. I can't imagine this place when it was uber crowded and busy, that must have been insane.

I also tried their cheesecake sticks. It was interesting. Not traditionally like cheesecake, but still good. The dough for the crust could have been flakier however.
author: Jessica C.

description:
I finally succumbed to trying these flaky puffs of pleasure that everyone's been talking about... and the only disappointment was that I could not try all the flavors on my one visit.

Enough has been said about them so won't elaborate. The puffs pastries themselves were surprisingly light, flaky and perfectly balanced between crisp and crewy. And then the creme in the diff flavors - I tried vanilla and chocolate - were delicious altho I liked the chocolate more. I have to try the other flavors like green tea next time.

Bottom line: I'm a fan. Lucky I don't live near this place - otherwise I'd be 300 pounds easily.
author: Jim C.

description:
MMMM Cream puffs and eclairs!  They taste even better when u bring them home and put it in the fridge over night. mmmm!

The owner/manager is also very nice!  The first time we came here and they had just opened we got there when they were closed and he saw us with our sad faces staring through the window, and he still let us in :)
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Yeah they're good.

Only get the vanilla cream filled puffs.  They have the most pronounced flavor.  The vanilla works well because it has a lot of vanilla beans put into it.  The chocolate isn't as luscious.  I heard the green tea isn't good either.

I'm always apprehensive when buying one.  Because I know that once i finish a single cream puff, it will most likely lead to another one.  Not as jaw dropping as I thought it would be, but oh so satisfying.  The hype is partly correct.

I tried the warm chocolate cake.  It's a small little cake that they heat up in the microwave.  It's very reminiscent of Mrs. Fields' Cookies, but in cake form.  Super good but I bet it's super crazy in terms of nutrition facts.

(They used to show a video of how they make the cream puffs.  A lot of milk, butter, and all the good things that make your pig blush.  They don't show it anymore because I think they realized that it's anti-marketing for the healthies.)
author: Michael H.

description: I rarely have the sinful urge to consume anything sweet but whenever I do get a sweet tooth craving frenzy attack, I think, Beard Papa's vanilla bean cream puffs crispy creaminess. Flaky, yet perfectly light & scrumptuous. Fresh ingredients, friendly staff, small & cozy corner shop w/ seating outside & perfect for people watching. A puff of heaven for only $2.25??  'Nuf said? Go grab yourself one! Or for an extra dub, grab a dozen & see what happens
author: Jason B.

description: Outstanding!  Pastry is so light and flaky and the cream filling delish :)
author: M A.

description:
Someone told me they're better than Krispy Kremes. They were right. Only problem is the only flavor right now is vanilla. But still so good that they get 5 stars...

UPDATE:

CHOCOLATE IS HERE, AND IT'S DELICIOUS!!
author: Joe R.

description:
Okay, I FINALLY tried it after a couple thwarted attempts and much much harrassment from Beard Papa disciples and... well, I've had better.

While I was in NYC, I had probably the best cream puff I've ever had at Puff & Pao (http://www.yelp.com/biz/XNrCuH77b37jf5X4R41xQA?hrid=D8XScfesrcFL3GCw2NJUNg). The puff was not too crusty and not too light, but just light enough and crusty enough - it's hard to describe, but it was just right. the custard was rich and smooth and not too sweet. On top of that, you can add fruit and chocolate to the puff. I'm drooling as I type at the thought of one.

Unfortunately Beard Papa doesn't come close to my Puff & Pao experience. I felt the puff was a bit too crusty for me, and it was a little too delicate and didn't have any structure to it. Also, it might have just been the 3 times I've been, but I found that the cream/custard filling was a bit grainy. I know that for some, this is what they expect from a cream puff, but it ain't me. I admit that it is very very tasty, but how can something that's main ingredients are sugar, flour, cream and butter NOT taste great?

I'll go there again, and possibly often, but that won't make me think they're the shit or that they're reasonably priced. they're like the microsoft of SFcream puffs.
author: Bernie L.

description:
Sure, I'll turn fat over these!

Best way to pack on 20 and enjoy every bite of it!

Came here during a recent lunch break say around 1:00 pm on a Tuesday and damn there was still a line out the door.

Only tried the vanilla cream puffs because they ran out of the chocolate right when I got their. 

I'll be back!
author: Ericka A.

description:
looks like the fish stick brand Gorton's/ smurfs selling a mix between a crossant/eclair.
Ok so the wait it freggin ridiculous! but it was a bloggin moment! waiting like half an hour for a taste of the BEST CREAM PUFF of my life.
a cure for diabetics..... eat a dozen and die happy. (sorry if this offends..just ignore me)
author: Lynn T.

description:
The Vanilla Bean cream puff is very yummy, but I didn't enjoy the Milk Tea nor the Cheesecake Stick. 

Also, I propose that they open earlier. I mean c'moooon -10am?? It's a Bakery!
author: Seema H.

description:
Just one more fan chiming in to say Beard Papa cream puffs are the bomb!

Yeah, it's a weird name. Japanese franchise. Does that explain it?

Because they're made with fresh ingredients, you must keep refrigerated and consume them within 24 hours of purchase. Yeah, right. Like they'd last that long in my house. I'm eating these "puffies" as soon as I'm out of the door.

Get the $1.75 vanilla cream puff for the classic experience. Experiment with the other items on the menu -- such as the $2.10 eclair or the strawberry-flavored cream puffs -- at your leisure.
author: Wella L.

description:
This is the place to come to if you want to have different fillings.... 
Like green tea, thai ice tea.. strawberry.. 
But the basic ones are vanilla bean and chocolate. 

YUMMY!! My best bribe dessert. 

There's also one in the mall that's open later.
author: Judi K.

description:
Delicious, but the ones in Tokyo are better ... so much better that I almost missed my flight back to SF because I was running around the city to find a fresh batch to take home and share with friends in the US.

I didn't miss my flight, but if I did, it would've been worth it. 
I wouldn't miss a flight for the cream puffs here (the puff pastry isn't as good, the cream is more watery), but still .. I'd eat it (:
author: Anvy A.

description:
After a day at the MOMA, I decided to stop in by to see what all the hub-bub is all about. 
So, I bought 2 flavors. The first one was a regular cream puff with Vanilla cream. It was more like vanilla custard, and it's not too sweet. The puff itself was so flakey, it left crumbs all over my shirt. Yeah, I didn't care if anyone saw me pick those crumbs back up and put them in my mouth. At $2.25 a puff, you would be too!
The second one was a chocolate creme filled cookie crumb puff. It was a little sweeter than the first but just as delicious. 
The puffs are a little more expensive than I thought they would be, but considering that they are rather big (about the size of your palm), they are worth the money. Definitely a must try.
author: Jan Z.

description:
Sometimes going near closing time isn't that great, but they're helpful. I went there on Wednesday and wanted a dozen flavor of the week. They were out of strawberry so they said to come back in 20 minutes. I came back and they were ready. 

They're good when they're fresh, but to me they're about the same a couple days later except the puff is a little bit softer.
author: Jen C.

description: Mangoo madness.. im in love, but too much sweet is not good. haha.. for a heavy person atleast... so cut cut cut... only to treat self on special occasions. =)
author: Monika T.

description:
If I had a pumpkin cream puff today and died tomorrow, I'd die a happy person.

Actually, any of the flavors (except maybe the Green Tea) are absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS.

It's hard for me to get just one...I usually get a half dozen or a full dozen! I'm glad the store is kind of far from me, otherwise I'd go broke (and be fat).
author: Buster B.

description: I HATE that Beard Papa's is sooOOoo GOOD, I HATE that the bf LOVES Beard Papa's, I HATE that I go to Beard Papa's at least once a week and what I HATE even more than all of the above is that it's located sooOOOo close to my work and I mean like 2 minute walk CLOSE!!! Not to mention that I always pass by it on route to the BART station to get home!! I always get half a dozen Cream Puff's whenever I come here. I get to be adventurous here and there whenever they offer coffee or green tea as it's weekly flavor, but the Vanilla Bean is by far THE BEST!!! :D The custard in the Cream Puffs are not too sweet and not too heavy, it is perfectly mastered!! They should seriously give me a discount or VIP card for coming here as often as I do!! :D
author: Doris L.

description: Delicious and simple.  Vanilla Cream puff was my favorite...fluffy and gooey with the perfect amount of sweetness.  Grab a couple and walk across the street to enjoy in the gardens.
author: Autumn C.

description: So glad we passed this place randomly on our stroll through the city. Sadly the shops in O.C have all disappeared and the L.A location is always crazy busy. =/ I only stick to the vanilla bean cream puffs and sadly I could probably eat a ton of them.  Lucky for us, we got a fresh batch that just came out so the puff was nice and crispy!
author: Chi N.

description:
After finding out about their opening this past weekend, I took a stroll over. Why the heck not? It's just a half block away. Which is a bad, bad thing.

These cream puffs are fantastic! The vanilla bean custard is not too sweet and the texture is just heavenly. The choux is nicely crispy on the outside. I love that these are made to order. 

There's not much of a selection right now. Just vanilla cream puffs. But in a few weeks they'll have chocolate, green tea, caramel and strawberry cream puffs and a few other pastries. 

I'll definitely be coming back to try the other flavors and this might also replace birthday cakes for a few people.

****Ok, so I had the chocolate cream puff last week and it was...disappointing. It was good as desserts go but in comparison to the vanilla cream puff? Not good. The chocolate filling was gritty and the batch of cream puffs that mine was from were very misshapen and, in my opinion, should not have been used and just tossed. Aren't choux supposed to be a roundish shape? The one I had was lumpy. Maybe I should try another 2 to see if it has improved but for now the vanilla was hands down much better.

*****I've now also had the green tea flavored puff. Let's just say that's going to be the only time I try it. The thing about green tea is that it's fairly subtle flavor. The custard was so rich that I didn't really detect the green tea until after I was finished. Which if you didn't know what you were eating you would just think that the taste was off. Also? The green powdered sugar that was dusted on top was a turn off. It was not an appetizing color.
author: cyndi L.

description:
Oh man. This was some good cream puffs. Me and my friend went and bought a half a dozen and ate them all in one day. The custard filling is light and not too sweet. I also thought with all the rave reviews that the line was gonna be long, especially during the lunch hour (I went around 1), but the line was pretty short (though there was never not a line while we were there) and we got our cream puffs relatively fast.

I'm gonna update and say I've been here a few more times and the cream puffs aren't that great. There should be more taste to it.
author: Aaron M.

description:
As others have said ... "I love it when you call me Beard Papa..."

Indeed.  After being completely uncool and hearing about Beard Papa on "Unwrapped" (on the Food Network) - I was excited to find out that we had one in SF.  

When I finally got to experience that divine combination of the pie crust/pate a choux (thanks to Alton Brown for that one) pastry with the vanilla custard (with a LactAid chaser - damned lactose intolerance!) ... I was a very happy girl.
author: Carly P.

description:
Best. Cream Puffs. EVAR.

I remember seeing the "coming soon" sign at the tucked-away location during MacWorld earlier this year, and looked forward to sampling the Beard Papa goodness. I had no idea that there was such a buzz about the place! Food Network, local news, etc.!

The scent of the fresh baked puffs lingers as you approach the storefront, making your mouth water with anticipation. Both times that I've been there recently there was no line at all, walked right up and got mah puff fix.

The buzz was definitely well-founded. The first time I had a BP cream puff, I had it stowed for sampling later with my boyfriend after dinner. Considering that it wasn't necessarily fresh off the line, it was still the best cream puff I'd ever had.

Can't wait to try all the coming soon flavors!
author: Courtney P.

description:
Beard Papa's Cream Puff' have finally made it to San Francisco! Yay...

Japanese style cream puffs are perfect for people who like their desserts light, fluffy, and not too sweet. Think banana cream pie or the anti-Cinnabon.

The wait at the store fluctuates with longest lines around the noon lunch hour and late in the afternoon. But it's worth the wait!

In keeping with the Japanese traditional excellence in customer service, the Beard Papa staff are all exceptionally courteous and friendly.
author: Tommy T.

description:
The pumpkin cream puff (today's special) was delicious - the filling tasted like pumpkin pie filling and vanilla ice cream. The pastry was a nice compliment, but at Beard Papa's, it's really the filling that's the thing.

Compared to the pumpkin, the vanilla creampuff was a letdown -- the filling was too sweet and rich.

Update: tried the green tea puff today. It is worthy.

The fondant was amazing. I popped it in the microwave for 12 seconds and was rewarded with essentially a chocolate cake with a core of warm melted chocolate filling. Very good.

The prices seem high but are not outrageous considering these are not some little dainty single bite dealies but instead a whole body pudding-all-over-the-face, powdered sugar down the front of your shirt experience. Imagine jelly donuts designed by the French for the Japanese export market, and you have a reasonable approximation of what you're going to get. 

$1.75 for a puff, $11 for a half-dozen. I'll be back
author: Pat T.

description:
awesome, fantastic cream puffs!  I can get much happier with this cream puff on my hand.  :)

yummy yummy ... I love every cream puff that they have; vanilla, chocolate, grean tea, and more.  

I can't wait to go back there and try other flavors ... ahhh ... sooo good!  :)
author: Misty C.

description:
We visited Beard Papa's Cream Puffs on a Thursday at about 3pm or so.  No line!  So, our curiosity was satisfied more quickly than I anticipated.  

I was disappointed to find that only a few flavors are available at any given time.  Why is this?  I've heard that in the east coast locations more flavors are always available.  We couldn't have green tea, which was our first choice.  We had to settle for one chocolate and one vanilla.

I don't really like pate a choux, but this was quite good.  Nice and crunchy, with plenty of air space inside to be filled with cream.  And, the pastry cream was quite good.  I liked the vanilla the best-- smooth and creamy with a good sweet vanilla flavor.  I found the chocolate pastry cream to be a bit grainy, but still enjoyable.

Over all, very enjoyable.  Give them a try!
author: Bruce S.

description:
Maybe it is an Asian thing, but to me it is just a cream puff.  Good, but so are a lot of other pastries.

I will have one about every 3 month, but not in public; they are too messy.
author: Bart V.

description:
OHHHH YUMMMM! I love the cream puffs here. Everytime someone mentions dessert I think Beard Papa :D. MMMMMMMMMMM! 

There are two both by Mission and 4th. One is downstairs in the Bloomies mall and the other is on the corner right across from the Metreon. 

The first time I had this I was standing in line and this couple asks us, is it really that good to stand in such a long line? I'm like I've never had it but apparently!
author: K T.

description:
Hmmm, there sure is a LOT of hype about this place. Don't get me wrong, their cream puffs and eclaires are good, but they're not the bomb! If you're like me, who's sweet tooth fell out at the age of 12, then you'd probably agree with me. I'd pick a Jamba Juice, sherbet, or some sour candy over a cream puff 75% of the time. Of course, if you're in the area (one is next to St. Patrick's Church on Mission and one is in the food court of the new Bloomingdales) and find yourself with a couple extra bucks in your pocket, you won't kick yourself in the head for buying one. Well, that is unless you look up the nutritional facts on it. YIKES!

One strange thing though is that my girlfriend swears that the Beard Papa's cream puffs in Oahu tasted better and fresher. She doesn't get it. EVERYTHING tastes better when you're in Hawaii.
author: Axel G.

description:
my boyfriend and i waiting for 1hr 30 minutes to get one of these things! but they are yummy, i just wish i didn't have to stand around so long to get one!
But this was before they opened the one  in the mall, so i'm sure the wait it alot more reasonable. yummy stuff, only i wouldn't call them cream puffs, they're more like oversized profiteroles.
author: Parisa G.

description:
Meh. It was a cream puff as I've come to expect (i.e. choux filled with custard) no more no less. Yes, the custard was pretty good, but it definitely wasn't mind blowing. The choux was a bit... overcooked? It wasn't exactly burnt, but it tasted a bit too dark for a sweet. The puff was a bit larger than normal, but the price ($1.75 for a standard vanilla bean cream puff) was definitely too high for what you get.

I might get one again just to compare and be certain that this wasn't an isolated incident, but  at the same time I'm not in any hurry to eat one again. In short, it was about as generic a cream puff as I could expect to eat: not bad, not fabulous.

Ignore the hype. For the price, I don't think it's worth it.
author: Mark S.

description:
Monstrous cream puffs! Gall bladders beware!

My sisters came to visit last Summer, and knowing they were picking up a car rental from the hotel around the corner from Beard Papa, I forced them to pick up some cream puffs to-go. After their much anticipated arrival with said puffs, I inhaled the "classic" custard puff, before working on the green tea puff that was malkjsldkjfsldkjd --- too good for words. Alas, there was only a bit left for the sisters to enjoy.

I admit, my mistake was not slowly enjoying the rich custard over a cup of stringent tea or coffee -- which I highly recommend, btw (at Yerba Buena park perhaps?). These suckers are big, so don't have a huge meal beforehand, or better yet, share them with a loved one.
author: Antoi C.

description:
Such little yummy creaminess. 

I blame them for my little chubby chub chub chubs. Them & my weak will power, but mostly them. 

I'm usually a fan of trying different things & being weird about it all, but I must say, the OG vanilla plain cream is really where its at. 

2 cream puffs & a microphone. 

Where its at.
author: Rebekah K.

description:
I love custards. I do not like whatever the traditional whipped sugar fluff is in other cream puffs. 

I freaking love Beard Papas. 

You order and they stuff the pastry shell right then. The chocolate custard is genuinely chocolatey! Cocoa powder and everything, nom nom nom. 

Get a half dozen for friends, half dozen for yourself. Maybe I'll exercise more if I bribe myself with these....
author: Ceren E.

description:
Yummmm.. I don't ever normally purchase or make cream puffs. Just not my preferred dessert.. but something about these particular cream puffs makes me crave them whenever I'm within about 6 blocks of their vicinity. (Ok, and sometimes even when I'm not even in the city at all!) 

Restraint is definitely necessary to eat just one. Sometimes I give in and eat one there, and get a second one to take home. :) Don't bother to look up the calories. Why would you do that? It's a cream puff, obviously it's not going to be full of vitamins and other healthy nutrients. But who cares, it's a treat!

So far I've tried the vanilla, chocolate, caramel, and strawberry (favorite! with bits of chopped strawberry in it! mmmm.. too bad it's not a regular flavor), and the cookie crumble puff. I could give or take the cookie crumble, I think the regular puff is satisfying enough. My boyfriend has had the green tea flavor and said it was good as well.

The only downside to this place? I'm on a college student budget, and they happen to be 'conveniently' close enough for me to just stop by on my way to BART after class is done... ;)
author: Tori C.

description:
Fresh strawberry custard smooshed inside a crushed sugar-cookie encrusted crispy choux pastry.  

O.
M.
G.

This sounds kinda... [well, you can fill in the blank], but it's really $2.50 tops for multiple mouthfuls of heaven.
author: BrasilPo P.

description: I am please to say, this is one of the best pastry type of place, not too sweet, I like it. Is it worth it? well, yes and no
author: Tom T.

description:
MMMMM! I had checked Beard Papa's website a couple months ago to see if they were ever coming to SF after I had a heavenly taste of their cream puffs in Hollywood. Today I checked again to see if they had opened yet, and lo and behold the opening day was yesterday! My friend and I rushed downtown and each bought 3 delicious cream puffs. Not too sweet, wonderful vanilla flavor in the sublimely textured cream, and a crispy-crunchy shell. MMMMMMMMMMMM!!! Apparently yesterday Beard Papa sold more cream puffs than any other California Beard Papa did on their first day. Good job San Francisco! I can't wait to try PUMPKIN cream puff!!!

Edit: I tried the pumpkin cream puff. It was really delicious. It had the slight sweet tang of pumpkin. PUMPYKIN. Does anyone else pronounce the word "pumpykin" like me? Well I also tasted the chocolate cream puff, which is a little too much choklad (pronounced hwoo-klohd, that's chocolate in Swedish) for me. Yay I have to try the "milk tea" probably the most Asian flavored cream puff you could get.. Unless it also had red bean filling and green tea essence in it too. And one prerequisite tapioca bean.
author: O K.

description:
Ok.  Not sure about the name and what it has to do with cream puffs, but damn, Bearded Papa makes one fine cream puff.  I can't say that I am an expert as I admittedly have not had many elsewhere, but the mouth and tummy don't lie--Yum!

Crispy on the outside, somewhat airy and elastic on the inside with the upper cut of  vanilla custard--body blow, body blow, knock him out, knock him out.  

I haven't been able to stray away from the vanilla, but they do have tempting flavors such as Green Tea, Chocolate, and Strawberry.  Go out on a limb if you dare, but I just can't seem to think of a reason to choose anything but vanilla.
author: Rick V.

description:
Ok, Gram doesn't make these anymore so this is a good place when I am feeling a little nostaligic for cream puffs...and while they are tasty at the expense of 200 calories per puff of delight, the line at either location is not worth my time.

I don't think the chocolate is all that, but the vanilla is the quintessential cream puff....
author: Amy Z.

description:
This was the site of the fabled puff gorge of 2006.

Yes, I and two of my friends ventured over one day after class out of curiosity. I had read an article about this place in Popular Science (of all places!) and it was time for some dessert lovin'. 

We each had three. Which, when the puff is about the size of your fist or so, is A LOT. But it was SO good. It was a good pain. YUM. 

I love the puff better than the cream. The cream was too much like pudding and didn't have a deep enough vanilla flavor I'd expect, but it was ok. I wonder if you can get the puff without the pudding. They'd be good with something savory in them, their choux pastry.

Minus one star for hardly ever having cheesecake sticks whenever I'm there. And because I'm not addicted enough to go there every week for the new flavor. I want to try everything NOW. :P
author: Regina L.

description:
I prefer this location to the one on Market in the mall, mostly because service here is faster due to less of a crowd (though the line does get really long here, it's usually worse over there due to famished shoppers).  $1.75 for a vanilla bean cream puff, a teensy bit more for chocolate and flavor of the week specials.  I believe if the total comes to less than $3 (or was it $5?), you have to pay in cash.  I ended up buying two puffs one time because all I had was plastic.

You have to try this place at least once.  Oh-- but sometimes, you might be the unlucky one who gets a slightly deflated puff (this happened once at the Market location, hence another reason I avoid that location).  I've never tried to haggle for a puffier cream puff before but I guess anything's possible....
author: Lynn O.

description:
Beard Papa is Japanese? Is that why with every bite I turn Japanese?

Screw the diet... Puff me papa!

[and cut~]

It is difficult to walk past this place without buying something; and after I buy a box, happiness turn to regret as I remember I just bought a box yesterday.  This place is going to give me diabetes, I just know it.
author: Cristoper C.

description:
There has to be something intrinsically WRONG with getting cravings for little pastries filled with cool pudding-esque semi-solids.

I admit I've put on my oversized Prada sunglasses and snuck in to Beard Papa's because, like a drug addict, I'm addicted to carbs.

These little babies are absolutely amazing. The no fuss, no judgements little bakery (carb hell, I call it) allow you CHOICES of cream puffs. I deign to eat the vanilla, chocolate and caramel (vanilla is still my fav), although I'm hesitant to try to strawberry. Strawberry flavoured puddings aren't my cup of tea (there's my minus 1 star).

The price range is great for the orgasm of taste your mouth will feel. You'll need a napkin to clean up the mess. :)
author: C. P.

description: ...and the sweet smell of freshly baked cream puffs permeated our nostrils and yanked us right in off the street....and we were hooked.  Not the traditional lighter than air straight whipped cream filling I expected, but cream and custard (or so the "how-we-make-it" video that runs on a continual loop in-store has it appear)...and just out of this world.  We stuck with the vanilla bean...and if time allowed probably would've had more than one as they were delectable.  Choux a la creme.....the best.
author: ser s.

description: Cream puffs dipped in solid chocolate -- Beard Papa's eclairs are really as good as it gets.  In my dreams, I live on these, fresh strawberries and champagne.  Mmmmmm.
author: Michelly S.

description:
What's better after a long day of shopping or just a simple break from shopping than a nice Vanilla Cream Puff from Beard Papa's?

Nothing!

I've tried the Vanilla, Chocolate, Green Tea, and Milk Tea Cream Puffs (Yes, Milk Tea. I'm Taiwanese and felt like I owed it to my heritage to try one). 

Vanilla Bean: I have to say this is still my favorite! It's not too sweet and tastes like a little puff of heaven! 
Chocolate and Green Tea: Great! but not as awesome as Vanilla bean!
Milk Tea: I thought this would be very strange, but it was delightfully yummy! I would absolutely get one again! The milk tea flavor wasn't overpowering, but you could definitely taste it.

All of them are delicious depending on your personal choice of flavor and definitely worth it. Can't wait to go back!
author: Sally A.

description:
Fisherman Santa*, I love you.

The best is the "eclair" with vanilla creme. Caramel is also good if they've got it. They're big enough to share, if you're feeling virtuous, and if not, well, just more deliciousness for you.

The only downside? Messy! Unless you have a giant mouth and devour it in one bite, chances are you're going to have to lick your fingers several dozen times. But it's worth it, I promise.

The chocolate fondant thingies are also delicious, if you want something a little smaller/more chocolatey.
 

*this is what my boyfriend calls the Beard Papa icon-man
author: Valerie M.

description: What a disappointment.  Super small...bland...over priced...the owners are making a mint.  It is obvious this stuff cost pennies to make.  Virtually any Patisserie, Chinese, or Mexican bakery in town produces better products at better prices.
author: Saul M.

description:
Beard PaPa is my old time favorite from Japan.
I'm soooo glad it finally opened up in SF. 
I had a chance to try it last week,and their cream puff seemed little smaller in size compare to the one in NYC and in Japan. It tasted same though. I wish it would have more branches in south bay and priced $1.50 like in LA.
author: Mika K.

description:
After reading about Beard Papa's on Daily Candy and Yelp, I was pretty excited about giving this place a try. 

Been there twice and was let down both times. First time I went, all they had were vanilla and chocolate cream puffs available, the special flavors were "coming soon." 

I went again about 6 weeks later and was excited to see that the special flavors were available. However, only one special flavor (out of 5 or so) for the week was available. I was so keen on trying the green tea but have not been able to because I wasn't there the right week. Why list all the flavors on the menu if you are not going to feature them until 3 weeks later?!!! 

Just really annoying each time I've gone with expectations of having a satisfying cream puff experience. With the ones I did try, average and not worth the wait in line. I think I made better cream puffs when I was 10 years old experimenting in my mom's kitchen. Give me the bulk cream puff package at Costco any day.
author: Rolo T.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!!!!!!!!!!!
I don't like sweets, but their cream puffs are sooo good.  Not as good as the one in NY.  Oh well!
author: E C.

description:
Since Beard Papa's opened in San Francisco, all of my fellow hapa friends talked this place up.  I never could bring myself to make it a destination --  I'm not a huge sweet eater -- and never sought it out on trips to Japan, and still I heard I MUST try the cream puff.

Well finally, I did it.  

I wasn't blown away by the eclair, but I've never been one for chocolatey coating.  Hubby said it is the best eclair he's ever had though.  The vanilla puff -- just good.  But the chocolate puff, that is some seriously delicious puff goodness.  Subtle and light.  The keys are as with any Japanese sweet: not so sickly sweet like so many Western confections, and high quality ingredients. 

So, four stars instead of five, but only because I'm not a big sweet eater and it's not like if I'm in the neighborhood I NEED one.  Not like ice cream at Ici.
author: saudade s.

description: This is my favorite Beard Papa's location. The friendly & efficient staff are always pumping out fresh & warm cream puffs and it's conveniently located off of market street in downtown SF. I used to walk by this place everyday after work on my way to the Caltrain and see a line of professionals from the nearby skyscrapers forming down the steps onto the sidewalk.  It's popularity means the cream puffs you buy are always fresh out of the oven with a crispy shell & fresh custard filling. Yum!
author: Jenni H.

description: These cream puffs are the best! I highly recommend trying them out. I wish that they would last more than 24 hrs though.
author: Marty M.

description: My friend and I had a day to hang out, and Beard Papa's was on the list. I was a little unsure about it (since i never had a cream puff before), but my friend was hyped about it, so i decided to try. The atmosphere was perfect for a modern cream puff palace. The wait was short, and we had our puffs in no time. OMG. Its heaven at first bite. My-oh-my, their vanilla bean cream puffs are UH-MAZ-ING ( and i believe i cant emphasize more than i already did ). This place is a must for everyone!
author: Natalie G.

description: Now you are talking.  I am an eclair girl so I just had to try it and we got a cream puff too.  I loved the hard chocolate on the outside.  We got the vanilla and I was in heaven.  Until I tried it with strawberry.  Tasted like a chocolate covered strawberry.  That is how good the cream is.  Not too sweet, just enough.  I wish I could have them shipped to me!!
author: Kathy A.

description: although its a chain, i prefer this to the puff spot in pacific heights.  its big, several choices like of cookie or cocoa (not all beard papas have it) and a seasonal flavor.  service is ok, they tend to mess up my order half the time.  just check it before you leave.
author: Fres R.

description:
Another Heaven...but I'll expand on this one..

Went today with 5 other friends after school, waited for about 15-20 minutes to get a dozen. and it started to rain, ate it inside metreon, 2 each. and it was just... unbelievably delicious.

whoever haven't tried it yet, please go. although they only have vanilla flavor for now, it's really good
author: Billy L.

description:
I originally tried Beard Papa in Singapore and I must say, that the San Francisco Shop may have done an even better job then the storefronts in Asia.  I like the chocolate, my husband likes the vanilla...we get one of each and share.  It's bliss.

The Puff is lite and has a good rich eggy feel.  The custards are well flavored, and just enough to satisfy.
