author: Elaine H.

description: So, sooooo good!  The cream puffs here are absolute perfection!  Heaven!  You must try one!  Seriously, at some point in your lifetime, you must try one of these cream puffs.  Put it on your list.
author: Lori B.

description: I love the cookie/crusted vanilla puffs. I can only eat one but love returning for more. Soooo good. Coffee is crap, but that's not why one should go there. Crowd pleasers at parties.
author: Trinity M.

description: Taste good but freaking expensive!!! I'd rather eat the tub of cream puffs you buy at Costco and you stick it in the freezer. Better yet Krispy Kreme beats em all!!!
author: Keoni U.

description:
i first tried beard papa cream puffs in nyc a few years ago, and was ecstatic when they opened a store at this location on yerba buena lane in san francisco. after a few visits, my elation slipped half a notch, but not because the cream puffs aren't excellent -- they're still quite tasty with the crisp outer shell that they fill with creamy custard when you order -- but because i think i've just kinda outgrown them or maybe realized that only occasional indulgence is a good thing and getting sick of beard papa's CAN happen. :P or maybe because i tried the chocolate one and it wasn't that good, weakly flavored and a bit grainy. i do wholeheartedly recommend the original vanilla flavor, as well as the pumpkin flavor and the strawberry. the green tea is good if you're a green tea fan, and caramel tastes like vanilla with a hint of caramel (which is good but not that caramelly). i also recently tried the royal milk tea flavor and it was okay, but not one of the better flavors. come to think of it, i guess i've tried pretty much all their flavors! the only thing is that they have vanilla and chocolate every day, but the rest of the flavors rotate on a weekly basis so they might not have the flavor you want the day you go.

i've also tried the cheesecake stick which wasn't very good. they also have an eclair (chocolate glazed version of the cream puff) and some kind of molten chocolate lava cake that i haven't yet tried.

i didn't know i had so much to say about beard papa's. the sad thing is that i could go on, but i won't. :P
author: Clara K.

description: Beard papa makes me so happy.  I like the plain vanilla cream puffs the best.
author: Sweaty P.

description: I was so pumped to go here after seeing one in NYC but not having a chance to stop in. Got a chocolate cream puff. It was definitely really good, better than the average cream puff. But it wasn't A-MAZING. The menu is short, SWEET and to the point. Cute store in good location.
author: Lea B.

description: They're alright. I mean, if you want to buy me some cream puffs.. go right ahead.
author: katharine s.

description:
I'm a little sad that I am only going to give three and a half stars to Beard Papa's.  Why?  Because when I used to live in NYC, I was obsessed with the cream puffs here and got every single relative who visited me obsessed with them as well.  When I read that Beard Papa was going to open in San Francisco, I emailed everyone I knew in San Francisco to let them know about the opening day.

So after moving back here, I was even more excited about Beard Papa being here because it was a little bit of NYC right here in SF and it would remind me of my life there.  Sadly though, the cream puffs here just don't quite measure up to the ones from NYC.  I even tried them out three times before writing this review just to make sure I wasn't getting it wrong.

So what's the difference?  Well, it is the same chain and presumably the same recipe for both the pastry and the custard.  But its just a little off.  The pastry seems a little crunchier than what I remember and the custard not as smooth.  I also notices that all three times I have been to the SF location, the cream puffs have been pre-made.  As in all dressed up with powdered sugar and already in their paper packages.  I'm not sure if that's for convenience's sake (although there's never been more than a few people in line everytime I go) or what, but it seems that the cream gets absorbed into the pastry and things soften up a bit too much in the center and bottom.  The operating procedure in NYC was that the sweet Japanese ladies making the cream puffs wouldn't make what you ordered until you ordered it, which preserves the freshness (and this was even if there was 10 people in line).  Obviously, this doesn't make much of a difference if you're bringing a bunch home, but I always ate mine fresh off the assembly line.

I'm also a little disappointed that the franchise owners decided to put both locations so close to each other rather than spreading them out throughout the city.  The service here is a bit spotty as well - one time, the young male cashier was too busy ogling a well-endowed female customer to pay attention to my order.  I had to repeat myself twice before he deigned to look in my direction and even with me giving him the stink eye, he continued to laugh and joke about this customer with the other male workers.      

Despite this, I'd still eat Beard Papa's because of the nostalgic factor and because it is still a pretty darn good cream puff.  But for the real thing, I'm heading back to NYC.
author: Angela H.

description: I was on Yelp trying to figure out what I had to try while in SF and came upon the reviews here, who can resist a cream puff?  Bonus points for being on my way to the MOMA.  For 2.25, it was a decent treat.  I shared the vanilla bean with a friend and I'm glad I did because these are huge.  They were filled upon order.  While the filling itself was good, I didn't find anything outstanding about the pastry itself.  I'm glad I tried it but I definitely didn't leave thinking, omg, I have to have this again.
author: Rachelle G.

description: i heard good things from others about this place but never wanted to go out of my way to try it. as if fate itself willed me to try a cream puff; while I visited the Jewish museum on a field trip, there about 500 ft away was a beard papas.  i wasn't expecting much in the first place since i generally am not a pastry guy since they are usually too sweet, but when i first took a bit into a vanilla bean cream puff, the slightly sweet thick creamy filling satisfied my taste buds and above my expectations. I would come here again if i was going to the metreon as it is 1 block away. hopefully they will have the green tea flavor next time.
author: Robert Y.

description: Mmm mm mm, I loves me some crack puffs.
author: M. H.

description: It's good to indulge sometimes. I bought two. My son wolfed his down and asked if i was sure I wanted mine. Yes I was sure I wanted it. What a delight.
author: Catherine D.

description: I had the green tea cream puff and I thought it was not that good.  Too much cream.
author: Seong P.

description:
These are really great cream puffs, but they're not as amazing as I thought they would be. But, talk about great marketing... and that custard aroma that wafts out of the cafe... enticing!
I used to eat Beard Papa's often when I was working in Asia (they're a lot cheaper there) and was thankfully a luxury I could afford but now that they've been translated into American dollars with the American price sting, I've reduced my love for Beard Papa's by a star (tear). But, when I'm in the city I 80% of the time make a stop here for two reasons: one, the menu has expanded and they have a "special" daily flavor, my favorite so far being pumpkin; two, it just smells soooo good and I always feel like I should be rewarded for my small life efforts so I'll dish out for one or two pastries. I'll buy more if I'm visiting family because they're absolute die hard fans of the original vanilla Beard Papa's cream puffs. Beyond the cream puffs and the eclairs (which are actually just the cream puffs dipped in chocolate) I haven't tried their other new offerings, but am planning on going back sometime to try cheesecake and fondant au chocolat. I hear they have mochi ice cream, but haven't seen/heard anything about them yet.
I have to say the 2 greatest selling point of Beard Papa's is that they use custard instead of cream, and it is definitely fresh. If you're willing to spend extra for sweets, Beard Papa would be your thing.
author: Jessica L.

description:
On a trip out from Chicago, I was lurred into this place by the adorable sign which reminded me of a combination of David the Gnome and the Gorton's fisherman. And "Beard Papa" is soooo ridiculously fun to say. I was definitely a silly tourist and had my photo taken in front of the sign. I look maniacally happy too because the photo was taken post-vanilla bean cream puff.

Sweet baby jesus.

I am a dessert connoisseur. Fuck all that Death by Chocolate crap you get at chain restaurants or ginormous slices of waxy Lemon Chiffon pie... give me something relatively simple but wonderfully rich and tasty and I'll be your loyal customer for life.
author: Katie A.

description:
I'm sorry. 
I know Beard Papa has a huge following, 
but I just don't get it.

To me, the pastry part tastes greasy but dry.
...I don't know how that's possible either, but it's true.
And the cream is like a cross between ice cream and fatty whipping cream.  
At room temp.

...I do have more of a salty than sweet tooth...
Maybe I'm just not a cream puff type o' girl.
author: A W.

description: Nothing beats a fresh cream puff, and I'm sorry to say that I doubt I'll ever get that from Beard Papa again.  When I first went when this place opened way back when, the puffs were so incredibly fresh (they literally had just been taken out of the oven) which just added to the deliciousness.  Although the cream puffs (I still like the plain vanilla one) are pretty good, they are not as good as when they came out fresh and piping hot in the first few months after launch.  Of course, I still enjoy them, but I just need to reset my expectations.
author: Melinda C.

description: How good are they?  It's like they ground up baby angels and piped them into pastries.  My only complaint is that they open so late.  If they were open earlier in the morning I could get a batch to take to work.
author: Leigh F.

description: I was expecting these to be AMAZING but they were just so-so, the temperature was definitely not right, either needed to be warmer or cooler.  I got a whole dozen! So many other pastries I would rather have, especially in SF!!
author: Stacey G.

description: A bit frustrated at the menu. Why can't you just put the flavors you have for that week on the menu. It gave me the wrong assumption that every single flavor on the menu was available. Why did you trick me like that? I really wanted the mango one. In the end, I got 2 of each (vanilla, chocolate and strawberry) for $11. My pick is 1) strawberry 2) vanilla 3) chocolate. Too bad, no mango. I guess I'll keep on checking back.
author: Cris C.

description: The line moved fast, the pate a choux was very tasty, but sadly the filling reminded me of a jello instant pudding. We only had the chocolate, so I do plan to try other flavors to see if they're better.
author: Dixon T.

description: I'd consider myself a fan of Beard Papa's cream puffs...just not a loyal enough fan to wait longer than 10 minutes for them.  Luckily,  I've never had to wait longer than that.  My favorite is the classic vanilla bean.  I've had the eclair, which is basically a vanilla cream puff with chocolate magic shell squirted on it.  The chocolate shell added another level of texture to the puff and cream layers that didn't really work for me.  The two flavors of the week (milk tea and caramel) I've had are pretty good, but they aren't the reason why I keep going back.
author: mandy f.

description: These puffs are giagantor! The cream in the puff is more like a pudding consistency that isn't too heavy. They only have 3 flavors: vanilla, chocolate and the eclair (which is just a vanilla puff covered in chocolate). I went online to find out that other Beard Papa's have green tea and earl grey tea cream custard flavors. Only if these flavors would also come to SF for a limited time! Just make certain to eat them fresh or the puff gets soggy.
author: Judy L.

description: Ah, the Japanese have done it again.  I ate one of these puffs after a wedding ceremony and before the reception.  Holy cow.  Now I know why the lines are so long.  These creme puffs aren't tiny creme puffs, but ones that are the size of a grown man's palm.  Filled with delicious goodness.  I heard that in Hong Kong they have red bean filled ones. yum.  Why can't we have this in Texas?  Next time I'm near a BP, I'm taking some home to freeze.
author: rosanna c.

description: I buy these chocolate eclairs with the choco or regular creme filling mostly for the novelty -- I really can't get these anywhere else with the same kitsch appeal.  They're definitely yummy, but not outta this world delicious.  My fave sweet indulgence still remains the red velvet cupcake with cream cheese - and that's one thing Beard Papa doesn't do!  When that day comes, maybe I'll add another star.
author: Vera D.

description: It tastes like they all do. Except this one is on the non sun facing side, so if you want to eat there, you have to sit in the dark and shade from the other buildings and the sun does not come out to warm you. Oh well, get it to go and go to the Yerba Buena park. The sun goes over there.
author: Andrew Y.

description: Yummy.  My friends buy and I eat.  I'm too lazy to drive and then wait in line.
author: Christopher D.

description: Yummmm!!! Their cream puffs are to die for delicious.
author: John C.

description:
beard papa- odd lil name that sorta encompasses the whole puff experience. you definitely see the japanese connection when you enter the store. its the hyper puff experience- order your quantity queue up and watch them take the fresh puff and squirt the vanilla custard center. the pie crust type exterior holds well, remaining crisp despite having the wet custard like filling inside.
raves- a six pack to go in the cute lil blue and yellow box will have people on the street asking you about the puffs. it also makes for great presentation when you are too tired to bake for the next potluck you attend. plus this dessert holds up pretty well if your biking.
bummers- not too sure if its the puff or hype that has people buzzin. gut tells me that its the next krispy kreme- fanatics and haters will join camps once the line isn't so long
tidbits- go in the early afternoon to avoid lines
author: CTP p.

description: Been hoping this place would show up around here for the longest time. First tried it out in NYC and was hooked ever since. It's all about the plain vanilla puff here. Something in the cream/vanilla filling makes it stand out from other cream puffs I've tasted. And according to Michells G. (03/29/2006) they've got a green tea filling now? Oh man, I'm there after work.
author: David G.

description: Stumbled across Beard Papa today, recalling all the hype I decided to try these so well marketed puffs. It was a bit after noon so most the office worker types were eating something substantial, I had a killer hangover so sugar was in order. I had a tough time deciding on eclair or vanilla puff. I'm a simple gal so opted for the latter, tho my interest was peaked by the green tea and pumpkin flavors it just didn't seem right to eat custards of that ilk. There was a few folks in 'line', because the staff, while friendly, are overly cautious. This gave me time to decide without freaking out and second guessing my choice. I found the little puff just delightful and am sure I will visit again when I need a fix.
author: Colleen B.

description:
just had to put my two cents in.

i like beard papa.  the line has never been TOO horribly long when i've stopped by, and i think it's worth a short wait.  the cream puffs are just tasty, period. a little pricey for what they are, but i don't mind spending the money on it whenever i'm in san francisco.
author: Katrina V.

description: Ok I finally made my way over here and this place is totally meh. I mean yeah they're tasty as far as tasty treats go but totally undeserving of the hoopla. If there was a line I would just keep on walking. The only thing I found marginally uplifting was the vanilla cream. Far superior to the chocolate cream but the puff itself was just ordinary in my opinion.
author: Cathy T.

description: Me and my friend came here after the football game yesterday and it was okay. The cream puffs actually have custard in them not whipped cream. I had an eclair and she tried the stawberry cream puff. Both were okay, we were expecting more because of all the hype. The french roast coffee and service was good. I would not come back for cream puffs.
author: Lorraine B.

description: Japanese people call those "shu-cream". Regardless, I've had a lot of those growing up and I'd say Beard Papa's stuff is pretty authentic. Good times. =)
author: Ryo S.

description:
oh my word!!!  total cream puff heaven.  let's just say if heaven does exist, these cream puffs would be its' own food group, fully approved by the FDA and they would be good for you, clear your skin, freshen your breath and build lean muscle mass. ok,  don't let the quirky old man logo a la gorton's fisherman fool you. no fish sticks here.   These dreamy cream puffs are oh so flaky and billowy, just chewy enough for a pastry and upon order they are freshly fornicated with the most creamy of centers.  yes, it's like the porn of cream puffs.  that's it.  
they are seriously a XXX SUPER treat.  and i know my treats.  :=)   (yes, that's a pig nose)
author: J P.

description: These cream puffs are better than good, perhaps they are great.  As with many great things, the buzz is sometimes better than the actual item.  Yes, these goodies are fresh.  Like Crispy Creme doughnuts though, if you don't eat them right away they lose a star.
author: Charlye W.

description: I LOVE BEARD PAPA'S!!! First time I had them were in Taipei, then (oddly enough) Boston, before actually trying them after they opened in the Bay Area. The cream inside has the perfect texture. Yuuuum.
author: Annie W.

description: This was the first Beard Papa I've been too. My boyfriend and I were spending a weekend in SF and on the last day, while walking and exploring, we came upon this place. GOOD GOD...GOOOODDD GODDDD. Best creampuffs EVER. They make 'em fresh right in front of you. They don't taste like those regular cream puffs you get at other bakeries, very distinct. Now everytime we or someone we're going to are in SF, they bring back a box (or two) of Beard Papa cream puffs!
author: Krystal N.

description: Good Cream Puffs.  The Lava Dessert was good.  They have their one year anniversary coming up Mid-May 2007 with special events & giveaways.
author: Atif Q.

description: The guy who gave me the puffs wasn't nice or friendly at all!! But them puffs are HELLA GOOD!! I had one, and bought my boss one, and gave the third one to my coworker. We felt so guilty afterwards. I went to the gym that night!! hahaha!!
author: Joanne D.

description: My initial reaction to a Beard Papa's cream puff was simply: "it just tastes like a cream puff." I'm no cream puff expert. I never loved cream puffs before. And I wasn't blown away the first time I bit into a BP cream puff. But a couple weeks later, I had a sudden craving. All I could think of was Beard Papa's. No cookie or cupcake or other baked item would do. MUST HAVE BEARD PAPA'S. I get the craze now.
author: Deb I.

description:
so good!! yum yum in my tum tum.  

I've stumbled across many positive BP reviews before I went to visit my fam in CA. So, I was thinkin, 'I gotta try one of these! I asked my cousin if she's had it before. (yes she has) Needless to say, she took me here. and OMG. these little cream puffs are excuisite!  I sure got my fill cause BP is not to be found in Michigan. That's why they lost a star. love/hate kinda thing.
author: Theresa U.

description: Wow!  That's all I can say...tried this for the first time and was thinking how can you make a cream puff better??  It was like alittle piece of heaven.  Very light puff pastry with a heavenly vanilla bean filling.  It's probably off the hook in calories but hey, it was so worth it.  This is a definate winner and must try!
author: Denny R.

description: It has been a year since I went to Beard Papa's and I still dream and talk about this place.  I wandered in here after a visit to the SFMOMA with a friend.  Now I can't say that I have ever been a big creme puff fan.  You usually get some slightly chewy flavorless pastry puff with boring whip creme inside.  But this-this is on a whole other level.  This was a perfectly crispy but soft on the inside puff with perfect light whipped creme inside and powdered sugar on the outside.  It was perfection.  And they have flavors, green tea, strawberry, chocolate, they rotate them, so you never get bored.  I dream of the day we get one here in Seattle!
author: Gretchen B.

description: There is no way you'll find the best cream puffs on earth looking for Yerba Buena Lane - make a note, it's on Mission. Even if you are thinking, huh? cream puffs?, if you like pastry at all, you will love these. The pastry shell is crispy and flaky, the filling is cool and creamy. Right now they only offer vanilla cream puffs, although the menu has many other items listed. I could have eaten 5, easily, because I am a glutton. The staff is super nice and friendly too.
author: Amy E.

description: mmm....deeeelish!   I Wish I would've never been introduced to these.  My whole office is hooked.
author: Leslie G.

description: Choux Factory in NYC is better. But it smelled wonderful and I'd like to try the milk tea one. The line did go fast, but the owner did warn us that there may not be enough to serve all of us (it was about to close), but my cousin & I made it through and enjoyed the custard puff treats. I'd have to agree with my good friend, Debbie Y. that its OK if anything.
author: Anita C.

description: If pumpkin is the week's flavor, do not even think about getting anything else. Vanilla to me is kind of blah, and the chocolate is one notch better. I've found that the flavor of the week is the way to go, and next to the pumpkin, the caramel is second best.  Man, when I got my hands on a pumpkin cream puff, I devoured the thing before I even took a single breath! I would stay away from the green tea puffs, though.
author: Tuyet N.

description: Yum!  I'm eating one right now.  Crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside.  The vanilla filling has vanilla bean seeds in it.    Not too sweet, just perfect.  Yum.  Yum!
author: MA f.

description: Oh with your soooo crispy golden puffs and your oh soooo creamy vanilla cream fillings!!  Talk about truth in advertising!! They claim to be the best cream puffs in the world!!! And you know what dang it they are!!!! If you havent tried them out, you are totally missing out.
author: Mark J.

description: Is it a cream puff or a custard sandwich? Ah, who cares when it's effing delish?
author: Maximillian M.

description: I wanted to followup and say that I went again, gave it one more try and the cream puffs were even grosser than I remembered.
author: n s.

description:
literally, what's not to love? i've been a fan since they gave me free ones when westfield shopping mall first opened and i wrote a news article about the food court (see where my loyalties lie?)
so ive been to this location at yerba buena and the westfield one, and this one is definitely a little more pleasant seeing the gardens are right across mission st and on a nice day you could pop over there and enjoy your cream puff or just stuff your face the second you get home... ...

i've only had the mango filling and vanilla filling in regular puff and cookie crunch puff. delicious. the cream filling is SO light and airy, the puff is almost flaky, but doesn't fall apart in some sort of mess (like a tartine croissant, not like that's a bad thing) and its just perfect. the combination is just great, i would go more if they had locations in more convenient locations (at least convenient for me)

oh and also, way better than pacific puff on union.
author: Kelly C.

description: I come here a lot. haha. my only complaint is that the special flavor seems to be caramel alot when i go there.  Seems like its too frequent.  Rotate the other flavors more please.
author: David C.

description: So excited, so excited, so excited...loved these guys in New York...can't wait for them to open in SF!
author: Tres S.

description: I'm not a fan of cream puffs usually, but these are delicious!  They're much bigger than normal cream puffs, and the filling is creamier (I think it's b/c they mix it up with whipped cream).  The vanilla is by far my favorite flavor.  A friend of mine brought some over for my birthday brunch, and they were a hit!  There is something novel about having a cream puff at 11 in the morning.  I love this whole Japanese company - they have sister companies in Japan that are incredible - I'm waiting for Choco Cro to come to the states - they have the perfect ratio of chocolate to fluffy, warm puff pastry in their chocolate croissants.  Mmm.....
author: Christina S.

description: This was a yummy experience!  Licking off the chocolate from my boyfriend's mouth and eating the strawberry puff was really fun!  We waited in line for about 45 minutes. By the time we arrived at the front cashier, we were suckered into buying the 6 pieces of goodies.   You can mix and match the pieces too.  My boyfriend had the double chocolate eclair which was oozing with chocolate, it was pretty good.  The location was interesting, next door to St. Patrick's church, what a great combo!
author: Carmen M.

description:
once i stepped in, i knew i was going to die of a heart attack.

the little vanilla cream puff i got was fabulous.  the cream was nice and fluffy, great texture, and not overly sweet.  

but the sick feeling afterward due to the fat-ness factor was not too great.
author: Amy Z.

description:
Wow I just found this on Yelp.....It looks great!!...I'm going right now!!!!!

It is as it appears....lots of butterfat!! who  Homer Simpson would be salvating just most of you are right now....
author: Roby R.

description: The green tea cream puffs are amazing!  I love this place.  Guess I went at a good time because there was no line, but by the time I got my order, the line was out the door.  I'll definitely be back.
author: Selene W.

description: The best Eclair"s I have ever had...absolutely perfect....I went to try 1 puff...I left with 3 boxes of goodies...best of all I barely had to wait at all.....
author: Dee D.

description:
Oh Beard Papa, how I love thee!!!! This place is the best. I mean really, they make cream puffs. They make the best cream puffs EVER. (Sorry mom) ;)
Simple and deliciously amazing, these cream puffs are on my mind daily!
author: Brian O.

description: The cream puffs are delicious.  My complaints would be that the puffs are a little pricey and the fanfare has overtaken the product.  Everyone should try them.  I really like the green tea flavor over vanilla though.  So I'm a little bummed by the fact that they don't offer a variety of flavors at a given time.
author: Shaquille O.

description: When I see that the special of the week is Caramel or Pumpkin, I just go crazy.
author: Lisa R.

description: Delicious heaven.  I loved beard papa so much the first time I had one, that I bought a couple dozen to share with everyone in the office.  I was the most popular person in the office that week.  The pastry is flaky, the cream filling is light and not too sweet.  I love the green tea, the pumpkin (which is usually available around the holidays), and of course, the original flavor, vanilla.  Haven't had the chocolate but I've heard they're to die for.  If you haven't tried it, you must, at least once.  I love them so much that when I made a trip to my hometown, NYC, in February, I directed all my friends and family there.  It's a must.
author: Magdalena ..

description: hum Japanese franchise hoping to be the new Krispie Kream of cream puffs? well, $150-$300,000 gets you in the game for yummy, addictive chocolate, matcha green tea and vanilla cream puffs..caloric wealth.....wow. Papa  ...papa...papa...hige papa no cream puffy puffy
author: miriam b.

description: I have seen the glory of freamy pastry goodness, and it was born at Beard Papas.  While i haven't been in and experienced waiting in line, i'm tempted to go in today as a reviewer has posted about the molten chocolate cake. i'm going to need to pick one up and update my review later based on store experience.
author: Pete D.

description: This place is a for desertaholic. Perrier water with a chocolate brownie puff - my personal choice. But for a dessert frenzie - vast selection! My ultimate wish is to try one of each on the menu. It's located right across from Metreon in the alley, up the stairs.
author: Anya B.

description: A little too sweet for me and the pastry not as rich as I would like.
author: Carolyn T.

description:
atmosphere: 4
puffs: 5!

i ROVE cream puffs! plus they use custard-- none of this cream crap. For me, the custard is key. Their staple vanilla bean is yum. Not a fan of the milk tea. It smelled and tasted like.. well milk tea. not my cup, thanks.

There is some seating inside, but may as well walk across the street to the Yerba Beuna gardens and enjoy your puffs in (hopefully) nice weather!
author: Miss C.

description: On spare the air days I happily ride the BART all the way from Union City to Powell street to order a pack of 6 to take home. As always I order 3 of the weekly special and 3 vanilla. I can never resist the temptation to eat one before I hop on the BART... so I do. These are great, but I just wish there was one closer to me.
author: Henry Y.

description: Yummy! These cream puffs were so good. I purchased  2 Vanilla Bean cream puffs for $1.75ea and 2 Strawberry cream puffs (flavor of the week) for $2.10ea. Both flavors were really good. They are light and not too sweet. Great dessert for a cheap price.
author: Cupcake s.

description: Delicious!!!!!  So light and tasty!  The best thing about the cream puffs is that they are not too sweet.  Too much sweetness kills a lot of the desserts out there.  But with Papa's, its just perfect, and yet you don't feel weighed down after eating a coupe of these cream puffs.  Shoot writing about them makes me want to get one right now!
author: Frank N.

description: First off the logo looks like Santa Claus expect for the yellow cap and is smoking a pipe so I guess Santa goes to eat cream puffs and smokes when the holiday season is not around,  Anyways, I have never really ate cream puffs before I stepped in here.  But after trying the chocolate cream puff, I am kinda hooked going over here since its by my work.  The vanilla ones are cool and also the caramel but the chocolate is the cream of the crop, no pun intended.
author: Kris A.

description: I remember trying my cousin's left over chocolate cream puff's from here. When I took a bite...I thought I was in heaven. Flaky crust after each bite and a delicious not so sweet chocolate filling, I'm bound to wanna get some more here! Best damn cream puff I ever had, highly recommend it!
author: Sean E.

description: Beard Papa probably has the best cream puffs!  The cream puffs are great to have at office meetings, weddings, parties or even just for yourself to munch on.  My favorites are the Green Tea, Vanilla Bean and Chocolate!  Also try the Fondant Au Chocolat and the Eclairs!  This is definitely a good place to stop by for desserts!
author: JenJen W.

description: i like that they have some tables to let us finish the food there.
author: Freya-Loki O.

description: The puffs were light and fluffy and the cream was just right.  The cream is put in when you order.  I could only eat one though, so don't go too crazy and order a dozen ($20 bucks!)  I would only go again if I was going to be at the metreon.
author: Nagoo N.

description:
i still think it's a bit pricey for a piece of puff.
as for myself i'd prefer the cream sweeter. it's better to eat it cold.
author: Suki S.

description:
regarding the classic vanilla cream puffs...

i wish i never knew of this place.  the cream puffs are delicate and perfectly light (not to sweet) pastry cups wrapped around a slightly chilled custard chock full of vanilla bean creaminess with a little pastry hat on top.  

I think about them often...but i have only had them twice.
author: Lia W.

description: OMG!  These are the most amazing cream puffs on the planet.  Perfect light flaky crust and delicious custard inside, not too sweet, made fresh (so no mushy dough).  Amazing!  The vanilla is my fav. I'm glad they aren't close to me or I'd be huge. Yum!
author: Rebecca M.

description: yum! the first time i ever got my hands on one of the beard papa cream puffs...i knew i'd be in trouble. they are so addicting. i love that they have a special flavor of the week...pumpkin and green tea are my favorite.
author: Marjie T.

description:
will it be as cool after everyone's had one?  

I mean, think back to when haagen dahz ice cream came out.  who didn't love it?  who didn't evangelize it's divinity?

and now, where is haagen dahz?  likely only here, misspelled in one obscure reference on Yelp.
author: david b.

description: Cream Puffs like my momma used to make!  So good, so fresh.  I went on opening day and waited 2 and a half hours.  Was it worth it?  Ohh yeah.
author: Stephen C.

description: Hey Look, these things are really good and it isn't too hard to understand why people go crazy for them.  They're great and they're fun to share.  I feel the need to mention though, for all of the other certifiable cream-puff addicts out there, that beard papa doesn't quite reach the level of sublimity.  The freshness is great, but in my opinion, the cream is just too sweet .
author: Buckminster F.

description: I broke my vegan vow to try one and I was not dissapointed.  They are very heavy, though, so 1/2 of one is really enough for me.
author: Rhea S.

description:
Whoaaa... I think I just clogged my artery...

Beard Papa is soooo good. I love how their name has nothing to do with their cream puffs...

I've tried all the puffs flavor and still think the classic vanilla is my favorite. The special flavor of the week tends to be really sweet, although the milk tea and pumpkin are still good. I'm a bit disspointed with the green tea however, they're just too strong and sweet.

When in doubt, order the vanilla!
author: Tania R.

description: Let it be noted that the only other cream puffs I have ever eaten are the little ones you get in the frozen food section at Costco.  So maybe I've never had a "real"  cream puff before.  Well,  I discovered after going to Beard Papa (which for some reason I always call Papa Beard by accident), I LIKE CREAM PUFFS!  Now there's one in my home town too (Redwood City).  Too bad I'm moving to Santa Clara in a month!  I just might have to make the drive to get some yummy cream puffs every once in a while.
author: Diane W.

description: Beard Papa.  When I hear those words I think of the best tasting cream puff in da world! Yum feagin EE!
author: Kool G.

description:
this place is so utterly amazingly delicious. fortunately it's not near my house, otherwise i would be enormously fat and in constant diabetic shock. but once a month i figure is ok.  all i've ordered is the chocolate cream puff and it is satisfying in every way.


oh and they're open till 9pm usually. score!
author: adams l.

description: This store stays constantly busy selling cream puffs.  Just amazing.  I tried  'em, thought they were just okay and on the expensive side, and walked away thinking this place won't make it.   There must be one heck of a cream puff following.  Every time i walk by, there are more and more people in there...buying cream puffs!  Did I miss something?  What's in that filling?   Is there a prize in the center?  Are they endorsed by Oprah and Barrack?  Is this chain owned by Apple?
author: Christophe P.

description: Warning: Do not inhale the airborn powdered sugar while taking a bite or you will suddenly start sneezing with all that Beard Pappa goodness attached to your face.
author: David M.

description:
i came here once with a friend and we had the pumpkin cream puff... very filling... but there was not much flavor to it. i'd order something else besides pumpkin if i am to visit again. 
cream puff was fun to eat. all that creaminess spread around your fingers making a mess all over your face...
author: Court L.

description: The freshly filled vanilla cream puff is a cool puff of magical bliss. Take a bite and you'll think you're on cloud nine.
author: Sue G.

description: Pretty darn good cream puffs, but still doesn't beat Bijan's Bakery cream puffs. I like how they do offer different flavors for cream puff, but nothing beats the original.
author: T Is For Tom N.

description: A line out the door for cream puffs, you've go to be kidding right?  Wrong...after the first bite I realized why everyone was waiting for these sweet treats.  That crispy outside and sweet whipped cream custard are totally worth the wait.  I'm just glad I don't live closer because I'd be eating them all the time.
author: Ryan I.

description: Everytime I go shopping in Westfield, Beard Papa's cream puffs are a MUST! I love how they would put the cream in after you would order, unlike some other places where the cream would be stuffed in already. The cream puffs taste fresh, crispy ,and overall, great! I eaten their chocolate, vanilla, green tea, and tiramisu flavor. (Yeah, I know, that's A LOT!) My favorite was the vanilla flavor; can't go wrong with that! I can't wait to go back.
author: Sakura c.

description: I came to this spot about 2-3 days after it opened at this location. I got a tip from my sister who said one of their clients brought a box of their famous cream puffs. She screamed and said "Auggghhh it was sooo good sis, you gotta try it!", so off I went during lunch break and was a bit amused on the see through counter where you can actually see the process of how it's made. I ordered The green tea (which by the way was flavor for that month). Gawwwd it was good!!! Price is a little over but well worth it. I'm over the vanilla but damn I will certainly come back for the green tea and mocha flavored cream puffs .. also the mini chocolate cake that had that gooey chocolate inside..yummy!! I'm a sweet tooth gal and I love my cream puffs!!! I come whenever i am in the city..so glad they just open one in Berkeley on my neck of the woods but I have yet to visit. This one location can get really busy but considering it's been around for quite a while now, I guess the hype is over.
author: Ateh M.

description: After an iMax movie at the Metreon didn't work,  we decided to appease our post-crashed iMax selves by having something to eat. Lo and behold, the famous Beard Papa's was just around the corner. We definitely had to try it. I've had cream puffs before, but they were Spanish style cream puffs with a much harder crust, so I wanted to try something different. So after a 30 minute queue, windy 50s temperature and several whiny kids waiting for their cream puff, it was finally our turn. All I can say is...Oh my. Cream Puff heaven. Perfectly creamy whipped cream + custard filling plus a slightly crisp outer shell baked to puffy perfection, you can't just eat one. It's sinfully good that even if each puff oozes about 230 calories, or even if the wait is impossible, or even if there are a dozen kids pushing me and stepping on my toes to watch the bakers in action, (okay, fine, maybe not a dozen), I'd always still come back to this place for creamy puffy goodness.
author: Erika I.

description: I live in San Francisco but my first taste of Bread Papa was in NYC during a cold winter Christmas four years ago. This made it so memoriable. I am happy that San Francisco has Bread Papa. There are two Bread Papa stores in San Francisco and both of them are in SF downtown. Good stuff always need some efforts, parking is super difficult there. The cream puff in Bread Papa just reminded me off those mini ones sells in Cosco except they serve in warm and extra large in size. I love BPP...the original cream puff is the best. Yummy!
author: Vivian L.

description: When I finally decided to venture to Beard Papa's, the lines and craziness eventually died down. This would not have been the second time that a pastry has caused such a panic in the world. Four years ago, a Krispy Kreme opened up in suburban Milwaukee drawing thousands to the small parking lot. Police were called in to direct traffic and news choppers hovered over the newly constructed store to snap photos of all the hype. Kenny Rogers, in town for a concert, showed up to pledge his love for the donut. Which leads me to exclaim that after eating my first Beard Papa, I had to think that the tasty treat was not the best cream puff I ever had. Krispy Kreme may have made Milwaukeeans look like a bunch of hype-driven consumers, but Wisconsin does lay claim to one title, even a chain store cannot topple; best cream puff in the World. Each year during the Wisconsin State Fair, nearly 360,000 puffs are sold, an average of 57 per minute. They have been crafting this treat for nearly 85 years and it is hard to beat. The combination is two eclair-like shells filled with a whopping amount of sweet cream, NOT eclair custard like at Beard Papa's. My Papa cream puff was good, but it felt more like an eclair to me and in my tainted world of dairy and cows, you just don't mess with the undisputed champion of cream puffs. From now on Beard Papa's only sells eclairs to me.
author: Taylor P.

description: The creme puffs are yummy; we like the chocolate ones best.  However, we also tried the chocolate fondant - and it's just ok.  Stick with the creme puffs!
author: Paul C.

description: When I went they only had vanilla and it was disgusting. I guess if you want to put some fat on quickly this would be the place to go. My friend said he could eat a half dozen in one sitting. I could barely manage half of one.
author: Michael G.

description:
i never liked cream puffs. i only tried the ones from costco and todai.  

i like cream puffs now..but only beard papas.  my fav flavors are caramel and vanilla.

i dont care too much for the chocolate or pumpkin.
author: rien d.

description: for cream puffs that shit is good!i only wish they had more flavors, the menu is a little deceiving it seems like they have a lot to offer but in reality its vanilla chocolate and the flavor of the month. one thing peculiar is the company is japanese but the staff is all filipino. oh well sarap!anyways
author: brooke h.

description: this is the next krispy kreme. but better. watch out, i bet they're coming soon to a corner near you. the puffs are awesome. well made and not too sweet and also light. it doesn't feel like a filled chocolate bar. they're filling is velvety/ custard, not rich pudding-like. i can eat about 6 of them. i prefer the vanilla myself. the chocolate is so-so.
author: Raymond G.

description: went there on a wednesday at around 7:30, hardly any line and prompt service...only got to try chocolate and it was delicious!  wish i had one closer to where i live!  the normal flavors are vanilla and chocolate ($1.85 each).
author: Steven C.

description: i just started working right around the corner from this place, but have resisted the sweet aromas emanating from it for weeks.  last friday, i finally gave in to 2 basic vanilla cream puffs and was totally satisfied.  now i have to try every flavor!
author: Aggie R.

description: 4pm sweet tooth got your tummy growling?  Make your way down to Bear Papa's, but beware.  Once you try the cream puff nothing else will be able to satisfy a sweet tooth craving again!  I've only been there once, but since then I've been dreaming of pastry puffs filled with a variety of creams.  I'm dying to try the Green Tea Puff (weekly special only offered on certain days).  I shared the chocolate puff, which I thought was decadent and delicious, but I hear the vanilla is better.  If you don't like puffs of cream they have a chocolate lava cake and I heard it's even better than the puffs!
author: Howard G.

description: I recently went to Beard Papa's for the first time--so I went post-hype.  I thought the cream puffs were excellent.  Now, I should preface my comments with the fact that I generally do NOT like cream puffs and that I probably will not go back to Beard Papa's any time soon (since I do not like cream puffs).  But, if perchance I ever find that I am in the mood for cream puffs, I definitely will go back to Beard Papa's.  Although the cream puffs are a little pricey, they are (in my opinion) worth it.  Typically, cream puffs are refrigerated, which makes the outer bread casing cold and mushy.  What is more, cream puffs that have been pre-made are oftentimes are soggy since the cream has been languishing in the bread casings for a long time.  At Beard Papa's, they do not actually fill the cream puff until you order it.  (Quite literally, empty bread casings sit in a bin next to cream-dispensing machines.  When you order a cream puff, a worker takes an empty bread casing and then fills it.)  This ensures that, when you eat your cream puff, the bread casing will not be soggy.  As for the cream, it is phenomenal.  It is sweet, but not too sweet (I'm partial to desserts that are not too sweet), and it has a smooth, creamy texture.  Although I generally do not care for cream puffs, I'd have to say that this place serves the best of 'em.
author: Sophrosyne Y.

description: I first tried Beard Papa's when I was in Honolulu some years ago. It was the most delicious cream puffs I had ever tasted. My friend and I would buy a couple, eat them outside of the supermarket where it was located, and go back in and get a couple more. Repeat the cycle a few times. We thought about bringing some back to the mainland but didn't think it would survive (we'd either kill 'em before we left the hotel, or they'd rot on the 5 hour trip unrefrigerated, more than likely the former). Since they opened one up here in SF I was kinda excited to get my hands on these tasty treats. I am proud to say that I've only been there one time though. I really enjoy popping these suckers in my mouth, but it's really not good for me (gotta watch my food intake in my old age) so I try my best to avoid it. The inconvenience of getting to the location is enough to keep me away, but if I'm cruising the g-ride, I could easily stop by for sure. I mos def recommend it for those with better metabolism and not addicted to sweets like myself. It's my luck that there isn't one much closer to me or I'd be in big trouble...
author: Epicurious M.

description: They use REAL vanilla beans in their cream... nuff said.
author: Nicole W.

description: is not like what i expected :] but its just ok for a franchise cream puffs joint.. for 220 calories each, i rather eat something else :D
author: sherly A.

description: At $1.75 for a regular vanilla cream puff and nearly $2 for their specialty cream puffs (chocolate / caramel / strawberry, etc) Beard Papa is a once in a while sort of snack for me.  My bf just came back from Asia and was raving about the Beard Papas over there, so we decided to check out the new establishment in SF.  We each had a vanilla bean cream puff.  My first Beard Papa "experience."  After reading reviews on Yelp about this place,  I was so curious what the first bite would be like.  Light flaky pastry with a sweet but not too sweet creamy custard filling.  The little flecks of real vanilla bean were a nice touch.  While I thought the cream puff was tasty, I also didn't feel the urge to run back in the store and buy 12 more.  Plus by then, the line had grown, and I didn't love the cream puff enough to stand 30 min in the cold.  I give Beard Papa three stars...I've had better cream puffs in my lifetime, albeit made homemade from French cooks, but Beard Papa's is good too.   I'm curious what their green tea and pumpkin cream puffs taste like and would go back to check it out.
author: Swirls L.

description: I do love Beard Papas..and it apparently loves my stomach. The only thing I don't like is the $2.25. I've made cream puffs before (as a young child) and it's honestly not that hard...I need to go back to those olden days...but if I'm lazy, for $2.25 it can't be beat. My favorite flavor by far is the Vanilla Bean - not too sweet, just the perfect amount of cold fresh cream in my puff.
author: Jeannette L.

description: it's overrated.  the pastry shell was not good but the cream is actually quite good b/c you can taste the real vanilla beans - none of that generic perservative laden crap.  but yah, it wasn't worth the 1 hour wait in line.
author: Dorothy L.

description: came here on opening day, which may have been a mistake, but ya know what?  that was a damn tasty (and large) puff!  i need to go back and try the other flavors!
author: Jill k.

description: i love eclairs, and i really like beard papa's eclairs.  the chocolate is dark and decadent.  the filling is not too sweet and very light.  the actual puff isn't the best- but isn't the worst, i'd say it is fair to crunchy.  but put it together and you have a perfect little treat.  worth a long line?  depends on exactly how much you want to get back to work...
author: Samantha W.

description: Four stars for the product. I always like Beard Papas cream puffs. For me, it's hard to get  a cream puff wrong as long as the filling is yummy and the puff is fresh. Poor service is what took the star off my rating. An angry, impatient looking cashier with a lower lip piercing gave me this what-do-you-want-just-freakin-order-and-get-out kind of stare. Made me wonder what happened to customer service. I ordered my dozen cream puffs with great difficulty as the cashier was not very helpful and continued to give me a hateful stare. When I finished ordering, I realize I had forgotten to get a cup of coffee. But I decided against it because I didn't want to further upset the cashier. Instead, I went next door to the chocolate shop to get my java. I left Beard Papas disappointed that I had this kind of experience. I suppose it's a plus that I'm not usually in the area and I normally go to the SF shopping center one.
author: Royce L.

description: oHmIgOsH!! those little cream puffs are sooooo yummy & addictive. my husband  & i wandered into place on the way to the merry go round w/ our little guy. we got the cream puff w/ chocolate filling yUmMy!! we decided to try another w/ vanilla creme filling delicious. it was a good little sweet treat!!
author: Jo K.

description: it's an experience that's worth doing once. or maybe twice. but thrice is at least once too many! note that your puff will be cold (as the pudding would melt, duh), and your legs may be numb by the time you get through the line and up to the front. the chocolate ones are my favorite.
author: Bee H.

description: A friend raved about this place, so when I found myself in the neighborhood I picked up a box of the classic vanilla cream puffs. I've made cream puffs before, and I love an eggy-flavored shell, but these puffs were very nondescript, almost cardboard-like.  The vanilla custard was also pretty bland and disappointing, which surprised me because while waiting I read about how it takes 2 hours to make the custard and they use fresh Madagascar vanilla beans.  I really wouldn't recommend them and won't likely go back.
author: Kris C.

description: When they first opened, the puffs were gigantic, filled with lots of creme. After the opening in the Westfield center, they seem to have downsized in their puffs and the cream filling. LOVE the original vanilla bean and strawberry. Great tea is not bad, have not tried the other flavors besides chocolate (which is not my favorite). Tastes and looks fresh, and reasonably priced, except when you're craving for more and only have money for one! Wish they had this in BERKELEY!
author: Lily L.

description:
ill call beard papas my DADDY any effin day o' the WEEK.
allright. its just cream puffs you may say. whats so special? WELL ILL TELL YOU. these cream puffs are the size of 16 year old football prodigy's fists! ok. now lets get to some more refined details.
you get three styles o' puff. cookie crumb or something. eclair. or plain. i get the eclair cause well, its covered in chocolate yo!
there are typically three flavors of filling: vanilla, chocolate, or the flavor of the week. ive had em all and betterbelieveit that all are good. 
my favorite is the eclair with the pumpkin filling. it felt like i ate halloween the first time i tried it. several children were crying over the loss of their favorite holiday. fear not citizens! it just TASTES like halloween! 
oh and the chocolate fondant cake is delish. small and SuPeR rich chocolate snack. be sure to have 4 napkins at the ready.
nice location. simple set up. friendly staff.
takes about 10 seconds to get your puff. trust me in that you will want to buy another but really now...do you need all that cream and puff at 9 in the morning? 
hellyesyoudo.
eat here. support it. cream puffs are waves of the future.
and macaroons. but thats for a different yelp.
puff away, sf.
author: Spencer P.

description: i FINALLY made it to the beard papa's for cream puffs, b/c i happened to be in union square at 10:30 on a sunday morning, and who eats cream puffs at that hour?  i was the only customer in the store, which was GREAT.  right when you enter, the scent of baked dough wafts in the air.  the flavor of the week was pumpkin, which was really good!!  the cream puff is light and airy, and the cream is not super sweet.  perfect combo!
author: Helen T.

description: The other week, a co-worker of mine yelled LaShanda!  You want to go get some cream puffs???  Needless to say I was confused for a minute and wondering if he was actually trying to hit on me...   He made an appointment in my outlook calendar for us to go try this place and I said to myself, this has GOTS to be good stuff.  Hmmm...not so much.  When we went, there was only one option:  regular cream puff.  Everything else was labeled coming soon!   Ok, fine, they're just starting off.  Bring on the puff.  The dough was cooked to be light and airy and non-greasy which was nice, but I can't say it really tasted like anything?  Maybe some more sugar?  The cream filling was also lacking in flavor, there was too much of it, and it was really cold.  I would have preferred my puff to be warm and if not warm, at least room temperature.  Other people in the office raved and raved over the puffs but I really can't say that I'm a fan.
author: LaSha G.

description: really not all that exciting. i've had the cream puffs a few times, and enjoyed them, but just feel like they're an average pastry dough stuffed with pudding. but hey, if you're craving cream puffs, there's really no where else to go right? they're enjoyable, but just nothing to get excited about.
author: Steven L.

description: The cream puffs are highly addictive!  Made fresh, they are filled while you wait.  Chocolate and Vanilla Bean are my favorite, but there are daily flavors like Strawberry, Green Tea and Pumpkin.  They are a little expensive as a box of a dozen Cream Puffs are 22$.  They are a little over 2$ each.  Unfortunately I don't like their cheesecake sticks, which are pretty bland.  Their eclairs and chocolate cakes are ok, but the real stars are the cream puffs.  The coffee here is pretty good, the iced coffee is better.  The lines can be a little long here, so prepare to be patient.  The store is always immaculately clean.  There isn't much seating inside the store, but fortunately there's Yerba Buena Park across the street, and seating nearby infront of the Jewish Museum.  Of course outside there's plenty of pan handling to avoid and anyone sitting down enjoying a pastry is seen as an easy target.
author: Michael D.

description: a great sweet snack.  they're just like the homemade cream puffs my sister makes, and i love.  so they're not super original, but if you don't want to go through the trouble at home, just pick up a box here.  i will give them credit for the delicious cream filling, it's like a lighter version of creme brulee, which adds to the guilt of eating the evil cream puff.
author: cat c.

description: I happened upon this place when I was walking back towards downtown after having dinner at Thirsty Bear with a friend. The smell of this place drew me in and has had me since then. I've tried their daily special cream puffs, but the original and chocolate cream puffs are still the best. To top things off, I'd definitely go with an eclair if I'm in the mood to indulge (which I always do). The eclair is basically a cream puff covered with chocolate. Must I say, this is DELICIOUS. The cheese sticks aren't too impressive, but still not bad if you're in the mood (but then I'd just go to the cheesecake factory which is just a couple blocks away). The chocolate lava cake is absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS. They would ask you if you want to eat it right away, or would like to bring it home. If you'd like to eat it right away, they would pop it into the microwave for 10 seconds and when you dive into the cake, the warm molten chocolate center oozes out in all its goodness. It's just the perfect ending to a great meal or a night in the city.
author: Fanny C.

description: I'm so screwed.  This place is within easy walking distance of my work.  If you're a fiend for pumpkin oriented desserts, their pumpkin cream puff won't let you down.
author: John D.

description: I wish I could say that I detest Beard Papa's Cream Puffs--that my taste for sweets is far more discriminating than to like a silly little cream puff--but truth be told, I rather like the things.  Rather like them quite a lot.  They're not like anything I've had before (certainly not like those azuki-filled eclairs I loathe), which is, in this case, a good thing.  It's also a good thing they're what I'd call a health food.
author: Hannah J.

description: cream puffs are ok but i like the cream puffs you get from the mexican bakeries way better.    the green tea ones look like soylent green so that's sort of cool.  in hong kong they serve one called the "Black Puff" but i didnt look more closely to see what it was.
author: X X.

description: yum!!!!!  go cream puffs go.  i was just at one of the nyc beard papa's this weekend and was so excited to learn that there is a new location here in sf!  and yes, that is all you will get at this place.  traditional japanese cream puffs that is...your choice of vanilla custard, chocolate, green tea and more.  don't wait...go now!!  and buy a couple extra for the road....
author: Michelle G.

description: The cream puffs may be worth the wait, but the hype should die down soon...it's carb-overload but the vanilla creme middle is worth it...and the flaky crust...superb.
author: Hannah H.

description: I'm not a big fan of cream puffs, but Beard Papa's have a batter for the uh...puff? that is really light and crispy. I personally like the regular cream puff better than the chocolate cream, yet I don't deny licking the paper clean after both of their consumptions. If you aren't down with finding cream on your face an hour later, then you can use the forks and knives to cut them up. (You'll be missing out on all the fun though!)
author: Tami H.

description: not too sweet and just the right amount of cream to go with the perfectly baked pastry shell.  you can't beat it for $1.75
author: michelle k.

description: ok, admittedly, the hype drew me in and i stopped by this place on my way from the MOMA. the vanilla pastries coupled with a cold handle of milk totally put in the mood. the cheesesticks were also good (the BFF did not like), but my question is: what the hell is up with always being out of strawberry?? i've tried the seasonals more than the strawberry, and for anyone who knows me, all ends right at that red berry. beard papa seriously gets one star off for not having it every time i go.
author: Jenz y.

description: I dream about the plain vanilla cream puffs.  They have to be eaten same day...doesn't keep well over night...gets soggy.
author: LT B.

description: tasty, but i can't imagine wanting to eat these things more than once every 6 months to a year. thank god i don't live near one, otherwise i might need one every 1 to 3 months.
author: Renee L.

description: MMMmmmm... this place was delicious. I heard about it from a friend who's been to Japan, which is where they are famous. All I have to say is that I loved it, but you have to eat it right away or it doesn't taste as good. Only thing was, that it wasn't hot. I think it would taste even better if they gave it to you at least warm.
author: Connie W.

description: Yummy yummy cream puffs. The pastry was just delightful and the filling was not overpowering. The major down side to the visit was the wait. But watching the workers actually fill cream puffs and powdering them with sugar helps pass the time.
author: Tara C.

description: i'd like to share my experience along with the other 190 reviews here, not that's it's a fascinating experience at all.  i was walking over to a friend's place when i saw all the fun blue and yellow balloons out front.  i thought it was some kind of cal thing.  hah.  anyway, it turned out to be the very second day of opening for this place.  recognizing the fisherman guy logo and seizing the opportunity that there were hardly any people in line, i bought one dozen puffs on the spot.  i waited maybe 10 minutes tops.  the longest part was them actually filling the puffs, since no one else was buying a dozen.  i still have the cute box.  it was the vanilla flavored cream... and oh so good.  i must've ate one a day for the next four days (i like moderation).  i think the sweetness is just right, not too sweet and very delicate.  maybe even a tad too much filling cuz it just oozes in the middle.  even the crust has a nice amount of chew.  doesn't really last more than three days though.  later i tried the chocolate, but i like the vanilla better.  i have yet to try the other flavors.  i'd never wait 45 minutes for this place like my other crazy friends.
author: Em C.

description: i was looking around yelp and found that this was one of the most reviewed places. i HAD TO go and get me a cream puff. so on a time schedule i went to the bank got me some money and then went to beard papa's for some cream puffs. i have to say i wasn't so impressed. don't get me wrong they were good but they weren't great. i got there and the wait wasn't long but the people working there walked away from me as i was about to place my order. they finally gave me my puffs but i noticed for some reason they skipped over people who were behind me. not bad for me but i felt bad. the chocolate cream puffs were chalky and i kinda choked on the ovaltine like powder on top when i inhaled it a little. when i got home i realized that they forgot to put the powdered sugar on my vanilla puffs. so very disappointed. i expected more. the vanilla puff was good but could have been better with the powder. will try it again.
author: Bee C.
